defines.trans_en: a single unit of language that has meaning and can be spoken or written

examples.ch: 你的论文不应超过2000词。
examples.en: Your essay should be no more than two thousand words long.

examples.ch: 有些词比其他的词难拼写。
examples.en: Some words are more difficult to spell than others.

examples.ch: 法语中的“比基尼”怎么说？
examples.en: What's the word for bikini in French?

examples.ch: 有时很难找到恰当的词来表达你想说的意思。
examples.en: It's sometimes difficult to find exactly the right word to express what you want to say.

defines.trans_en: a short discussion or statement

examples.ch: 经理想谈一谈。
examples.en: The manager wants a word.

examples.ch: 我能（和你）就销售数字谈一谈吗？
examples.en: Could I have a word (with you) about the sales figures?

examples.ch: 或许你可以和气地向迈克解释一下这件事。
examples.en: Could you have a quiet word with Mike (= gently explain to him) about the problem?

defines.trans_en: news or a message

examples.ch: 自从保罗去纽约之后，你听到过他的消息吗？
examples.en: Has there been any word from Paul since he went to New York?

examples.ch: 我们从以前的一个同事那里得知了他们的计划。
examples.en: We got word of their plan from a former colleague.

examples.ch: 关于这项新发现的消息在天文学家当中引起了轰动。
examples.en: Word of the discovery caused a stir among astronomers.

defines.trans_en: a promise

examples.ch: 我说过要去拜访他，我得说话算数。
examples.en: I said I'd visit him and I will keep my word.

examples.ch: 我保证——我不会告诉别人。
examples.en: You have my word - I won't tell a soul.

defines.trans_en: an order

examples.ch: 我们正在等待总部的命令，之后才会发表声明。
examples.en: We're waiting for the word from head office before making a statement.

examples.ch: 指挥官一下令，部队就会立即行动起来。
examples.en: The troops will go into action as soon as their commander gives the word.

examples.ch: 老师一下命令，孩子们就开始收拾起他们的书来。
examples.en: At a word from their teacher, the children started to put away their books.

phrases.trans_ch: 那个以F开头的词／以C开头的词（通常是粗鲁或令人难堪的词，只说出该词的第一个字母来指代）
phrases.trans_en: used to refer to a word, usually a rude or embarrassing one, by saying only the first letter and not the whole word

examples.ch: 在美国的电视上仍然不允许说那个以F开头的词。
examples.en: You're still not allowed to say the F-word on TV in the US

examples.ch: 节食进行得怎么样——也许你不愿意让我提那个以D开头的词。
examples.en: So how's the diet going - or would you rather I didn't mention the d-word?

phrases.trans_en: angry words

examples.ch: 两名参赛者在比赛后发生了争吵。
examples.en: Both competitors had words (= argued) after the match.

examples.ch: 人们吵架了，然后有人打了一拳。
examples.en: Words were exchanged (= people argued) and then someone threw a punch.

phrases.trans_en: discussion, rather than action

examples.ch: 恐怕到目前为止，提供儿童保育的问题更多地停留在讨论层面上，而较少付诸实施。
examples.en: So far there have been more words than action on the matter of childcare provision.

phrases.trans_en: to talk to each other for a short time

examples.ch: 我们走出会议室时匆匆交谈了几句。
examples.en: We exchanged a few words as we were coming out of the meeting.

phrases.trans_ch: （表示赞同或支持某人或某事的）好话
phrases.trans_en: a statement of approval and support for someone or something

examples.ch: 你见了队长能不能替我说句好话？
examples.en: If you see the captain could you put in a good word for me?

examples.ch: 评论家们把这场演出说得一无是处。
examples.en: The critics didn't have a good word to say about the performance.

defines.trans_en: to choose the words you use when you are saying or writing something

examples.ch: 他在回答中的措词表明他不承认原来犯的错误。
examples.en: He worded the reply in such a way that he did not admit making the original error.

defines.trans_en: used especially in questions as the subject or object of a verb, when asking which person or people, or when asking what someone's name is

examples.ch: 这是谁做的？
examples.en: Who did this?

examples.ch: 她是谁？
examples.en: Who's she?

examples.ch: 那些人是谁？
examples.en: Who are all those people?

examples.ch: 她问我是否知道谁获得了那份工作。
examples.en: She asked me if I knew who had got the job.

examples.ch: 您要找哪位？
examples.en: Who (also formal whom) do you want to talk to?

examples.ch: 我不知道该邀请谁参加聚会。
examples.en: I don't know who to ask to the party.

defines.trans_ch: （与表示“知道”的动词连用，表示不知道）
defines.trans_en: used with verbs that relate to knowing, when you want to say that something is not known

examples.ch: “他们是要结婚了吗？”“谁知道呢。”
examples.en: "Are they going to get married?" "Who knows?" (= It is not possible to know at the moment.)

examples.ch: 谁知道会发生什么呢？
examples.en: Who can tell what will happen now?

defines.trans_ch: （用作动词的主语或宾语，表示所提及的人，或附加所提及的人的信息）
defines.trans_en: used as the subject or object of a verb to show which person you are referring to, or to add information about a person just mentioned. It is used for people, not things

examples.ch: 我觉得打电话的人是你爸爸。
examples.en: I think it was your dad who phoned.

examples.ch: 她是那种喜欢引人注意的人。
examples.en: She's one of those people who love to be the centre of attention.

examples.ch: 他打电话给詹姆斯，詹姆斯既是家庭医生又是他的好朋友。
examples.en: He called James, who was a good friend as well as the family doctor.

examples.ch: 住在这所房子里的其他人十分友好。
examples.en: The other people who (also that) live in the house are really friendly.

examples.ch: 这是加布里埃尔，我跟你说起过他。
examples.en: This is Gabriel, who I told you about.

defines.trans_ch: 世界卫生组织（the World Health Organization的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for
the World Health Organization
(on) the present day

examples.ch: 今天几号？
examples.en: What's the date today?

examples.ch: 他今天某个时候要给你打电话。
examples.en: He's going to call you at some point today.

examples.ch: 今天甚至比昨天还热！
examples.en: Today is even hotter than yesterday!

examples.ch: 那是今天的报纸吗？
examples.en: Is that today's paper?

examples.ch: 他一个星期后的今天回来。
examples.en: He should be back today a week today (= one week from today).

defines.trans_en: used more generally to mean the present time

examples.ch: 现在人们比过去更关注自己的健康。
examples.en: Today, people are much more concerned about their health than they were in the past.

examples.ch: 有了今天的技术，似乎一切皆有可能。
examples.en: With today's technology almost anything seems possible.

examples.ch: 如今的年轻人不知道他们有多幸运。
examples.en: The youth of today don't know how lucky they are.

defines.trans_en: in need of rest or sleep

examples.ch: 我昨晚下班回家后很累，就小睡了一会儿。
examples.en: I was so tired when I got home from work last night that I had a quick nap.

examples.ch: 我的腿酸了。
examples.en: My legs are tired.

examples.ch: 她说话有气无力的。
examples.en: She spoke in a tired voice.

defines.trans_ch: （人、想法或话题）老套乏味的，令人生厌的
defines.trans_en: used to describe people, ideas, or subjects that are not interesting because they are very familiar

examples.ch: 在这些会上总是些不变的令人生厌的老面孔。
examples.en: It's always the same tired old faces at these meetings.

defines.trans_en: feeling or showing a need to rest or sleep

phrases.trans_en: to be bored with an activity or person

examples.ch: 我厌倦了日复一日地做同样的工作。
examples.en: I'm so tired of doing the same job, day after day.

examples.ch: 老吵架你们不觉得累吗？
examples.en: Don't you get tired of arguing all the time?

examples.ch: 我很烦你老是对我该做什么指手画脚。
examples.en: I'm sick and tired of you telling me what to do all the time.

defines.trans_en: feeling or showing a need to rest or sleep
someone whose job is to teach in a school or college

defines.trans_ch: （讨论、考虑或研究的）主题，话题;问题;题目
defines.trans_en: the thing that is being discussed, considered, or studied

examples.ch: 我们讨论的话题是无家可归问题。
examples.en: Our subject for discussion is homelessness.

examples.ch: 她拍摄了一系列以家庭关系为题材的纪录片。
examples.en: She has made a series of documentaries on the subject of family relationships.

examples.ch: 特邀演讲人演讲的题目是“现代社会的刑罚与监禁”。
examples.en: The guest lecturer took as her subject (= decided to speak about) "punishment and imprisonment in modern society".

examples.ch: 自去年夏天开始，从小镇上空飞过的飞机数量一直让人们忐忑不安。
examples.en: The number of planes flying over the town has been the subject of (= has caused) concern since last summer.

defines.trans_ch: （中小学或大学的）学科;科目;专业
defines.trans_en: an area of knowledge that is studied in school, college, or university

examples.ch: 上学时我最喜欢的科目是历史和地理。
examples.en: My favourite subjects at school were history and English.

examples.ch: 她的专业是低温物理学。
examples.en: Her subject (= special area of study) is low-temperature physics.

defines.trans_en: a person, thing, or situation that is written about in a book, article, etc. or shown in a picture, etc.

examples.ch: 桥边磨坊是特纳一副未完成油画的主题。
examples.en: The mill by the bridge was the subject of an unfinished painting by J. M. W. Turner.

defines.trans_en: the person or thing that performs the action of a verb, or is joined to a description by a verb

examples.ch: Bob 是句子 Bob threw the ball 的主语。
examples.en: "Bob" is the subject of the sentence "Bob threw the ball."

defines.trans_ch: （尤指君主制国家的）臣民，国民
defines.trans_en: a person who lives in or who has the right to live in a particular country, especially a country with a king or queen

examples.ch: 他是英国臣民。
examples.en: He is a British subject.

phrases.trans_en: to start talking about a different subject

examples.ch: 我想把情况解释清楚，他却岔开了话题。
examples.en: I'd tried to explain the situation, but he just changed the subject.

defines.trans_en: to defeat people or a country and then control them against their wishes and limit their freedom

examples.ch: 入侵者很快就征服了当地的部落。
examples.en: The invaders quickly subjected the local tribes.

defines.trans_en: under the political control of another country or state

examples.ch: 被征服的民族／国家
examples.en: subject peoples/states

phrases.trans_en: to have or experience a particular thing, especially something unpleasant

examples.ch: 买汽车要交很高的国内税。
examples.en: Cars are subject to a high domestic tax.

examples.ch: 近年来，她一直饱受抑郁症的折磨。
examples.en: In recent years, she has been subject to attacks of depression.

phrases.trans_en: only able to happen if something else happens

examples.ch: 如果你同意，我们打算周三走。
examples.en: We plan to go on Wednesday, subject to your approval.

examples.ch: 如果有足够的人手，把所有的书都搬走花不了多少时间。
examples.en: Moving all the books should not take long, subject to there being (= if there are) enough helpers.

defines.trans_en: strongly limiting someone's freedom to behave as they wish, or likely to severely punish someone if they do not obey

examples.ch: 我小的时候父母对我要求非常严格。
examples.en: My parents were very strict with me when I was young.

examples.ch: 加强对空气污染的控制将会有助于减少酸雨。
examples.en: Stricter controls on air pollution would help to reduce acid rain.

examples.ch: 从黄昏到黎明实行了严格的宵禁。
examples.en: A strict curfew has been imposed from dusk till dawn.

examples.ch: 对电脑上个人资料的使用和存储，我们遵循极为严格的规定。
examples.en: We follow very strict guidelines on the use and storage of personal details on computers.

examples.ch: 你认为制定更为严格的枪械法律会降低美国谋杀案的发生率吗？
examples.en: Do you think stricter gun laws would reduce the murder rate in the United States?

examples.ch: 这种药只有在医生严格的指导下才能使用。
examples.en: The drug should only be administered under strict medical supervision.

examples.ch: 谈判在高度保密的情况下进行。
examples.en: The negotiations took place in strict (= total) secrecy.

defines.trans_ch: 精确的，完全正确的；严谨的
defines.trans_en: exactly correct

examples.ch: 紧扣原文的翻译
examples.en: a strict translation of the text

examples.ch: 按照对法律的严谨阐释，他会被判有罪。
examples.en: He would be found guilty under a strict interpretation of the law.

defines.trans_ch: 恪守信条的，严格遵循（某种生活方式）的；不折不扣的；（信条或原则）必须恪守的
defines.trans_en: used to refer to someone who follows the rules and principles of a belief or way of living very carefully and exactly, or a belief or principle that is followed very carefully and exactly

examples.ch: 他的父母是恪守教规的天主教徒。
examples.en: His parents were strict Catholics.

examples.ch: 她是个不折不扣的素食主义者，任何禽类和鱼类都不吃。
examples.en: She's a strict vegetarian and refuses to eat any poultry or fish.

phrases.trans_en: in the most limited meaning of a word, phrase, etc.

examples.ch: 严格意义上说这些不是葬礼，看不到棺材也没有遗体。
examples.en: These were not funerals in the strict sense of the word; there were no caskets or physical remains.

examples.ch: 小农经济严格来说算不上“自给自足”。
examples.en: This peasant economy should not be considered "subsistence" in a strict sense.

defines.trans_en: very, extremely, or to such a degree

examples.ch: 这房子太漂亮了！
examples.en: The house is so beautiful.

examples.ch: 谢谢你这么耐心。
examples.en: Thank you for being so patient.

examples.ch: 不要这么傻了！
examples.en: Don't be so stupid!

examples.ch: 我不知道她有这么多孩子！
examples.en: I didn't know she had so many children!

examples.ch: 你只能帮忙到这个地步。
examples.en: You can only do so much to help (= there is a limit to how much you can help).

examples.ch: 她向来这样和蔼可亲。
examples.en: She's ever so kind and nice.

examples.ch: 我太累了，连坐在这椅子上都能睡着！
examples.en: I'm so tired (that) I could sleep in this chair!

examples.ch: 我并不急着非同意不可。
examples.en: I'm not so desperate as to agree to that.

examples.ch: 这个词本身就十分罕见，几乎要被淘汰了。
examples.en: The word itself is so rare as to be almost obsolete.

defines.trans_ch: （用在名词或 not 前表示强调）
defines.trans_en: used before a noun or before "not" to emphasize what is being said

examples.ch: 别穿那个了——去年才流行那个呢，现在早过时了。
examples.en: Don't wear that - it's so last year (= it was fashionable last year but not now).

examples.ch: 对不起，但适合她的尺码绝对要比10号大很多。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but she is so not a size 10 (= she is very much larger than a size 10).

defines.trans_en: used at the end of a sentence to mean to a very great degree

examples.ch: 这就是你如此痛恨他的原因吗？
examples.en: Is that why you hate him so?

examples.ch: 你太多虑了！
examples.en: You worry so!

defines.trans_ch: （通常用于 have，be，do 等助动词前）同样，像这样
defines.trans_en: used usually before the verbs "have", "be", or "do", and other auxiliary verbs to express the meaning "in the same way" or "in a similar way"

examples.ch: “我有很多很多工作要做。”“我也一样。”
examples.en: "I've got an enormous amount of work to do." "So have I."

examples.ch: “我对坚果过敏。”“我弟弟也是。”
examples.en: "I'm allergic to nuts." "So is my brother."

examples.ch: 尼尔午夜刚过就走了，罗兹也走了。
examples.en: Neil left just after midnight and so did Roz.

examples.ch: 就像你喜欢和小伙子晚上出去一样，我偶尔也喜欢和女孩子一起出去。
examples.en: Just as you like to have a night out with the lads, so I like to go out with the girls now and again.

defines.trans_ch: （用于代替先前提到的短语以避免重复）这样，如此
defines.trans_en: used to avoid repeating a phrase mentioned earlier

examples.ch: “我希望他们在一起。”“我也希望如此。”
examples.en: "I hope they stay together." "I hope so too."

examples.ch: “你认为他不高兴了吗？”“我想没有。”
examples.en: "Do you think he's upset?" "I don't think so."

examples.ch: 詹姆斯今晚要来，至少他是这么说的。
examples.en: James is coming tonight, or so he said.

defines.trans_en: used to say that a situation mentioned earlier is correct or true

examples.ch: “我们今年真的不会加薪吗？”“恐怕是这样的。”
examples.en: "Is it true that we're not getting a pay increase this year?" "I'm afraid so."

examples.ch: “安东尼和米娅相处得不怎么好。”“真是那样吗？”
examples.en: "Anthony and Mia don't get along very well." "Is that so?"

examples.ch: “天气预报说可能要下雨。”“如果真是那样的话，我们就在室内聚会。”
examples.en: "The forecast says it might rain." "If so, we'll have the party inside."

defines.trans_en: used to say that a fact that has just been stated is certainly true

examples.ch: “我两眼的颜色略有差别。”“的确如此。”
examples.en: "My eyes are slightly different colours." "So they are."

examples.ch: “那是她弟弟——看上去像詹姆斯•迪恩。”“的确如此。”
examples.en: "That's her brother - he looks like James Dean." "So he does."

defines.trans_ch: （用于代替已提到过的形容词以避免重复）
defines.trans_en: used instead of repeating an adjective that has already been mentioned

examples.ch: 她是个能与之共事的人——比人们告诉我的要好。
examples.en: She's reasonable to work with - more so than I was led to believe.

examples.ch: 他挺聪明的——嗯，绝对比他弟弟聪明。
examples.en: He's fairly bright - well, certainly more so than his brother.

defines.trans_en: used, especially by children, to argue against a negative statement

examples.ch: “你根本没有看过这部电影。”“我就是看过！”
examples.en: "You didn't even see the movie." "I did so!"

defines.trans_en: in this way, or like this

examples.ch: 建筑物外面的柱子如此排列是为了能提供最大的室内空间。
examples.en: The pillars, which are outside the building, are so placed in order to provide the maximum space inside.

examples.ch: 我这样安排自己的旅程就能在星期五晚上到家。
examples.en: I've so arranged my trip that I'll be home on Friday night.

defines.trans_en: used when you are showing how something is done

examples.ch: 把这张纸反折，就这样，在这儿折一条痕。
examples.en: Just fold this piece of paper back, so, and make a crease here.

examples.ch: 就这样轻轻拌入鸡蛋。
examples.en: Gently fold in the eggs like so.

defines.trans_en: used when you are representing the size of something

examples.ch: “他到你哪儿？”“哦，大约这么高。”她在自己的脖子上比划了一下说道。
examples.en: "How tall is he next to you?" "Oh, about so big," she said, indicating the level of her neck.

examples.ch: “我最喜欢的桌子大约有这么宽。”她说着，张开双臂至一米半的间距。
examples.en: "The table that I liked best was about so wide," she said, holding her arms out a metre and a half.

phrases.trans_en: to act in the way mentioned

examples.ch: 父母必须为他们的子女负责，如果不这样的话可能意味着罚款或监禁。
examples.en: Parents must take responsibility for their children. Failure to do so could mean a fine or a jail sentence.

defines.trans_ch: （放在句首，表示和已说过或已发生过的事相联系）如此，这样，那么
defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of a sentence to connect it with something that has been said or has happened previously

examples.ch: 就这样，我站在路边，只穿着内衣……
examples.en: So, there I was standing at the edge of the road with only my underwear on ...

examples.ch: 那么，就把我刚才所说的内容讲完……
examples.en: So, just to finish what I was saying earlier...

defines.trans_en: used as a way of making certain that you or someone else understand something correctly, often when you are repeating the important points of a plan

examples.ch: 这么说，我们星期四出发，下一个星期二回来，对吗？
examples.en: So we leave on the Thursday and get back the next Tuesday, is that right?

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a discovery that you have just made

examples.ch: 那就是我不在的时候他所干的事！
examples.en: So that's what he does when I'm not around!

defines.trans_ch: （表示停顿，有时用于强调所说的内容）
defines.trans_en: used as a short pause, sometimes to emphasize what you are saying

examples.ch: 瞧，我们又在一起了——就你和我。
examples.en: So, here we are again - just you and me.

defines.trans_ch: （表示引出谈话内容，尤用于提问）那么
defines.trans_en: used before you introduce a subject of conversation that is of present interest, especially when you are asking a question

examples.ch: 那么，你认为谁会赢得大选？
examples.en: So, who do you think is going to win the election?

defines.trans_ch: （表示某人所说的内容并不重要）是呀，没错
defines.trans_en: used to show that you agree with something that someone has just said, but you do not think that it is important

examples.ch: 没错，这辆车的确很贵——可我买得起。
examples.en: So the car's expensive - well, I can afford it.

defines.trans_en: and for that reason; therefore

examples.ch: 我的膝盖开始疼痛，因此我停下来不再跑了。
examples.en: My knee started hurting so I stopped running.

examples.ch: 我迷路了，所以买了一张街道地图。
examples.en: I was lost so I bought a street map.

defines.trans_en: used before you give an explanation for the action that you have just mentioned

examples.ch: 我特意没吃午饭，为的就是让自己今晚能感到饿。
examples.en: I deliberately didn't have lunch so (that) I would be hungry tonight.

examples.ch: 把钥匙放在外面，好让我记得带。
examples.en: Leave the keys out so (that) I remember to take them with me.

phrases.trans_en: in order to

examples.ch: 我总是把水果放在冰箱里，以防虫子叮咬。
examples.en: I always keep fruit in the fridge so as to keep flies off it.

phrases.trans_en: in order not to

examples.ch: 为了不打扰她，他没有开灯。
examples.en: He did not switch on the light so as not to disturb her.

phrases.trans_ch: 非常整齐的，井井有条的
phrases.trans_en: perfectly tidy and well arranged

examples.ch: 他是个完美主义者——一切都必须是一丝不乱的。
examples.en: He's a perfectionist - everything has to be just so.

defines.trans_ch: 索（大调音阶的第五音，同 soh）
defines.trans_en:
the musical note 
soh

defines.trans_ch: 科学;自然科学;科学知识
defines.trans_en: (knowledge from) the careful study of the structure and behaviour of the physical world, especially by watching, measuring, and doing experiments, and the development of theories to describe the results of these activities

examples.ch: 纯／应用科学
examples.en: pure/applied science

examples.ch: 科学技术的最新发展
examples.en: recent developments in science and technology

examples.ch: 太空遨游是现代科学的一大奇迹。
examples.en: Space travel is one of the marvels/wonders of modern science.

defines.trans_en: a particular subject that is studied using scientific methods

examples.ch: 物理学
examples.en: physical sciences

examples.ch: 经济学严格说并不是一门科学。
examples.en: Economics is not an exact science.

examples.ch: 医学的发展
examples.en: advances in medical science

defines.trans_en: the study of science

examples.ch: 理科研究生／教师
examples.en: a science graduate/teacherteacher

examples.ch: 理科课程／课
examples.en: a science course/lesson

defines.trans_en: a person or organization you are closely involved with in some way

examples.ch: 他在搭档被杀后辞去了警官的工作。
examples.en: He gave up his job as a police officer after his partner was killed.

examples.ch: 这两家公司订立合同，共同建造一座新的工厂。
examples.en: The two companies are partners in a contract to build the new factory.

defines.trans_en: one of the owners of a company

examples.ch: 他是一家保险公司／律师事务所的合伙人。
examples.en: He's a partner in an insurance company/a law firm.

defines.trans_en: the person you are married to or living with as if married to them, or the person you are having a sexual relationship with

examples.ch: 我已经邀请戴维及其伴侣共进晚餐。
examples.en: I've invited David and his partner over for dinner.

defines.trans_en: one of a pair of dancers or one of a pair who are playing a sport or a game together, especially when the pair are playing as a team

defines.trans_ch: （在体育运动、游戏或舞蹈中）同（某人）合作，与（某人）成为搭档
defines.trans_en: to act as someone's partner in a sport, game, dance, or activity, or to choose someone to do this

examples.ch: 他说泰迪是他合作过的最好的球员。
examples.en: He said that Teddy was the best player he had ever partnered.

examples.ch: 保罗在舞蹈课上与劳拉搭档，然后他们坠入了爱河。
examples.en: Paul partnered with Laura during a dance class and they fell in love.

examples.ch: 每个有听障的学生都有一名助听员与其合作。
examples.en: Each hearing-impaired student is partnered with a hearing helper.

defines.trans_en: to join with another person or organization in a business activity

examples.ch: 他们与一家创业投资公司合伙成立了阿玛达滑雪用品公司。
examples.en: They partnered with a British venture capital firm and formed Armada Skis.

examples.ch: 三家公司合伙购买十九万三千英亩土地。
examples.en: Three companies partnered to purchase 193,000 acres of land.

defines.trans_ch: 下一个的；其次的；紧接着的
defines.trans_en: being the first one after the present one or after the one just mentioned

examples.ch: 谁在你隔壁的办公室工作？
examples.en: Who works in the office next to yours?

examples.ch: 在下一个路口向右拐。
examples.en: Take the next street on the right.

examples.ch: 你认为谁将出任下届总统？
examples.en: Who do you think will be the next president?

examples.ch: 这里并没有什么实质性的变化，天天差不多都是一个样儿。
examples.en: Nothing really changes around here. One day is pretty much like the next.

examples.ch: 下次你想借东西的话，请先问问我。
examples.en: (The) next time you want to borrow something, please ask me first.

examples.ch: 我忙得经常记不清下一步该做什么。
examples.en: I'm so busy it's hard to remember what I'm supposed to be doing from one minute to the next.

examples.ch: 接下来几天她休假。
examples.en: She's away for the next few days.

examples.ch: 你得等到下一个生日才会收到新自行车。
examples.en: You'll have to wait until your next birthday for a new bike.

examples.ch: 我们安排下下周开会可以吗？
examples.en: Can we arrange a meeting for the week after next?

examples.ch: 你认为明年这个时候你会在做什么？
examples.en: What do you think you'll be doing this time next year?

examples.ch: 我们发生了激烈的争吵，不过第二天他就打电话向我道歉了。
examples.en: We had a big argument, but he called me the next day (= the day after) to apologize.

examples.ch: 对不起，轮到我了——我是下一个。
examples.en: Excuse me, it's my turn - I was next.

defines.trans_en: immediately after

examples.ch: 那后来怎么样了？
examples.en: So what happened next?

examples.ch: 你还喜欢什么？
examples.en: What would you like next?

examples.ch: 先炒一下大蒜，再加生姜。
examples.en: First, fry the garlic. Next, add the ginger.

defines.trans_en: The time when you next do something is the first time you do it again

examples.ch: 你下次什么时候去多伦多？
examples.en: When are you next going to Toronto?

phrases.trans_en: used when describing two people or things that are very close to each other with nothing between them

examples.ch: 我可以靠窗坐吗？
examples.en: Can I sit next to the window?

examples.ch: 在车站有一个很古怪的男人站在我旁边。
examples.en: There was a really strange man standing next to me at the train station.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于作出选择或比较时）仅次于，在…之后
phrases.trans_en: used to mean `after' when making a choice or a comparison

examples.ch: 奶酪是我最喜欢的食品，其次是巧克力。
examples.en: Cheese is my favourite food and, next to that, chocolate. (= Cheese is the only food that I like more than chocolate.)

phrases.trans_en: almost

examples.ch: 他们没付给我多少钱，但我实在喜欢那工作。
examples.en: They pay me next to nothing (= very little) but I really enjoy the work.

examples.ch: 要在这附近找到廉价的住处极其困难。
examples.en: It's next to impossible (= extremely difficult) to find somewhere cheap to live around here.

examples.ch: 我们很快就到家了。
examples.en: We got home in next to no time (= very little time).

phrases.trans_en: next in order to appear or happen, often in some form of entertainment

examples.ch: 接下来要播出的是总统竞选活动的最新消息。
examples.en: Next up is the latest news from the presidential campaign .

defines.trans_ch: 寿命;生命;一生，人生;生活;性命
defines.trans_en: the period between birth and death, or the experience or state of being alive

examples.ch: 人生短暂，何必为金钱而烦恼！
examples.en: Life's too short to worry about money!

examples.ch: 我不能肯定自己是否愿意与他共度余生。
examples.en: I'm not sure I want to spend the rest of my life with him.

examples.ch: 不幸的是，意外事故也是生活的一部分。
examples.en: Unfortunately, accidents are part of life.

examples.ch: 他在生命走向终了时疯掉了。
examples.en: He went mad towards the end of his life.

examples.ch: 据说猫有九命。
examples.en: Cats are supposed to have nine lives.

examples.ch: 他不知道自己在生活中真正想要的是什么。
examples.en: He doesn't know what he really wants in/out of life.

examples.ch: 那场事故彻底改变了我对人生的看法。
examples.en: The accident changed my whole outlook on life.

examples.ch: 他在一战中丧生。
examples.en: He lost his life (= died suddenly because of a violent event or accident) in the Great War.

examples.ch: 在世界上很多地方，把葡萄糖和水混合在一起就可以用来拯救人的性命。
examples.en: A simple mixture of glucose and water can save lives in many parts of the world.

examples.ch: 他带着她毕生的积蓄跑掉了。
examples.en: He ran off with her life savings (= all the money she had saved).

defines.trans_ch: 生活方式;生活（的某一部分）
defines.trans_en: a way of living or a particular part of someone's life

examples.ch: 她的家庭／个人／性生活
examples.en: her family/private/sex life

examples.ch: 我的职业生涯
examples.en: my working life

examples.ch: 我们采访了资深政界人士、著名作家等公众人物。
examples.en: We interviewed senior politicians, famous writers, and others in public life.

examples.ch: 毒品和暴力在美国社会生活中已经根深蒂固。
examples.en: Drugs and violence are deeply rooted in American life.

examples.ch: 我16岁离家出去闯荡世界。
examples.en: I left home at 16 to see life (= have different experiences with a lot of people in lots of places).

examples.ch: 教书已成为了她的生命。
examples.en: Teaching has been her life (= the most important and enjoyable thing in her life).

defines.trans_en: the period for which a machine or organization lasts

examples.ch: 新一代电池的寿命要长得多。
examples.en: The newer batteries have a much longer life.

examples.ch: 小心使用会延长机器的寿命。
examples.en: Careful use will prolong the life of your machine.

examples.ch: 该项立法在当前议会的任期内不会获得通过。
examples.en: The legislation won't be passed during the life of the present parliament.

defines.trans_en: the quality that makes people, animals, and plants different from objects, substances, and things that are dead

examples.ch: 医生发现老人已经没有了生命迹象。
examples.en: The doctor could find no sign of life in the old man's body.

examples.ch: 我透过窗子向外望去，却看不到有任何人类活动的迹象。
examples.en: I looked through the window but I couldn't see any signs of life (= people moving).

defines.trans_en: energy or enthusiasm

examples.ch: 她充满了活力。
examples.en: She's so full of life.

defines.trans_en: everything that is alive

examples.ch: 人类／海洋生物／植物
examples.en: human/marine/plant life

defines.trans_en: In art, if you work from life, you paint, draw, etc. real people or objects, usually while they are in front of you rather than from memory.

examples.ch: 写生课
examples.en: life drawing classes

defines.trans_ch: （尤指儿童游戏中的）一次机会;命
defines.trans_en: especially in children's games, one of the limited number of times that you can lose, but still continue playing

examples.ch: 小人儿每被击中一次，你就丢了一条命。
examples.en: Every time the little man gets hit, you lose a life.

phrases.trans_en: to make something more real or exciting

examples.ch: 这段历史总是令人饶有兴味，这部电影对此进行了真实的再现。
examples.en: It's always been an interesting period in history and this film really brought it to life.

phrases.trans_ch: 使更加实在；使更有生机
phrases.trans_en: to become more real or exciting

examples.ch: 比赛下半场有了生机。
examples.en: The game really came to life in the second half.

phrases.trans_en: for the whole of a person's life

examples.ch: 我相信婚姻是一辈子的事情。
examples.en: I believe marriage is for life.

phrases.trans_en: to be willing to die in order to defend or support someone or something

examples.ch: 他们已做好了为国捐躯的准备。
examples.en: They were ready to give their lives for their country.

phrases.trans_en: If you believe in life after death, you believe that people continue to exist in some form after they die.
to completely change how or where you live

examples.ch: 她决定在澳大利亚开始新的生活。
examples.en: She decided to start a new life in Australia.

defines.trans_en: an activity that someone does for pleasure when they are not working

examples.ch: 安吉拉的业余爱好是修复老爷摩托车。
examples.en: Angela's hobby is restoring vintage motorcycles.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指当作宠物或用来打猎、看护的）狗，犬
defines.trans_en: a common animal with four legs, especially kept by people as a pet or to hunt or guard things

examples.ch: 我的宠物狗
examples.en: my pet dog

examples.ch: 野狗
examples.en: wild dogs

examples.ch: 狗粮
examples.en: dog food

examples.ch: 我们可以听到远处的狗叫声。
examples.en: We could hear dogs barking in the distance.

defines.trans_ch: 讨厌的家伙，惹人烦的家伙;失信者
defines.trans_en: a man who is unpleasant or not to be trusted

examples.ch: 这个无赖，他想偷我的钱。
examples.en: He tried to steal my money, the dirty dog.

defines.trans_en: a woman who is not attractive
to follow someone closely and continuously

examples.ch: 记者们跟着他让他回答问题。
examples.en: Reporters dogged him for answers.

defines.trans_en: to cause difficulties

examples.ch: 技术问题从旅行一开始就一直困扰着我们。
examples.en: Technical problems dogged our trip from the outset.

defines.trans_en: something that tells you what something or someone is like

examples.ch: 描述一下你最喜欢的海滨胜地。
examples.en: Write a description of your favourite beach.

examples.ch: 她向警察详细描述了抢劫者的相貌。
examples.en: She has given the police a very detailed/full description of the robber.

examples.ch: 有人在格拉斯哥发现一个女孩，相貌特征符合对失踪少女的描述。
examples.en: A girl answering (= matching) the description of the missing teenager was spotted in Glasgow.

examples.ch: 你的文章描述性内容太多，而对问题的讨论不够。
examples.en: Your paper contains too much description, and not enough discussion of the issues.

phrases.trans_en: of all types

examples.ch: 各种各样的船只正在驶入港湾。
examples.en: Boats of every description were entering the harbour.

phrases.trans_en: to be something that you cannot describe accurately because of its great size, quality, or level

examples.ch: 她的美无与伦比。
examples.en: Her beauty is beyond description.

examples.ch: 巴特的房间乱得难以形容！
examples.en: The mess in Bart's room defies description (= is very bad)!

defines.trans_en: a father

examples.ch: 爸，今天晚上聚会后你能不能接我回家？
examples.en: Can you pick me up from the party tonight, Dad?

examples.ch: 很高兴昨天晚上在音乐会上见到你爸妈。
examples.en: It was great to see your mum and dad at the concert last night.

defines.trans_en: a large town

examples.ch: 世界上许多城市的人口超过500万。
examples.en: Many of the world's cities have populations of more than five million.

examples.ch: 惠灵顿是新西兰首都。
examples.en: Wellington is the capital city (= centre of government) of New Zealand.

defines.trans_en: any town in the UK that has a cathedral (= large, important church)

examples.ch: 伊利市有大约1万5千居民。
examples.en: The city of Ely has about 15,000 inhabitants.

defines.trans_en: the government of a city

examples.ch: 维护人行道是市政府的责任。
examples.en: It's the city's responsibility to maintain the pavements.

examples.ch: 我父亲为市政府工作。
examples.en: My father works for the city.

phrases.trans_en: the business centre of London where the large financial organizations are, such as the Bank of England

examples.ch: 他在伦敦商业中心上班。
examples.en: He works in the City.

examples.ch: 伦敦商业区分析师
examples.en: a City analyst

phrases.trans_en: the financial organizations as a group and the people who work for them

examples.ch: 金融界对英镑下跌的消息迅速作出反应。
examples.en: The City acted swiftly to the news of a fall in the value of sterling.

defines.trans_en: If you are busy, you are working hard, or giving your attention to a particular thing.

examples.ch: 妈妈在厨房里忙着呢。
examples.en: Mum was busy in the kitchen.

examples.ch: 孩子们在忙着做家庭作业。
examples.en: The kids are busy with their homework.

examples.ch: 她在忙着写婚礼请柬。
examples.en: She's busy writing out the wedding invitations.

examples.ch: 我有很多工作，够你忙活的。
examples.en: I've got plenty of jobs to keep you busy.

examples.ch: 他忙着说话没有注意到我们进来。
examples.en: He was too busy talking to notice us come in.

defines.trans_en: A busy place is full of activity or people.

examples.ch: 繁忙的餐馆
examples.en: a busy restaurant

examples.ch: 他们的房子临近热闹的马路。
examples.en: Their house is near a very busy road.

defines.trans_en: In a busy period, you have a lot of things to do.

examples.ch: 我未来的一周会很忙。
examples.en: I have a busy week ahead of me.

examples.ch: 你忙了一天了。
examples.en: You've had a busy day.

defines.trans_en: If a phone line is busy, someone is using it.

examples.ch: 我试过给你打电话，可是电话占线。
examples.en: I tried calling you but the line was busy.

defines.trans_ch: 繁琐的，杂乱的；使人眼花缭乱的
defines.trans_en: having too much decoration or too many colours

examples.ch: 对我来说，这件夹克太花哨了——我喜欢简单一点的。
examples.en: The jacket was a bit too busy for my tastes - I'd prefer something plainer.

phrases.trans_en: to make the time pass by doing something

examples.ch: 我整理书桌来打发时间。
examples.en: I busied myself with tidying up my desk.

defines.trans_en: the scientific study of the natural processes of living things

examples.ch: 人类生物学
examples.en: human biology

examples.ch: 海洋生物学
examples.en: marine biology

examples.ch: 分子生物学
examples.en: molecular biology

examples.ch: 此书讲述的是野牛的生殖习性。
examples.en: The book deals with the reproductive biology of the buffalo.

defines.trans_en: at or during a time earlier than (the thing mentioned)

examples.ch: 饭前应该洗手。
examples.en: You should always wash your hands before meals.

examples.ch: 走前他和每个人都告了别。
examples.en: Before leaving he said goodbye to each of them.

examples.ch: 她总是黎明前就起床了。
examples.en: She's always up before dawn.

examples.ch: 他还没走到门前她就迅速关上了门。
examples.en: Before he could reach the door, she quickly closed it.

examples.ch: 趁我们还未作决定，还有人想说什么吗？
examples.en: Before we make a decision, does anyone want to say anything else?

examples.ch: 她得给看门人小费，好让他帮她提箱子。
examples.en: She had to give the doorman a tip before he would help her with her suitcases (= he would not do it until she had given him a tip).

defines.trans_en: until (the event mentioned)

examples.ch: 警察一小时后才赶到。
examples.en: It was an hour before the police arrived.

defines.trans_en: in the past

examples.ch: 他说他以前从没见过她。
examples.en: He said he had never seen her before.

examples.ch: 我感觉好像以前来过这儿。
examples.en: I feel as though I've been here before.

defines.trans_en: in front of

examples.ch: 在英语字母表中，K排在L前面。
examples.en: The letter K comes before L in the English alphabet.

examples.ch: 许多母亲都把孩子的需要置于自己的需要之前。
examples.en: Many mothers put their children's needs before their own.

examples.ch: 我们有整个周末的时间——做些什么呢？
examples.en: We have the whole weekend before us - what do you want to do?

examples.ch: 他在满屋子人面前站起来向她求婚。
examples.en: He stood up before a whole roomful of people, and asked her to marry him.

defines.trans_en: If a place is before another place, you will arrive at it first when you are travelling towards the second place.

examples.ch: 公共汽车站就在学校前面一点。
examples.en: The bus stop is just before the school.

defines.trans_en: If something is before someone or before a group of people, it will be formally considered or examined by that person or group.

examples.ch: 委员会正在考虑我们打算降低10%开支的建议。
examples.en: The proposal before the committee is that we try and reduce our spending by ten percent.

examples.ch: 这些人昨天出庭了。
examples.en: The men appeared before the judge yesterday.

defines.trans_en: for the reason that

examples.ch: “你为什么做这事？”“因为卡洛斯叫我去做的。”
examples.en: "Why did you do it?" "Because Carlos told me to".

examples.ch: 我们不能参加朱莉娅的聚会，因为那个周末我们要外出。
examples.en: We can't go to Julia's party because we're going away that weekend.

examples.ch: 我今晚把裙子借给你，但并不意味着你任何时候想借就可以借的。
examples.en: Just because I'm lending you my dress for tonight doesn't mean you can borrow it whenever you want to.

examples.ch: 最近我们没有见过你，你是不是外出了？
examples.en: Where've you been, because (= the reason I am asking is that) we haven't seen you recently?

defines.trans_en: to put a question to someone, or to request an answer from someone

examples.ch: 她问了我一个问题。
examples.en: She asked me a question.

examples.ch: 她问了一个有关威尔士历史的问题。
examples.en: She asked a question about Welsh history.

examples.ch: 她问我有关威尔士历史的问题。
examples.en: She asked me about Welsh history.

examples.ch: 她问了有关威尔士历史的问题。
examples.en: She asked about Welsh history.

examples.ch: 我不知道火车什么时候开，问问列车长是否知道。
examples.en: I've no idea what time the train leaves. Ask the guard whether he knows.

examples.ch: 我问了问列车长火车的离站时间。
examples.en: I asked the guard the time of the train's departure.

examples.ch: 我问了问火车什么时候开。
examples.en: I asked when the train would leave.

examples.ch: “火车什么时候开？”我问道。
examples.en: "What time does the train leave?" I asked.

defines.trans_en: to speak or write to someone saying that you want them to do something, to give you something, or to allow you to do something

examples.ch: 如果有需要帮忙的地方，请尽管说。
examples.en: If you need any help, please don't hesitate to ask.

examples.ch: 她问（经理）自己是否可以提早离开去接孩子。
examples.en: She asked (her manager) if/whether she could leave early to pick up the kids.

examples.ch: 我要求见我的会计师。
examples.en: I asked to see my accountant.

examples.ch: 你应该（向你的会计师）征求财务方面的建议。
examples.en: You should ask (your accountant) for some financial advice.

examples.ch: 你应该让你的会计师给你一些财务方面的建议。
examples.en: You should ask your accountant to give you some financial advice.

examples.ch: 你可以帮我个忙吗？
examples.en: Can I ask you a favour?/formal Can I ask a favour of you?

examples.ch: 我遇到一个财务方面的问题，想听听你的建议／意见。
examples.en: I'd like to ask your advice/opinion on a financial matter.

examples.ch: 你必须征得许可方能离开。
examples.en: You have to ask permission to leave.

examples.ch: 我们要求凡有质量问题的货物都装回原包装内退回。
examples.en: We ask that any faulty goods be returned in their original packaging.

examples.ch: 律师要求允许她的当事人打个电话。
examples.en: The solicitor asked that her client be allowed to make a phone call.

defines.trans_en: to request or invite someone to go somewhere with you or to come to your home

examples.ch: 我已经邀请了戴维参加聚会。
examples.en: I've asked David to the party.

examples.ch: 我已经邀请了戴维来参加聚会。
examples.en: I've asked David to come to the party.

examples.ch: “你去参加缪里尔的聚会吗？”“不，我没有接到邀请。”
examples.en: "Are you going to Muriel's party?" "No, I haven't been asked."

examples.ch: 豪尔赫邀请我们下星期五共进晚餐。
examples.en: Jorge has asked us over for dinner next Friday.

examples.ch: 伊恩请我们下周五去吃晚饭。
examples.en: Ian's asked us round to/for dinner next Friday.

examples.ch: 实际上他们请我们过去呆上整个周末。
examples.en: In fact they've asked us to stay for the whole weekend.

defines.trans_en: to expect or demand something

examples.ch: 格雷格的房子要价25万英镑。
examples.en: Greg's asking (= expecting to be paid) £250,000 for his house.

examples.ch: 他对我的要求太过分了——我不能总在那里帮他吧。
examples.en: He asks too much of me - I can't always be there to help him.

examples.ch: 如果你的老板想让你晚上加班，周末也工作，那就太过分了。
examples.en: It's asking a lot when your boss wants you to work weekends as well as evenings.

phrases.trans_en: to consider something carefully

examples.ch: 她应当好好想想为什么好像没有人喜欢她。
examples.en: She needs to ask herself why nobody seems to like her.

defines.trans_ch: 四处，周围；围绕，（环）绕；掉转
defines.trans_en: in a position or direction surrounding, or in a direction going along the edge of or from one part to another (of)

examples.ch: 我们围着桌子坐着。
examples.en: We sat around the table.

examples.ch: 他用胳膊搂着她。
examples.en: He put his arm around her.

examples.ch: 事故现场围了一群人。
examples.en: A crowd had gathered around the scene of the accident.

examples.ch: 她脖子上围了一条围巾。
examples.en: She had a scarf around her neck.

examples.ch: 月亮围绕地球转。
examples.en: The moon goes around the earth.

examples.ch: 我从楼的一侧绕了过去。
examples.en: I walked around the side of the building.

examples.ch: 公共汽车开动时，她转过身来向我们挥手告别。
examples.en: As the bus left, she turned around (= so that she was facing in the opposite direction) and waved goodbye to us.

examples.ch: 他把轮子装对了／安反了。
examples.en: He put the wheel on the right/wrong way around (= facing the right/wrong way).

examples.ch: 孩子们在房间里来回跳舞。
examples.en: The children were dancing around the room.

examples.ch: 我用了一年时间周游了非洲和亚洲。
examples.en: I spent a year travelling around Africa and Asia.

examples.ch: 这个博物馆的馆藏包括来自世界各地的艺术品。
examples.en: The museum's collection includes works of art from all around the world.

examples.ch: 她端出一盘饼干让大家传着分享。
examples.en: She passed a plate of biscuits around (= from one person to another).

examples.ch: 这种病毒已经传播开来。
examples.en: This virus has been going around (= from one person to another).

defines.trans_ch: （在…）附近，在（…）近处；到处，四处；随便
defines.trans_en: positioned or moving in or near a place, often without a clear direction, purpose, or order

examples.ch: 他总是随手把衣服（往地板上）一扔。
examples.en: He always leaves his clothes lying around (on the floor).

examples.ch: 她进了城，四处转悠了两个小时。
examples.en: She went into town and spent two hours just walking around.

examples.ch: 我们把孩子们带到公园去让他们到处跑跑吧。
examples.en: Let's take the children to the park so they can run around for a while.

examples.ch: 过去我就住在这一带。
examples.en: I used to live around (= near) here.

examples.ch: 你用得着她的时候，她就没影了。
examples.en: She's never around (= near here) when you need her.

examples.ch: 你下周在吗？
examples.en: Will you be around next week?

examples.ch: 现在流感肆虐。
examples.en: There's a lot of flu around (= a lot of people have it) at the moment.

examples.ch: 智能手机问世已经有一段时间了。
examples.en: Smartphones have been around (= existed) for quite a while.

defines.trans_en: approximately

examples.ch: 大约6英尺高
examples.en: around six feet tall

examples.ch: 大约两个月前
examples.en: around two months ago

examples.ch: 4点左右
examples.en: around four o'clock

examples.ch: 她一年大约挣4万美元。
examples.en: She earns around $40,000 a year.

defines.trans_en: some, or even the smallest amount or number of

examples.ch: 柠檬蛋糕有没有剩下点儿啊？
examples.en: Is there any of that lemon cake left?

examples.ch: 我们到那儿的时候，几乎一点吃的都没了。
examples.en: There was hardly any food left by the time we got there.

examples.ch: “还有黄油吗？我要用点。”“没了，人造黄油还有些，但是黄油一点都没有了。”
examples.en: "Is there some butter I could use?" "No, there's some margarine but there isn't any butter."

examples.ch: “还有汤吗？”“抱歉，一点都没了。”
examples.en: "Is there any more soup?" "No, I'm afraid there isn't any left."

examples.ch: 他的电影我一部都没看过。
examples.en: I haven't seen any of his movies.

examples.ch: 我希望他再也不要给我们添任何麻烦了。
examples.en: I don't expect we'll have any more trouble from him.

examples.ch: 我只有参加婚礼才会去教堂。
examples.en: I go to church for weddings but not for any other reason.

examples.ch: 你肯定这问题没有任何解决办法了？
examples.en: Are you sure there isn't any way of solving this problem?

defines.trans_en: one of or each of a particular type of person or thing when it is not important which

examples.ch: 只要有点吃的，就比没有强。
examples.en: Any food would be better than nothing at all.

examples.ch: “我可以吃哪块蛋糕？”“哪块都行。”
examples.en: "Which of these cakes may I eat?" "Any."

examples.ch: 商家提供的优惠是，花30英镑可任选3件你喜欢的服装。
examples.en: The offer was that you could have any three items of clothing you liked for $30.

examples.ch: 星期天我是抓着哪件衣服就穿哪件。
examples.en: On Sundays I just wear any old thing (= anything) that I happen to find lying around.

examples.ch: 你们随便哪个都应该能回答这个问题。
examples.en: Any of you should be able to answer this question.

examples.ch: 任何人只要懂点起码的法语，都能在巴黎预订一个旅馆房间。
examples.en: Any idiot with a basic knowledge of French should be able to book a hotel room in Paris.

examples.ch: 你给我什么建议我都会感激不尽。
examples.en: Any advice (= whatever advice) that you can give me would be greatly appreciated.

examples.ch: 他们两个随时都会大吵一场。
examples.en: Any minute/day/time now (= very soon) there's going to be a massive quarrel between those two.

examples.ch: 展览会上有很多电脑，无论哪一台都会非常适合我用。
examples.en: There were a lot of computers at the exhibition, any (one) of which would have suited me perfectly.

defines.trans_en: at all or in the least

examples.ch: 你不能再跑快一点吗？
examples.en: Can't you run any faster?

examples.ch: 那条裤子看起来和其他裤子没什么两样。
examples.en: Those trousers don't look any different from the others.

examples.ch: 你病愈后感觉身体好些了吗？
examples.en: Are you feeling any better after your illness?

examples.ch: 以前这一地区的房价非常低廉，但是现在可不便宜了。
examples.en: Houses in this area used to be a real bargain, but they're not cheap any more (= now).

examples.ch: 这台收音机根本不好用，我还得再买一台。
examples.en: This radio isn't any good (= it's useless) - I'll have to buy another.

examples.ch: 我以前每天都步行去上班，但是现在不了。
examples.en: I used to walk to work every day, but not any longer (= not now).

examples.ch: 我极力想劝阻他，但根本无济于事，他还是离家而去。
examples.en: I tried talking him out of it, but that didn't help any - he still left home.

defines.trans_en: the day of the week after Tuesday and before Thursday

examples.ch: 你是说会议在星期三开吗？
examples.en: Did you say the meeting is on Wednesday?

examples.ch: 那家餐馆总是在星期三歇业。
examples.en: The restaurant is always closed on Wednesdays.

examples.ch: 下个星期三是我的生日。
examples.en: Next Wednesday is my birthday.

examples.ch: 我上周三没有去学校。
examples.en: I didn't go to school last Wednesday.

examples.ch: 4月29日是一个星期三。
examples.en: 29 April is a Wednesday.

examples.ch: 星期三早上／下午／傍晚／晚上
examples.en: Wednesday morning/afternoon/evening/night

defines.trans_en: the day of the week after Monday and before Wednesday

examples.ch: 我们周二8点见。
examples.en: We'll meet at eight on Tuesday.

examples.ch: 我们总是在星期二见。
examples.en: We always meet on Tuesdays.

examples.ch: 这项工作必须截止在下星期二完成。
examples.en: The work has to be finished by next Tuesday.

examples.ch: 你上星期二在哪里？
examples.en: Where were you last Tuesday?

examples.ch: 29号是星期二，对吧？
examples.en: The 29th is a Tuesday, isn't it?

examples.ch: 星期二上午／下午／傍晚／晚上
examples.en: Tuesday morning/afternoon/evening/night

defines.trans_en: the day of the week after Wednesday and before Friday

examples.ch: 星期四下班后我去理发。
examples.en: I'm getting my hair cut after work on Thursday.

examples.ch: 商店在星期四较晚关门。
examples.en: The shops stay open late on Thursdays.

examples.ch: 再见！下星期四见！
examples.en: Bye! See you next Thursday!

examples.ch: 你还记得我们上星期四谈论的那本书吗？
examples.en: Do you remember that book we were talking about last Thursday?

examples.ch: 今年我的生日在星期四。
examples.en: This year my birthday is on a Thursday.

examples.ch: 星期四上午／下午／傍晚/晚上
examples.en: Thursday morning/afternoon/evening/night

defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for
physical education

defines.trans_ch: （用在已婚妇女的姓或姓名之前）夫人，太太
defines.trans_en: a title used before the family name or full name of a married woman who has no other title

examples.ch: 伍德太太／琼•伍德太太
examples.en: Mrs Wood/Mrs Jean Wood

examples.ch: 你好，格兰特夫人，你今天怎么样？
examples.en: Hello, Mrs Grant, how are you today?

defines.trans_ch: （用以表示某已婚女士是某一品质、活动或地方的典型代表）
defines.trans_en: used when expressing the idea that a woman is typical of or represents a quality, activity, or place

examples.ch: 平凡女子
examples.en: Mrs Average (= a woman who is typical of an ordinary woman)

defines.trans_en: the day of the week after Sunday and before Tuesday

examples.ch: 周一我将开始我的新工作。
examples.en: I start my new job on Monday.

examples.ch: 难道你不讨厌每个周一又要回学校吗？
examples.en: Don't you hate going back to school on Mondays?

examples.ch: 下星期一见。
examples.en: I'll see you next Monday.

examples.ch: 他上周一上班迟到了。
examples.en: He was late for work last Monday.

examples.ch: 孩子是在一个星期一出生的。
examples.en: The baby was born on a Monday.

examples.ch: 周一上午/下午/傍晚/晚上
examples.en: Monday morning/afternoon/evening/night

defines.trans_ch: 未做到；未体验；避开；幸免于
defines.trans_en: to fail to do or experience something, often something planned or expected, or to avoid doing or experiencing something

examples.ch: 我上课迟到了，因为我坐的公共汽车晚了。
examples.en: I missed the start of the class because my bus was late.

examples.ch: 我经常不吃早餐而早吃午饭。
examples.en: Often I miss (= do not eat) breakfast and have an early lunch instead.

examples.ch: 如果你想避开高峰时间，就该早些出发。
examples.en: You should leave early if you want to miss the rush hour.

examples.ch: 我今早差点被一辆公共汽车撞倒。
examples.en: I only just missed being run over by a bus this morning.

defines.trans_en: to arrive too late to get on a bus, train, or aircraft

examples.ch: 如果你不快点，会误了飞机的。
examples.en: You'll miss your flight if you don't hurry up.

defines.trans_en: to not go to something

examples.ch: 缺课严重的学生会很难赶上。
examples.en: Students who miss a lot of school can find it hard to catch up.

examples.ch: 我正要找个不去办公室聚会的接口。
examples.en: I'm trying to find an excuse for missing the office party.

defines.trans_en: to not see or hear something or someone

examples.ch: 我错过了演出的开头。
examples.en: I missed the beginning of the show.

examples.ch: 她最近的一部电影很好，不容错过。
examples.en: Her latest movie is too good to miss (= it certainly should be seen).

examples.ch: 很遗憾没有在帕特的派对上看到你——我准是在你离开后才到的。
examples.en: I was sorry I missed you at Pat's party - I must have arrived after you left.

defines.trans_en: to not notice someone or something

examples.ch: 你真是明察秋毫，是吧？别人都没有注意到那个错误。
examples.en: You don't miss much, do you? Nobody else noticed that mistake.

examples.ch: 我的办公室是右边的第一间，有一扇鲜红色的门。你不会找不到的。
examples.en: My office is first on the right with a bright red door. You can't miss it (= it is very easy to find).

defines.trans_en: to feel sad that a person or thing is not present

examples.ch: 她离开的时候我非常想念她。
examples.en: I really missed her when she went away.

examples.ch: 所有认识她的人都会很悲伤地怀念她的。
examples.en: She will be sadly missed by all who knew her.

examples.ch: 我仍惦念着我的旧汽车。
examples.en: I still miss my old car.

examples.ch: 你住在法国时最想念家乡的是什么？
examples.en: What did you miss most about home when you were living in France?

examples.ch: 出乎我的预料，我并没有老想着要抽烟。
examples.en: I haven't missed smoking like I expected to.

defines.trans_en: to fail to hit something, or to avoid hitting something

examples.ch: 子弹差几厘米就击中了他的心脏。
examples.en: The bullet missed his heart by a couple of centimetres.

examples.ch: 我为避开另一辆车急忙转向，差一点就撞到树上。
examples.en: I swerved to avoid the other car and only just missed a tree.

examples.ch: 他朝我扔了一本书，但没打中。
examples.en: He threw a book at me, but he/it missed.

defines.trans_ch: 发觉遗失；发觉…不在身边
defines.trans_en: to notice that something is lost or absent

examples.ch: 直到服务员拿来账单，他才发觉丢了钱包。
examples.en: He didn't miss his wallet until the waiter brought the bill.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when something or someone fails to hit something or avoids hitting something

examples.ch: 打得好！你8次击中得分，只有两次失误。
examples.en: Well done! You scored eight hits and only two misses.

defines.trans_en: a girl or young woman, especially one who behaves rudely or shows no respect

examples.ch: 你这个冒失的小姑娘！立刻道歉。
examples.en: You're a cheeky little miss! Apologize at once.

defines.trans_ch: （用在女孩或未婚女子名前作为称呼）小姐
defines.trans_en: a title used before the family name or full name of a single woman who has no other title

examples.ch: 卡特小姐，怀特医生现在就见你。
examples.en: Dr White will see you now, Miss Carter.

examples.ch: 海伦娜‧刘易斯小姐
examples.en: Miss Helena Lewis

defines.trans_ch: （作为对看上去没有结婚的女孩或青年女子的称呼）小姐
defines.trans_en: used as a form of address for a girl or young woman

examples.ch: 打扰了，小姐，你把这个东西掉地上了。
examples.en: Excuse me, Miss, you dropped this.

defines.trans_ch: （孩子有时对女教师的称呼）老师
defines.trans_en: sometimes used by children to address or refer to teachers who are women

examples.ch: 我能去厕所吗，老师？
examples.en: Can I go to the toilet, Miss?

defines.trans_en: a title given to a woman who wins a beauty contest, combined with the name of the place that she represents

examples.ch: 印度／英国小姐
examples.en: Miss India/UK

examples.ch: 世界小姐比赛
examples.en: the Miss World contest

phrases.trans_ch: 避开；对…不予理会；决定不做
phrases.trans_en: to avoid or not do something

examples.ch: 我们通常夏天去法国，但今年我们决定不去了。
examples.en: We usually go to France in the summer, but we've decided to give it a miss this year.

examples.ch: 这家餐馆鱼做得很好，但他们的素菜我不愿意吃。
examples.en: The restaurant's very good for fish, but I'd give their vegetarian options a miss.

defines.trans_en: a small bird like a swallow but with a shorter tail

phrases.trans_ch: 在（某人的）知识范围之外
phrases.trans_en: not in your area of knowledge

examples.ch: 金融方面的事我恐怕不懂。
examples.en: Financial matters are beyond my ken, I'm afraid.

defines.trans_en: to know someone or something
the day of the week after Thursday and before Saturday

examples.ch: 我们星期五去看戏怎么样？
examples.en: Shall we go to the theatre on Friday?

examples.ch: 我星期五较早下班。
examples.en: I leave work early on Fridays.

examples.ch: 下个星期五我们将去巴黎度周末。
examples.en: We're going to Paris for the weekend next Friday.

examples.ch: 自从上星期五以来我都没有和他说过话。
examples.en: I haven't spoken to him since last Friday.

examples.ch: 我们下一次会议是在5号，星期五。
examples.en: Our next meeting is on the 5th, which is a Friday.

examples.ch: 星期五上午/下午/傍晚/晚上
examples.en: Friday morning/afternoon/evening/night

defines.trans_en: a person who makes and repairs barrels (= large wooden containers with a flat top and curved sides, used for holding beer, wine, etc.)
clay of a high quality that is shaped and then heated to make it permanently hard, or objects made from this, such as cups and plates

examples.ch: 瓷盘
examples.en: china plates

defines.trans_en: a country in East Asia
the United States of America
North America and/or South America

to make marks that represent letters, words, or numbers on a surface, such as paper or a computer screen, using a pen, pencil, or keyboard, or to use this method to record thoughts, facts, or messages

examples.ch: 填表时，请用黑色墨水书写清楚。
examples.en: When you fill in the form, please write clearly/legibly in black ink.

examples.ch: “希望下周六能见到你，”她写道。
examples.en: "I hope to see you next Saturday," she wrote.

examples.ch: 为什么不在开始前把你的想法写在纸上呢？
examples.en: Why not write (down) your ideas on a piece of paper before you start?

defines.trans_en: to send a letter or message to someone, giving them information or expressing your thoughts or feelings

examples.ch: 她最近没有给我写信。
examples.en: She hasn't written to me (US also written me) recently.

examples.ch: 我给姐姐写了封信。
examples.en: I wrote my sister a letter.

examples.ch: 母亲写信向我描述了聚会的详情。
examples.en: My mother wrote to give me details about the party.

examples.ch: 旅行社已发信提供了这次旅行的资料。
examples.en: The travel company has written giving information about the trip.

defines.trans_en: to put all the information that is needed on a document

examples.ch: 请写出你完整的姓名和地址。
examples.en: Please will you write (out) your name and address in full.

examples.ch: 我给他开了一张50英镑的支票。
examples.en: I wrote him a cheque for £50.

defines.trans_ch: 创作，写作;编写（计算机程序）
defines.trans_en: to create and record something, such as a book, poem, song, or computer program, on paper or on a computer

examples.ch: 她写儿童书／诗。
examples.en: She writes children's books/poems.

examples.ch: 亚当设计并编写了那个软件。
examples.en: Adam designed and wrote the software.

examples.ch: 他为电影和电视节目创作音乐。
examples.en: He wrote music for films and TV shows.

examples.ch: 这本书写得很好。
examples.en: The book is very well written.

defines.trans_en: to have the job of creating books, stories, or articles that will be published

examples.ch: 她为一家全国性的报纸撰稿。
examples.en: She writes for a national newspaper.

defines.trans_ch: （在书籍、报刊或文件中）指出，写道
defines.trans_en: to say something in a book, newspaper, magazine, or document

examples.ch: 他在文章中写道，难民营问题正在恶化。
examples.en: In the article, he writes that the problems in the refugee camps are getting worse.

defines.trans_en: to record information in the memory of a computer

examples.ch: A 盘驱动器在写入时出了个问题。
examples.en: There was a problem writing to the disk in the A drive.

defines.trans_en: an activity, such as a job, that a person uses physical or mental effort to do, usually for money

examples.ch: 我有一大堆工作要做。
examples.en: I've got so much work to do.

examples.ch: 整天来回运送重物是个苦活儿。
examples.en: Carrying heavy loads around all day is hard work.

examples.ch: 你什么时间开始／完成工作?
examples.en: What time do you start/finish work?

examples.ch: 艾琳做大部分的家务活儿。
examples.en: Aileen does most of the work around the house.

examples.ch: 你对哪一种工作有经验？
examples.en: What sort of work are you experienced in?

examples.ch: 她总是穿得漂漂亮亮的去上班。
examples.en: She tends to wear quite dressy clothes for work.

examples.ch: 罗杰的工作需要经常出差。
examples.en: Roger's work involves a lot of travelling.

defines.trans_en: the material used by someone at work, or what they produce

examples.ch: 我只好把这项工作带回家完成。
examples.en: I'll have to take this work home with me and finish it there.

examples.ch: 所有的家具都是这里居民的劳动成果。
examples.en: All the furniture is the work of residents here.

defines.trans_en: a place where a person goes specially to do their job

examples.ch: 你每天上班路远不远？
examples.en: Do you have far to travel to work each day?

examples.ch: 每年都有数以千计的人在工作中受重伤。
examples.en: Thousands of people are seriously injured at work every year.

examples.ch: 她什么时候出门去上班？
examples.en: When does she leave for work?

defines.trans_ch: （尤指绘画、书籍或音乐）作品，著作
defines.trans_en: something created as a result of effort, especially a painting, book, or piece of music

examples.ch: 这家博物馆有很多毕加索的作品，也有不少其他现代画家的作品。
examples.en: The museum has many works by Picasso as well as other modern painters.

examples.ch: 泰戈尔的诗作
examples.en: the poetic works of Tagore

defines.trans_en: surgery (= a medical operation) that is done to improve someone's appearance

examples.ch: 她否认做过任何整容手术，但我认为她肯定做过一点。
examples.en: She denies having had any cosmetic surgery, but I think she's definitely had some work done.

defines.trans_en: force multiplied by distance moved

phrases.trans_en: everything that you might want or expect to find in a particular situation

examples.ch: 新郎穿着晨礼服，戴着手套和高顶礼帽——全套的行头。
examples.en: The bridegroom was wearing a morning suit, gloves, top hat - the works.

examples.ch: 给我来两份全套的比萨饼吧。
examples.en: And can I have two large pizzas with the works (= with all available types of food on top).

phrases.trans_en: an industrial building, especially one where a lot of people are employed

examples.ch: 钢／铁厂
examples.en: a steel/iron works

phrases.trans_en: the parts of a machine, especially those that move

examples.ch: 如果你把钟的后盖打开，就会看到那些活动部件。
examples.en: If you take the back off this clock, you can see its/the works.

defines.trans_en: to be effective or successful

examples.ch: 她关于部门重组的构想实际上永远都不会实现。
examples.en: Her idea for reorganizing the department will never work in practice.

examples.ch: 几分钟后药片就会开始起作用。
examples.en: The tablets will start to work in a few minutes.

examples.ch: 有些人认为我进行冥想有点古怪，但这对我有用，这才是最重要的。
examples.en: Some people think I'm weird doing meditation, but it works for me and that's all that matters.

examples.ch: 有据可考，君主政体成功施行了很多个世纪。
examples.en: Arguably, the monarchy worked well for many centuries.

defines.trans_ch: （使）工作;（使）劳动;（使）干活儿（尤指为了挣钱）
defines.trans_en: to do a job, especially the job you do to earn money, or to make someone do a job

examples.ch: 他在当地的医院工作。
examples.en: He works at the hospital.

examples.ch: 她在医院里当清洁工。
examples.en: She worked as a cleaner at the hospital.

examples.ch: 迈克在一家计算机公司工作。
examples.en: Mike works for a computer company.

examples.ch: 对于一名初级医生来说，每周工作70甚或80小时是很平常的。
examples.en: It's not unusual for a junior doctor to work a 70 or sometimes an 80-hour week.

examples.ch: 你有没有教授过有学习障碍的孩子？
examples.en: Have you any experience of working with children who have learning difficulties?

examples.ch: 生存训练课上，老师把我们累坏了。
examples.en: The instructors worked us very hard on the survival course.

defines.trans_en: If a machine or device works, it operates, especially correctly and without failure, and if you work it, you make it operate.

examples.ch: 我们的电话坏了。
examples.en: Our phone isn't working.

examples.ch: 这样大小的熔炉需要大约12个人来维持其运行。
examples.en: You need a team of about twelve people to work a furnace this size.

examples.ch: 这个泵利用风力。
examples.en: The pump works off/on (= uses) wind power.

examples.ch: 这个泵靠风力运转。
examples.en: The pump is worked by (= uses to operate) wind power.

examples.ch: 我怎么也弄不好这台收音机。
examples.en: I can't get the radio to work.

defines.trans_en: to succeed gradually in becoming something or cause a person or thing to become something, either by making an effort or by making many small movements

examples.ch: 他从一名技术员做起，一步一步晋升为公司的总经理。
examples.en: He started as a technician and worked his way up through the company to become managing director.

examples.ch: 最后她终于读完了一大堆技术论文。
examples.en: Eventually she worked her way through (= read) the huge amount of technical papers.

examples.ch: 震动会使螺母和螺丝自动松开。
examples.en: Vibration tends to make nuts and screws work themselves loose.

examples.ch: 随着时间的推移，螺丝已经松了。
examples.en: The screws had worked loose over time.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指不通过官方认可的方式或巧妙地）安排
defines.trans_en: to arrange for something to happen, especially by not using official methods and/or by being clever

examples.ch: 我不知道她是如何做到在50岁退休的。
examples.en: I don't know how she worked it, but she retired at 50.

examples.ch: 我们能否安排一下，以便在工作时间这里总是有人接电话？
examples.en: Can we work things (out) so that there's always someone here to answer the phone during office hours?

defines.trans_en: to shape, change, or process a substance

examples.ch: 加工铁比加工青铜需要更高的温度。
examples.en: Working iron requires higher temperatures than bronze.

examples.ch: 轻轻地把黄油揉到面粉里，直到没有硬块为止。
examples.en: Gently work the butter into the flour until there are no lumps left.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to work of a particular type

examples.ch: 家庭作业
examples.en: homework

examples.ch: 文字工作
examples.en: paperwork

defines.trans_ch: 使用（某种材料）的手艺（或活动）
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a skill or activity using a particular type of material

examples.ch: 在这所学校里，男孩和女孩们学习木工和金属制造手艺。
examples.en: Girls and boys study woodwork and metalwork at this school.

defines.trans_en: used to name things made of a particular material

examples.ch: 石制品
examples.en: stonework

examples.ch: 铁制品
examples.en: ironwork

defines.trans_ch: （与过去时连用，对已经存在的情况表示遗憾）但愿，希望
defines.trans_en: used with the past simple to express that you feel sorry or sad about a state or situation that exists at the moment

examples.ch: 我个子再高一点就好了。
examples.en: I wish (that) I was/were a bit taller.

examples.ch: 你要是和我一起去就好了，彼得。
examples.en: I wish (that) you were coming with me, Peter.

defines.trans_ch: （与过去完成时连用，对过去某事表示悔恨）但愿，希望
defines.trans_en: used with the past perfect to express that you feel sorry or sad about a particular action in the past

examples.ch: 我真希望自己没吃那么多。
examples.en: I wish (that) I hadn't eaten so much.

examples.ch: 我敢打赌她希望自己从未卷入整个事件里去。
examples.en: I bet she wishes (that) she'd never got involved in the whole mess.

defines.trans_en: to want to do something

examples.ch: 只要是您想要这样，先生。我们一定会去做。
examples.en: As you wish, Sir. It will be done.

examples.ch: 我要投诉。
examples.en: I wish to make a complaint.

examples.ch: 去往国王十字车站的乘客请现在上车。
examples.en: Passengers wishing to take the Kings Cross train should board now.

examples.ch: 我不想让你担心，但他确实说过午夜之前会回来。
examples.en: I don't wish to worry you but he did say he'd be back by midnight.

examples.ch: 有时我特别消沉，甚至希望自己死了。
examples.en: Sometimes I was so depressed that I wished myself dead.

defines.trans_en: to hope or express hope for another person's success or happiness or pleasure on a particular occasion

examples.ch: 我们祝愿你将来事事成功。
examples.en: We wish you every success in the future.

examples.ch: 我甚至没能见到她，当面祝福她生日快乐。
examples.en: I didn't even see her to wish her a happy birthday/wish a happy birthday to her.

examples.ch: 我祝她旅途平安，并与她挥手道别。
examples.en: I wished her a safe journey and waved her off.

defines.trans_ch: 希望（因为好运或魔力而）梦想成真
defines.trans_en: to hope that something you want will be made real because of good luck or magical powers

examples.ch: 我记得吹灭了生日蛋糕上的蜡烛，并默默希望约翰‧李能成为我的男朋友。
examples.en: I remember blowing out the candles on my birthday cake and wishing that John Lee would be my boyfriend.

examples.ch: 如果现在我想去什么地方就能去什么地方的话，我希望去一个暖风扑面阳光明媚的地方。
examples.en: If I could wish myself anywhere in the world (= go anywhere as a result of making a wish) right now it would be somewhere hot and sunny.

examples.ch: 他幽默、聪明而又英俊——真正拥有一个女孩子希望的一切。
examples.en: He's funny, bright, handsome - everything a girl could wish for really.

examples.ch: “你的工作一定非常有意思。”“我倒希望是那样！”
examples.en: "Your job must be very glamorous." "I wish!" (= not at all.)

examples.ch: “到了40岁的时候，我就会富了。”“你想得美！”
examples.en: "By the time I'm 40, I'll be rich." "You wish!" (= There is no chance of that happening.)

defines.trans_ch: （用特定的言辞或举动）欢迎，问候
defines.trans_en: to welcome someone with particular words or a particular action

examples.ch: 他每天早上都问候我。
examples.en: He wishes me every morning.

phrases.trans_ch: （用来表示对某人行为的厌烦）我希望…
phrases.trans_en: used to express anger at someone's behaviour

examples.ch: 我希望她能闭一会儿嘴，让其他人来说。
examples.en: I wish she'd shut up for a minute and let someone else talk.

examples.ch: 我希望在我跟你讲话时你能看着我！
examples.en: I wish you'd look at me when I'm trying to talk to you!

phrases.trans_en: to hope someone will succeed

examples.ch: 我祝他的新企业成功。
examples.en: I wished him well with his new venture.

defines.trans_en: a feeling of wanting something

examples.ch: 他表达了想见我的愿望了吗？
examples.en: Did he express any wish to see me?

examples.ch: 依照他的意愿，他葬在了妻子的旁边。
examples.en: In accordance with his wishes (= what he wanted), he was buried next to his wife.

examples.ch: 他们故意违背我的意愿，把房屋卖了。
examples.en: They've deliberately gone against my wishes and sold the house.

examples.ch: 爷爷最大的愿望就是有个孙子或孙女成为医生。
examples.en: It was grandpa's greatest wish that one of his grandchildren would become a doctor.

defines.trans_en: a hope that is made real with magical powers

examples.ch: 如果我只有一个愿望可以实现，那我希望世界上所有的战争明天都停止。
examples.en: If I could have just one wish I suppose it would be that all the fighting in the world would stop tomorrow.

examples.ch: 闭上眼睛许一个愿。
examples.en: Close your eyes and make a wish.

examples.ch: 故事里的那个片断中，仙女答应实现小女孩的3个愿望。
examples.en: It's that part of the story where the fairy grants the little girl three wishes.

examples.ch: 祝你所有的心愿都成真。
examples.en: May all your wishes come true.

phrases.trans_en: something you say or write at the end of a letter, etc. to show that you hope someone is happy and has good luck

examples.ch: 他用“祝好，卡洛”结束了那封信。
examples.en: He ended the letter "Best wishes, Carlo".

examples.ch: 祝你早日康复。
examples.en: Best wishes for a speedy recovery.

examples.ch: 把最诚挚的祝福送给你，路易丝‧福斯特。
examples.en: With best wishes, Louise Foster.

examples.ch: 当你见到乔伊斯时，请送上我的美好祝福。
examples.en: When you see Joyce, please give her my good wishes.

defines.trans_en: in the way that most often happens

examples.ch: 他通常在6点左右到家。
examples.en: He usually gets home about six o'clock.

examples.ch: 通常我午饭只吃一个三明治。
examples.en: I usually just have a sandwich for lunch.

examples.ch: 你的朋友经常这么无礼吗?
examples.en: Is your friend usually so rude?

examples.ch: 一般我们在2月份去滑雪。
examples.en: Usually we go skiing in February.

examples.ch: “你们晚上自己做饭吗?”“通常是的。”
examples.en: "Do you cook your own meals in the evenings?" "Usually."

defines.trans_en: the part of existence that is measured in minutes, days, years, etc., or this process considered as a whole

examples.ch: 他想多花时间陪家人。
examples.en: He wants to spend more time with his family.

examples.ch: 玩得高兴时，时间过得特别快。
examples.en: Time passes so quickly when you're having fun.

examples.ch: 随着时间的推移，她对这门学科越来越着迷。
examples.en: She grew more and more fascinated by the subject as time went on/by.

examples.ch: 年深日久，窗帘已经褪色了。
examples.en: The curtains have faded over/with time (= as years have gone past).

examples.ch: 你迟早会忘记她的。
examples.en: You'll forget her in time (= in the future).

examples.ch: 随着岁月的流逝，岩石上出现了洞眼。
examples.en: Over the course of time (= as years have gone past), holes have formed in the rock.

examples.ch: 葆拉生病时，我给她带去一些杂志帮她消磨时间。
examples.en: When Paula was ill, I took her some magazines to help her pass the time.

examples.ch: 如果你在这篇文章上多花些时间，本可以写得好得多。
examples.en: If you'd taken more time with/over (= spent more time doing) this essay, you could have done it much better.

examples.ch: 从伦敦到悉尼要花很长时间。
examples.en: It takes a long time (= many hours are needed) to get from London to Sydney.

examples.ch: 如果我们坐火车去，就会在旅程上节约时间。
examples.en: We'd save time on our journey (= it would be quicker) if we went by train.

examples.ch: 我只在那儿工作过很短一段时间。
examples.en: I only worked there for a short period of time.

examples.ch: 厨房的钟快／慢了。
examples.en: The kitchen clock is gaining/losing time (= is going fast/slow).

examples.ch: 我的手表从来都不准。
examples.en: My watch has never kept very good time (= been correct).

defines.trans_en: the system of recording hours used in different parts of the world

examples.ch: 格林尼治标准时间
examples.en: Greenwich Mean Time

examples.ch: 夏令时
examples.en: daylight saving time

defines.trans_en: an amount of time that you have available to do something

examples.ch: 我不知道你是怎么抽出时间做所有这些事情的。
examples.en: I don't know how you find time to do all the things you do.

examples.ch: 我原以为我们会多给她一点儿时间完成工作。
examples.en: I thought we'd give her a little more time (= allow her more time) to get the job done.

examples.ch: 所有的博物馆我都想参观，可时间不够。
examples.en: I'd like to visit all the museums but time is short (= there is little time left).

defines.trans_en: a particular period of time for which something has been happening, or that is needed for something

examples.ch: 过了一阵子，情况变得很明显，没有人想来参加会议。
examples.en: After a time, it became clear that nobody was interested in coming to the meetings.

examples.ch: 他们跟我们住了很短一段时间。
examples.en: They stayed with us for a short time.

examples.ch: 那是我很长一段时间以来去过的最好的饭店。
examples.en: That was the best restaurant I've been to for/in a long time (= a long period has gone past since I went to such a good restaurant).

examples.ch: 我最后一次收到她的信已有一段时间了。
examples.en: It was some time ago that I last heard from her.

examples.ch: 我们过两周要去度假。
examples.en: We're going on holiday in two weeks' time (= after two weeks have passed).

examples.ch: 首相在执政期间推行了多项改革。
examples.en: During her time (= while she was) in office, the prime minister introduced a large number of changes.

examples.ch: 你业余时间喜欢做什么？
examples.en: What do you like doing in your spare/free time (= when you are not working)?

defines.trans_en: a particular point in the day, as expressed in hours and minutes or shown on a clock, or a particular point in time

examples.ch: 现在几点了？
examples.en: What time is it?

examples.ch: “现在什么时间？”“10点钟。”
examples.en: "What's the time?" "It's ten o'clock."

examples.ch: 你什么时候完成工作？
examples.en: What time do you finishwork?

examples.ch: 你知道几点了吗？
examples.en: Have you got the time? (= Do you know what time it is?)

examples.ch: 他在教女儿看钟表。
examples.en: He's teaching his daughter to tell the time (= to recognize what time it is by looking at a clock).

examples.ch: 你查到去基辅的火车的发车时间了吗？
examples.en: Did you find out the times of the trains to Kiev?

examples.ch: 这次航班估计在11点15分到达／起飞。
examples.en: The estimated time of arrival/departure of this flight is 11.15.

examples.ch: 哦，天哪，有这么晚了吗？
examples.en: Oh dear, is that the (right) time? (= is it really so late?)

examples.ch: 我们每天总是在同一时间吃晚饭。
examples.en: We always have dinner at the same time every day.

examples.ch: 我到家时已经筋疲力尽了。
examples.en: I was exhausted by the time (= when) I got home.

examples.ch: 我什么时候给你打电话合适？
examples.en: When would be a good time for me to call you?

examples.ch: “我们什么时候送桌子最合适？”“哦，什么时候都行。”
examples.en: "What would be the best time of day for us to deliver the table?" "Oh, any time will be OK."

examples.ch: 今天的气温会和往年此时的平均气温一样。
examples.en: Today's temperatures will be normal for the time of year (= will be as they are expected to be in this season).

examples.ch: 想想吧，下星期这个时候我们就在阿鲁巴岛了。
examples.en: Just think, this time (= at the same particular point during) next week we'll be in Aruba.

examples.ch: 很遗憾，我们现在无法供应您订的货。
examples.en: We regret that at the present time (US also at this time) we are unable to supply the products you ordered.

examples.ch: 我们必须下决心的时刻很快就要到了。
examples.en: The time is fast drawing near/approaching (= it will soon be the time) when we'll have to make a decision.

defines.trans_ch: （从事特定活动或某事应该发生的）时间，时候
defines.trans_en: a particular point of the day, year, etc. that is suitable for a particular activity, or at which something is expected to happen

examples.ch: 假期
examples.en: holiday time

examples.ch: 聚会时间
examples.en: party time

examples.ch: 现在收拾好玩具，该睡觉了。
examples.en: Put your toys away now - it's time for bed.

examples.ch: 我该动身了。
examples.en: It's time (that) I was leaving.

examples.ch: 该回家了吗？
examples.en: Is it time (for us) to go home yet?

examples.ch: 现在不是考虑买房子的时候。
examples.en: This is not the time (= not a suitable moment) to be thinking about buying a house.

examples.ch: 现在不是你改变主意的时候。
examples.en: This is no time (= not a suitable moment) to change your mind.

examples.ch: 我觉得是我离开的时候了。
examples.en: I feel that the time has come (= now is a suitable moment) for me to move on.

examples.ch: 道路维修工程提前两星期完成了。
examples.en: The repairs to the road were finished two weeks ahead of time (= sooner than was expected).

examples.ch: 为什么公交车从不准点？
examples.en: Why is it that the buses never run on time (= make their journeys in the expected number of hours, etc.)?

examples.ch: 她过早地衰老了。
examples.en: She's grown old before her time (= sooner than she might have been expected to have done).

defines.trans_en: an occasion when something happens, or the experience connected with it

examples.ch: 上一次我们去巴黎的时候，每天都下雨。
examples.en: The last time we went to Paris, it rained every day.

examples.ch: 每次我叫你做事，你都说太忙。
examples.en: Every time/Each time I ask you to do something you say you're busy.

examples.ch: 他们每周去游泳三四次。
examples.en: They go swimming three or four times a week.

examples.ch: 有时我真希望我不是住在现在的地方。
examples.en: There are times when I wish I didn't live where I do.

examples.ch: 这名曾4度夺冠的选手在比赛的第二轮就被打败了。
examples.en: The four-times champion (= the champion on four occasions in the past) was defeated in the second round.

examples.ch: 我当时要是知道她是他前妻的话，我就不会那样说了。
examples.en: If I'd known at the time (= then) that she was his former wife, I'd never have said what I did.

examples.ch: 有时我很喜欢英语课，但有时也感觉很枯燥。
examples.en: Sometimes I enjoy my English classes, but at other times I find them really boring.

examples.ch: 我无数次／上百次／上千次告诉过你，别再戏弄你妹妹了。
examples.en: For the umpteenth/hundredth/thousandth time, (= I've told you on many occasions to) stop teasing your sister.

examples.ch: 你会开得好／不好吗？
examples.en: Did you have a bad/good time (= an unpleasant/enjoyable experience) at the conference?

examples.ch: 她生第二个孩子时很顺利／艰难。
examples.en: She had an easy/hard time of it (= a comfortable/uncomfortable experience) with the birth of her second baby.

defines.trans_en: a period in history

examples.ch: 小说《双城记》是以法国大革命时期为背景的。
examples.en: "A Tale of Two Cities" is set at the time of the French Revolution.

examples.ch: 中世纪时期，人们把被认为是女巫的女人烧死在火刑柱上。
examples.en: In/During medieval times, women thought to be witches were burned at the stake.

examples.ch: 在过去的时代里，所有的农作物都是手工收割的。
examples.en: In times gone by, all crops were harvested by hand.

examples.ch: 我小时候日子很艰难。
examples.en: Times were hard (= living conditions were not good) when I was a boy.

examples.ch: 人们普遍认为他是现代／我们这个时代最优秀的作家之一。
examples.en: He is widely regarded as one of the best writers of modern/our times (= the present or very recent past).

examples.ch: 我怎么也想不到这会在我有生之年发生。
examples.en: I never thought it would happen in my time (= before I died).

examples.ch: 我们坐下来谈论往事。
examples.en: We sat and talked about old times (= things that had happened to us in the past.)

examples.ch: 时代已经变了，置身高级管理职位的女性数量比过去多得多了。
examples.en: Times have changed and many more women now have executive jobs than in the past.

defines.trans_en: Your time in a race is the number of minutes, hours, etc. you take to complete it.

examples.ch: 她的马拉松成绩略低于3小时。
examples.en: Her time for the marathon was just under three hours.

examples.ch: 他以创纪录的成绩完成了100米赛跑。
examples.en: He ran the 100 metres in record time.

defines.trans_en: the number of beats in a bar of music, or the speed at which a piece of music is intended to be played

examples.ch: 这支曲子是四四拍的。
examples.en: This piece is written in 4/4 time.

examples.ch: 幼儿唱歌时常常难以与音乐合拍。
examples.en: Small children often have difficulty singing in time with the music (= at the same speed at which the music is being played).

examples.ch: 我觉得小提琴似乎不合拍。
examples.en: It seemed to me as if the violins were playing out of time (= at a different speed from the other instruments playing the same piece of music).

examples.ch: 打拍子就是跟着音乐的节奏制造出一系列有规律的声响。
examples.en: To beat time is to make a regular series of sounds at the same speed as a piece of music is played.

examples.ch: 用脚轻叩有助于你跟上节拍。
examples.en: Tapping your foot will help you to keep time (= to play the music at the correct speed).

defines.trans_en: the particular point in the day at which people who are drinking in a bar in the UK have to finish their drinks and leave

examples.ch: “对不起，要打烊了，”店主叫道。
examples.en: "Time, please!" called the landlord.

examples.ch: 已经到打烊的时间了吗？
examples.en: Is it time already?

phrases.trans_en: continuously

examples.ch: 我希望你别再没完没了地批评我了。
examples.en: I wish you'd stop criticizing me all the time.

phrases.trans_en: very quickly or very soon

examples.ch: 孩子们很快吃完了饭。
examples.en: The kids ate their dinner in no time.

examples.ch: 我们很快就能回到家。
examples.en: We'll be home in next to no time.

phrases.trans_en: If you say there is or that you have no time to lose, it means that you must do quickly whatever it is that you want to do.

examples.ch: 赶快，没有时间耽搁了，我们必须在约翰发现之前赶到家。
examples.en: Come on, there's no time to lose, we have to get home before John finds out.

phrases.trans_en: always

examples.ch: 我会永远爱你。
examples.en: I will love you for all time.

phrases.trans_en: that has ever lived or existed

examples.ch: 她被称为有史以来最伟大的演唱家。
examples.en: She's been called the greatest singer of all time.

phrases.trans_en: If you have time, you have enough time to do something.

examples.ch: 在火车发车之前我们的时间不多了。
examples.en: We don't have much time before the train leaves.

examples.ch: 下班后你有没有时间小酌一杯？
examples.en: Do you have time for a quick drink after work?

examples.ch: 我想学驾帆船，可我没时间。
examples.en: I'd like to learn to sail, but I don't have the time (= I am too busy).

examples.ch: 我今天没有时间去商店购物。
examples.en: I don't have time to go to the shops today.

phrases.trans_en: to not make good use of the hours, etc. that you have available

examples.ch: 如果你当时继续工作而不是浪费时间玩手机，你现在已经完成任务了。
examples.en: If you'd done your work instead of wasting time on your phone, you'd be finished by now.

phrases.trans_en: to not have enough hours, etc. available to finish something you are trying to do

examples.ch: 她时间不够，最后一道题没有答完。
examples.en: She ran out of time and didn't finish the last question.

phrases.trans_en: to not have enough minutes, etc. available

examples.ch: 我很想继续讨论，但我们的时间不够。
examples.en: I'd like to continue this discussion but we're all out of time.

phrases.trans_en: there are no more minutes, hours, etc. available

examples.ch: 好了，各位，这星期的就到这里。
examples.en: OK, everyone, time's up for this week.

phrases.trans_en: a period of time added to the end of a football match because play was stopped during the game, usually to take care of players who were hurt
