examples.ch: 他在比赛伤停补时阶段的第三分钟射进一球，决定了比赛的胜利。
examples.en: His goal in the third minute of time added on sealed the match.

phrases.trans_en: to stop work, in order to do something else

examples.ch: 我问老板我能不能请一会儿假去看牙医。
examples.en: I asked my boss if I could have some time off (from work) to go to the dentist.

phrases.trans_en: for a short period

examples.ch: 我们一度都认为希拉和弗兰克会结婚。
examples.en: For a time, we all thought that Sheila and Frank would get married.

phrases.trans_en: for a fairly long period of time

examples.ch: 我做瑜伽已有一段时间。
examples.en: I've been doing yoga for some time.

phrases.trans_en: for a limited period

examples.ch: 暂且先别烫衣服——我晚些时候来做。
examples.en: Leave the ironing for the time being - I'll do it later.

phrases.trans_en: at the particular point when something was thought of or done

examples.ch: 在当时这似乎是个好主意。
examples.en: It seemed like a good idea at the time.

phrases.trans_en: If two things happen at the same time, they happen together.

examples.ch: 我们同时到达。
examples.en: We arrived at the same time.

phrases.trans_en: at a person's present age

examples.ch: 他这样年纪应该享享清福了。
examples.en: At his time of life, he ought to be taking things easy.

phrases.trans_en: early enough

examples.ch: 我正好及时赶到家——随后就开始下雨了。
examples.en: I got home just in time - it's starting to rain.

examples.ch: 如果我们不赶快，就不能及时赶上火车了。
examples.en: If we don't hurry up, we won't be in time to catch the train.

examples.ch: 我们比赛前早早地就到了。
examples.en: We got there in plenty of time (= we arrived early) for the beginning of the game.

phrases.trans_en: happening or done at the particular moment that it was expected to happen or be done

examples.ch: 我父母极为准时地到家。
examples.en: My parents go to the house right on time.

phrases.trans_en: earlier than a particular moment

examples.ch: 我们见面吃个午饭吧。我会提前打电话跟你定时间和地点。
examples.en: Let's meet for lunch. I'll call you ahead of time to decide exactly when and where.

phrases.trans_ch: 差不多是时候了；早该（做某事）了
phrases.trans_en: If it is about time/high time that someone did something, it should have been done sooner or a long time ago.

examples.ch: 学校早该改善膳食服务了。
examples.en: It's about time (that) the school improved its food service.

examples.ch: 是到了批评者们对新做法采取开放态度的时候了。
examples.en: It is high time for the critics to open their minds to a new approach.

phrases.trans_ch: （表示某人早该做某事了或某事早该发生了）早该如此
phrases.trans_en: said when someone does something or something happens that you think should have been done or have happened much sooner

examples.ch: “这么说，本终于找到工作了。”“对，早就该找到了。”
examples.en: "So Ben's finally found a job." "Yeah, it's about time."

phrases.trans_en: it is the most suitable moment to do something or for something to happen

examples.ch: 我目前还没有告诉他，时机成熟的时候我会的。
examples.en: I haven't told him yet, but I will when the time is right.

examples.ch: 她觉得是时候该离开了。
examples.en: She felt the time was right to leave.

examples.ch: 投资新技术的时机成熟了。
examples.en: The time is ripe for investing in new technology.

phrases.trans_en: sometimes, but not often

examples.ch: 我偶尔还会想起她。
examples.en: From time to time I still think of her.

phrases.trans_en: again and again

examples.ch: 她一次次地与不般配的男人陷入情感纠葛。
examples.en: Time after time she gets involved in relationships with the wrong men.

phrases.trans_en: very often

examples.ch: 我多次跟你说过——过马路之前要先看一看。
examples.en: I've told you time and time again - look before you cross the road.

phrases.trans_en: continuously

examples.ch: 在机场，要把行李一直带在你身边。
examples.en: When you're at the airport, you should make sure you have your luggage with you at all times.

phrases.trans_en: at or during any particular point or moment in the day

examples.ch: 该建筑任何时候都只允许一定数量的人员进入。
examples.en: Only a certain number of people are allowed in the building at any one time.

examples.ch: 对不起，我现在太忙了，不能帮你——我一次只能做一件事。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but I'm too busy to help you now - I can only do one thing at a time.

phrases.trans_en: sometimes

examples.ch: 要知道，你有时很令人恼火。
examples.en: You can be really annoying at times, you know.

phrases.trans_en: ever

examples.ch: 这里任何时候都不得停车。
examples.en: Parking is not allowed here at any time.

phrases.trans_en: on many occasions

examples.ch: 我已经告诉你许多次了，在借用我的衣服之前要先问一声。
examples.en: The times I've told you, ask before you borrow my clothes.

phrases.trans_en: in the past

examples.ch: 乔治‧艾略特曾一度住在这里。
examples.en: At one time, George Eliot lived here.

phrases.trans_ch: 领先时代的，超越时代的
phrases.trans_en: having new ideas, opinions, or ways of living long before most other people do
If something is before your time, it happened or existed before you were born or were old enough to remember it.

examples.ch: 我对甲壳虫乐队没有什么印象——那是我出生前的事。
examples.en: I don't remember the Beatles - they were before my time.

phrases.trans_en: said to mean that there was a period in the past when something used to happen or be true

examples.ch: 过去，你花6便士就能买到一条面包。
examples.en: Time was (when) you could buy a loaf of bread for sixpence.

phrases.trans_en: to spend a period of time in prison

examples.ch: 出狱后要找到工作可不容易。
examples.en: It's not always easy to find a job after you've done time.

defines.trans_ch: 确定…的时间，为…安排时间
defines.trans_en: to decide that something will happen at a particular time

examples.ch: 我们把旅行安排在表哥结婚的时候。
examples.en: We timed our trip to coincide with my cousin's wedding.

defines.trans_en: to arrange something so that it happens at the best possible time

examples.ch: 如果精心安排好出发的时间，你应该能够避开交通堵塞最严重的时段。
examples.en: If you time your departure carefully, you should be able to miss the worst of the traffic.

examples.ch: 女子少年篮球队完美地掌握时机，在比赛结束哨响前一刻投篮进球，赢得了这场比赛。
examples.en: The girls' basketball team won the game with a perfectly timed shot (= one played at exactly the right moment), just before the buzzer.

defines.trans_ch: 为…计时，测定…所需的时间
defines.trans_en: to measure how long it takes for something to happen or for someone to do something

examples.ch: 请你给我测一下游一个单程要花多少时间好吗？
examples.en: Will you time me to see how long it takes me to swim a length?

defines.trans_en: the stated period of time during the year, day, etc.

examples.ch: 春季
examples.en: springtime

examples.ch: 圣诞节的时候
examples.en: Christmas-time

examples.ch: 白天
examples.en: daytime

examples.ch: 夜晚
examples.en: night-time

defines.trans_en: to say something to someone, often giving them information or instructions

examples.ch: 那么跟我说说你的假期吧。
examples.en: Tell me about your holiday then.

examples.ch: 请问去图书馆怎么走？
examples.en: Can you tell me how to get to the library?

examples.ch: 你有没有跟任何人说起要来看我？
examples.en: Did you tell anyone (that) you were coming to see me?

examples.ch: “我要离开你，”她跟他说。
examples.en: "I'm leaving you," she told him.

examples.ch: 我叫她回家。
examples.en: I told her to go home.

examples.ch: 他给我们讲述了他不寻常的童年。
examples.en: He told us of his extraordinary childhood.

examples.ch: 我对你的帮助感激不尽。
examples.en: I can't tell you how grateful I am for your help (= I am extremely grateful).

defines.trans_en: to know, recognize, or be certain

examples.ch: “他是荷兰人。”“你怎么知道？”
examples.en: "He's Dutch." "How can you tell?"

examples.ch: 我看得出你当时很不高兴。
examples.en: I could tell (that) you were unhappy.

defines.trans_en: If something tells you something, it gives you information.

examples.ch: 这次调查给我们提供了有关青少年生活的什么信息？
examples.en: What does the survey tell us about the lives of teenagers?

defines.trans_en: to have an effect

examples.ch: 她最近压力很大，而且这已经开始让她吃不消了。
examples.en: She's been under a lot of stress recently and it's starting to tell.

phrases.trans_en: to say something/things that are not true

examples.ch: 她老是说谎。
examples.en: She's always telling lies.

phrases.trans_en: to tell the facts without hiding anything
If someone, usually a child, tells tales, they tell someone such as a teacher about something bad that someone else has done.

examples.ch: 阿尔文，如果你老是打小报告，你的同学会不信任你的。
examples.en: Your classmates won't trust you if you're always telling tales, Alvin.

phrases.trans_en: to speak honestly

examples.ch: 你怎么知道她讲的是实话？
examples.en: How do you know she's telling the truth?

phrases.trans_en: to be honest

examples.ch: 说实话，他说的我一点儿也听不懂。
examples.en: To tell (you) the truth, I didn't understand a word of what he was saying.

phrases.trans_en: to notice a difference in quality between two things

examples.ch: 这种咖啡的价格差不多是那种的一半，而你根本分辨不出它们有什么不同。
examples.en: This coffee is about half the price of that one and yet you really can't tell the difference.

phrases.trans_en: to say what will happen in someone's future

examples.ch: 集市上有一个算命的女人。
examples.en: At the fair, there was a lady who told your fortune.

phrases.trans_en: to be able to understand a clock

examples.ch: 我女儿刚刚学会看时间。
examples.en: My daughter has just learned to tell the time.

phrases.trans_en: there is no way of knowing

examples.ch: 不知道他们的未来会怎么样。
examples.en: There is no telling what the future will hold for them.

phrases.trans_en: said to mean that you can never know or be certain

examples.ch: 谁知道彼得和我将来会怎么样呢——谁也无法预料。
examples.en: Who knows what will happen to Peter and me in the future - you can never tell.

defines.trans_en: plural of tooth
an examination of opinions, behaviour, etc., made by asking people questions

examples.ch: 最近的一项调查表明，有58%的人不知道自己的心脏在什么位置。
examples.en: A recent survey found/revealed/showed that 58 percent of people did not know where their heart is.

examples.ch: 进行调查
examples.en: to conduct/carry out/do a survey

defines.trans_en: the measuring and recording of the details of an area of land

examples.ch: 地质勘测
examples.en: a geological survey

defines.trans_ch: （对某一专题的）概述，全面评述
defines.trans_en: a description of the whole of a subject

examples.ch: 他的新书概括介绍了19世纪的欧洲戏剧。
examples.en: His new book is a survey of European theatre in the 19th century.

defines.trans_en: an examination of the structure of a building by a specially trained person
to look at or examine all of something, especially carefully

examples.ch: 他下了车仔细检查受损的情况。
examples.en: He got out of the car to survey the damage.

examples.ch: 她已经写了一本详细评述女权运动史的书。
examples.en: She has written a book which surveys (= describes in detail) the history of feminism.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指为绘制地图而）测量，勘测，测绘
defines.trans_en: to measure an area of land, and to record the details of it, especially on a map

examples.ch: 在建设新铁路之前，其路线已经经过了仔细的测量。
examples.en: Before the new railway was built, its route was carefully surveyed.

defines.trans_en: If a building is surveyed, it is examined carefully by a specially trained person, in order to discover if there is anything wrong with its structure.
to ask people questions in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

examples.ch: 研究人员调查了2500名大学生的看法。
examples.en: The researchers surveyed the attitudes of 2,500 college students.

examples.ch: 许多接受调查的听众都说他们对这个电台的节目不满意。
examples.en: Many of the listeners surveyed said that they were not satisfied with the station's programming.

defines.trans_en: to begin doing something

examples.ch: 你什么时候开始你的课程／新工作？
examples.en: When do you start your course/your new job?

examples.ch: 我们将在6点钟开始（议程）。
examples.en: We'll be starting (the session) at six o'clock.

examples.ch: 星期一你能开始工作吗？
examples.en: Can you start (= begin a new job) on Monday?

examples.ch: 他们1月份动工盖这所房子。
examples.en: They started building the house in January.

examples.ch: 我刚开始写信，电话铃就响了。
examples.en: I'd just started to write a letter when the phone rang.

defines.trans_ch: （企业或其他机构）开业，开始运营;创办，开办
defines.trans_en: If a business or other organization starts, or if someone starts one, it is created and starts to operate.

examples.ch: 她创办了自己的软件公司。
examples.en: She started her own software company.

examples.ch: 这个地区有很多家新餐馆开业。
examples.en: A lot of new restaurants have started up in the region.

defines.trans_en: to begin to happen or to make something begin to happen

examples.ch: 一档新的野生动物节目已开始在每周一晚上播出。
examples.en: A new series about wildlife has started on Monday nights.

examples.ch: 警方认为这起火灾是有人蓄意纵火。
examples.en: Police believe the fire was started by arsonists.

defines.trans_en: to begin a set of activities with the thing or person mentioned

examples.ch: 讲演者讲述了她的中国之行作为开场白。
examples.en: The speaker started with a description of her journey to China.

examples.ch: 请一个接一个地回答我的问题，从露西开始。
examples.en: Give me your answers one by one, starting with Lucy.

examples.ch: 你开始时可以先给花坛除草。
examples.en: You could start by weeding the flowerbeds.

examples.ch: 他刚开始工作时是工程师，但后来做了老师。
examples.en: He started his working life as an engineer but later became a teacher.

defines.trans_ch: 开始抱怨;开始惹人厌烦
defines.trans_en: to begin to complain or be annoying in some way

examples.ch: 别烦人——我们不去，没的商量！
examples.en: Don't start with me - we're not going and that's that!

examples.ch: “如果理查德做了些工作就好了。”“噢，别提理查德了，说起来我就生气！”
examples.en: "It would help if Richard did some work." "Oh, don't get me started on Richard!"

defines.trans_ch: 出发;动身，启程;开始，（自…）起
defines.trans_en: to begin at one point and then move to another, in distance or range

examples.ch: 跑步活动的出发地点是公园大门口。
examples.en: The run starts at/from the entrance to the park.

examples.ch: 我们需要早点儿出发，因为路上需要6个小时。
examples.en: We'll need to start (off/out) early because the journey takes six hours.

examples.ch: 告诉我发生了什么事——从头说起。
examples.en: Tell me what happened - start at the beginning.

examples.ch: 票价80欧元起，最高500欧元。
examples.en: Ticket prices start at/from €80 and go up to €500.

defines.trans_en: to move your body suddenly because something has surprised or frightened you

examples.ch: 电话铃声把他吓了一跳。
examples.en: He started at the sound of the phone.

defines.trans_en: to (cause to) begin to work or operate

examples.ch: 我的车发动不起来。
examples.en: I'm having trouble starting the car.

examples.ch: 发动机启动不了。
examples.en: The engine won't start.

phrases.trans_en: to begin

examples.ch: 我们什么时候能开始？
examples.en: When can we get started?

phrases.trans_en: to have your first child
to begin an argument or a fight

examples.ch: 看得出这个家伙想挑事，于是我们就走开了。
examples.en: You could tell the guy wanted to start something, so we just walked away.

phrases.trans_en: to begin being employed

examples.ch: 他16岁开始在当地的一家面包房干活。
examples.en: He started work at 16 in a bakery.

phrases.trans_en: at the beginning, or as the first of several things

examples.ch: 起初我们在蒙特利尔只认识两个人，但很快就交到了朋友。
examples.en: We only knew two people in Montreal to start with, but we soon made friends.

examples.ch: 首先，我们需要更好的电脑——其次，我们需要更多的培训。
examples.en: To start with, we need better computers - then we need more training.

defines.trans_en: the beginning of something

examples.ch: 从一开始我们就对这个产品的效用抱有疑问。
examples.en: We were doubtful about the product's usefulness from the start.

examples.ch: 他们宣布创办一个新的企业。
examples.en: They announced the start of a new commercial venture.

examples.ch: 本周初天气不错。
examples.en: The weather was good at the start (= in the first part) of the week.

examples.ch: 活动开局不顺／不利，舞台灯光头几分钟就出了问题。
examples.en: The event got off to a shaky/poor start with the stage lights failing in the first few minutes.

defines.trans_en: the act of beginning to do something

examples.ch: 我们下星期需要开始准备小册子了。
examples.en: We need to make a start on (preparing) the brochure next week.

defines.trans_en: an advantage that you have over someone else when you begin something

examples.ch: 比赛开始时我们给年龄最小的孩子五秒钟让先。
examples.en: We gave the youngest children a five-second start (= in a race).

defines.trans_en: a sudden movement of the body that you make when something has surprised or frightened you

examples.ch: 他抖了一下，惊醒了。
examples.en: He woke with a start.

examples.ch: 我进去时她吓了一跳。
examples.en: She gave a start as I entered.

phrases.trans_en: including all of something, from the beginning to the end

examples.ch: 整个过程自始至终糟糕透了。
examples.en: The whole party was a disaster from start to finish.

phrases.trans_en: first, or as the first in a set of things

examples.ch: 我们先记下名字和电话号码，之后可以获取更多的细节。
examples.en: We'll take names and phone numbers for a start, then later on we can get more details.

phrases.trans_en: used when giving a first example of something

examples.ch: 这本书比她的上一部好。首先它短一些。
examples.en: This book is better than her last one. For a start, it's shorter.

defines.trans_en: in or within a short time; before long; quickly

examples.ch: 她很快就到。
examples.en: She'll soon be here./She'll be here soon.

examples.ch: 不久以后，外国人就不能进入这个国家了。
examples.en: It will soon be impossible for foreigners to enter the country.

examples.ch: 我们出发得越早，到那儿也就越早。
examples.en: The sooner we leave, the sooner we'll get there.

examples.ch: 同意去之后不久，她就意识到自己犯了一个错误。
examples.en: Soon after agreeing to go, she realized she'd made a mistake.

examples.ch: 我们什么时候能签订合同？
examples.en: How soon (= when) can we sign the contract?

examples.ch: “你想什么时候见面？”“越快越好。”
examples.en: "When would you like to meet?" "The sooner the better."

examples.ch: 我恨不得马上离开那个地方。
examples.en: I couldn't get out of that place soon enough.

phrases.trans_en: at the same time or a very short time after

examples.ch: 我一看到她就知道出事了。
examples.en: As soon as I saw her, I knew there was something wrong.

phrases.trans_en: If you do something as soon as possible, you do it as quickly as you can.

examples.ch: 我们需要尽快修好。
examples.en: We need the repairs done as soon as possible.

defines.trans_en: a device that releases drops of water through a lot of very small holes and that you stand under to wash your whole body

examples.ch: 淋浴器坏了——你得用浴缸洗澡了。
examples.en: The shower is broken - you'll have to have a bath.

examples.ch: 英国的许多家庭都在浴缸龙头上安装了淋浴器。
examples.en: Many British homes have a shower attachment fixed to the bath taps.

examples.ch: 浴帘／浴帽
examples.en: a shower curtain/cap

defines.trans_en: an acting of washing using a shower

examples.ch: 我们出去之前我还有时间冲个澡吗？
examples.en: Do I have time to have a shower before we go out?

defines.trans_en: a place, usually in a bathroom, where a shower is situated

examples.ch: 他现在正在冲澡。让他给你回电话好吗？
examples.en: He's in the shower at the moment. Do you want him to call you back?

defines.trans_en: a short period of rain or snow

examples.ch: 一阵阵的雨、冰雹和雨夹雪
examples.en: showers of rain, hail and sleet

examples.ch: 你都湿透了！你赶上那阵雨了吗？
examples.en: You're soaked! Did you get caught in the shower?

examples.ch: 全国大部分地区将有雷阵雨／寒冷的阵雨。
examples.en: There will be thundery/wintry showers over many parts of the country.

examples.ch: 周末将有阵雪。
examples.en: Snow showers are expected at the end of the week.

defines.trans_ch: （为即将结婚或分娩的妇女举行的）送礼会
defines.trans_en: a party held for a woman just before she gets married or gives birth to a child, when she is given presents for her future home or baby

examples.ch: 我买了最漂亮的婴儿服去参加杰西孩子的送礼会。
examples.en: I bought the cutest baby clothes to take to Jacey's baby shower.

examples.ch: 我们昨天去参加了我表妹的新娘送礼会。
examples.en: We went to my cousin's bridal shower yesterday.

phrases.trans_ch: 一大批，一连串（从天而降的小颗粒物或液滴）
phrases.trans_en: a lot of small objects or drops of liquid coming through the air

examples.ch: 一声巨响，闪过一片火花。
examples.en: There was a bang and a shower of sparks.

examples.ch: 管道爆裂了，喷出一阵水花。
examples.en: The pipe burst, sending out a shower of water.

phrases.trans_en: a large amount of something

examples.ch: 她从同事那里得到了大量的赞美。
examples.en: She received a shower of praise from her colleagues.

defines.trans_en: to fall down or come out in a shower, or to make something do this

examples.ch: 我听到了巨大的爆炸声，几秒钟后，玻璃碎片纷纷散落在我们身上。
examples.en: I heard a massive explosion, and seconds later fragments of glass were showering (= falling) down on us.

examples.ch: 她用力晃动酒瓶，向我们喷洒香槟。
examples.en: She shook the bottle violently and showered us with champagne.

defines.trans_en: to take a shower

examples.ch: 我每天早上都要洗个淋浴。
examples.en: I shower every morning.

defines.trans_en: the part of every 24-hour period when it is dark because there is very little light from the sun

examples.ch: 夜间天气转凉。
examples.en: It gets cold at night.

examples.ch: 我昨晚睡得很不好。
examples.en: I slept really badly last night.

examples.ch: 我在特德家里过的夜。
examples.en: I spent the night at Ted's.

examples.ch: 他搭乘了夜班渡轮／火车。
examples.en: He took the night ferry/train.

defines.trans_ch: 晚上（指傍晚至就寝前的时段）
defines.trans_en: the period of time between the late afternoon and going to bed; the evening

examples.ch: 我们周六晚上出去玩好吗？
examples.en: Let's go out on Saturday night.

examples.ch: 我们这个星期每天晚上都出去吃饭。
examples.en: We've eaten out every night this week.

examples.ch: 她晚上在酒吧唱歌，白天则从事秘书工作。
examples.en: She's a singer in a bar by night and a secretary by day.

defines.trans_en: the evening on which a special event happens

examples.ch: 你什么时候演最后一场？
examples.en: When's the last night of your show?

examples.ch: 她的新电影的首映相当成功。
examples.en: The first/opening night of her new movie was a great success.

phrases.trans_ch: （通常为儿语或对孩子说的）晚安
phrases.trans_en: used as another way of saying good night, usually by or to children
on one evening recently

examples.ch: 我前几天晚上在健身房见到了娜奥米。
examples.en: I saw Naomi at the gym the other night.

phrases.trans_en: an evening spent at a restaurant, theatre, etc. rather than staying at home

examples.ch: 我这个周末需要跟女生朋友们出去玩一玩。
examples.en: I need a night out with the girls this weekend.

examples.ch: 我们星期六晚上出去玩吧。
examples.en: Let's have a night out on Saturday.

defines.trans_ch: （晚上与人分别时礼貌地道别用语）晚安
defines.trans_en: a friendly way of saying goodbye when you leave someone in the evening or before going to bed or to sleep

examples.ch: 甜心，晚安！好好睡！
examples.en: Night, sweetheart! Sleep well!

defines.trans_en: the part of the day from the time when the sun rises or you wake up until the middle of the day or lunch time

examples.ch: 美丽的／阳光明媚的／多雨的上午
examples.en: a beautiful/sunny/wet morning

examples.ch: 我每周在书店工作3个上午。
examples.en: I work three mornings a week at the bookshop.

examples.ch: 她只在上午工作。
examples.en: She only works in the mornings.

examples.ch: 我们今天上午有什么安排？
examples.en: What's our schedule for this morning?

examples.ch: 请把时间约定在明天上午。
examples.en: I'd like an appointment for tomorrow morning, please.

examples.ch: 我星期六上午见你。
examples.en: I'll see you on Saturday morning.

examples.ch: 我在萨拉的聚会上喝得太多，第二天上午觉得很难受。
examples.en: I had too much to drink at Sarah's party, and I felt terrible the morning after.

phrases.trans_en: during the early part of the day

examples.ch: 我早晨听广播。
examples.en: I listen to the radio in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: at some time between twelve o'clock at night and twelve o'clock in the middle of the day

examples.ch: 谋杀发生在凌晨4点。
examples.en: The murder took place at four in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: the next morning

examples.ch: 她说第二天早上见你。
examples.en: She said she would see you in the morning.

defines.trans_en: a friendly way of greeting people when you meet them in the morning

examples.ch: 苏，早上好！你今天好吗？
examples.en: Morning, Sue! How are you today?

defines.trans_en: used, usually as the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to the person speaking or writing

examples.ch: 有我的一份吗？
examples.en: Is there one for me?

examples.ch: 她给了我一些钱。
examples.en: She gave me some money.

examples.ch: 你能把那本书递给我吗？
examples.en: Could you pass me that book?

examples.ch: 不是我主动要去，是夏洛特。
examples.en: It wasn't me who offered to go, it was Charlotte.

defines.trans_en:
the musical note 
mi

defines.trans_ch: 慢性疲劳综合征（myalgic encephalomyelitis的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for myalgic encephalomyelitis: an illness, sometimes lasting for several years, in which a person's muscles and joints (= places where two bones are connected) hurt and they are generally very tired

defines.trans_ch: （美国）缅因州（写地址时Maine的缩写）
defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for the US state of Maine: used in addresses
to like another adult very much and be romantically and sexually attracted to them, or to have strong feelings of liking a friend or person in your family

examples.ch: 我爱你。
examples.en: I love you.

examples.ch: 昨晚他告诉我说他爱我。
examples.en: Last night he told me he loved me.

examples.ch: 我只爱过一个男人。
examples.en: I've only ever loved one man.

examples.ch: 我确信他爱他的孩子们。
examples.en: I'm sure he loves his kids.

defines.trans_en: to like something very much

examples.ch: 她喜欢动物。
examples.en: She loves animals.

examples.ch: 我特别爱吃巧克力。
examples.en: I absolutely love chocolate.

examples.ch: 他非常喜欢自己的工作。
examples.en: He really loves his job.

examples.ch: 我喜欢滑雪。
examples.en: I love skiing.

examples.ch: 你喜欢也好，讨厌也罢，真人秀电视节目已成了一种气候。
examples.en: Love it or hate it, reality TV is here to stay.

phrases.trans_en: used, often in requests, to say that you would very much like something

examples.ch: 如果你在沏咖啡，我也想要一杯。
examples.en: I'd love a cup of coffee if you're making one.

examples.ch: 她非常想开一家属于自己的公司。
examples.en: She would dearly love to start her own business.

examples.ch: 下星期我想请你来吃晚饭。
examples.en: I'd love you to come to dinner next week.

examples.ch: 下星期我想请你来吃晚饭。
examples.en: I'd love for you to come to dinner next week.

defines.trans_en: the feeling of liking another adult very much and being romantically and sexually attracted to them, or strong feelings of liking a friend or person in your family

examples.ch: “我和他交往一年多了。”“是恋爱吗？”
examples.en: "I've been seeing him over a year now." "Is it love?"

examples.ch: 孩子们需要得到极大的关爱。
examples.en: Children need to be shown lots of love.

examples.ch: “下星期我要去看劳拉。”“喔，请代我向她问好。”
examples.en: "I'm seeing Laura next week." "Oh, please give her my love" (= tell her I am thinking about her with affection).

examples.ch: 玛吉让我问你和孩子们好。
examples.en: Maggie asked me to send her love to you and the kids (= tell you that she is thinking about you with affection).

examples.ch: 最近你的感情生活怎么样？
examples.en: How's your love life (= your romantic and/or sexual relationships) these days?

defines.trans_en: a person that you love and feel attracted to

examples.ch: 他是我一生的挚爱。
examples.en: He was the love of my life.

examples.ch: 她是我的初恋情人。
examples.en: She was my first love.

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示友好的称呼）亲爱的
defines.trans_en: used as a friendly form of address

examples.ch: 你看起来很累，亲爱的。
examples.en: You look tired, love.

examples.ch: 正好4英镑，亲爱的。
examples.en: That'll be four pounds exactly, love.

defines.trans_en: used before your name at the end of letters, cards, etc. to friends or family

examples.ch: 圣诞节见，爱你的凯特。
examples.en: See you at Christmas. Love, Kate.

defines.trans_en: strong liking for

examples.ch: 我不像男友那样喜欢烹饪。
examples.en: I don't share my boyfriend's love of cooking.

defines.trans_en: something that you like very much

examples.ch: 音乐是她最大的爱好之一。
examples.en: Music is one of her greatest loves.

defines.trans_en: (in tennis) the state of having no points

examples.ch: 目前的比分为40比0。
examples.en: The score now stands at 40–love.

phrases.trans_en: to love someone in a romantic and sexual way

examples.ch: 我是第一次谈恋爱，感觉非常奇妙。
examples.en: I'm in love for the first time and it's wonderful.

examples.ch: 他们依然疯狂地爱着对方。
examples.en: They're still madly in love (with each other).

phrases.trans_en: to start to love someone romantically and sexually

examples.ch: 我20岁的时候第一次谈恋爱。
examples.en: I was 20 when I first fell in love.

defines.trans_en: to give attention to someone or something in order to hear him, her, or it

examples.ch: 你听哪一类的音乐？
examples.en: What kind of music do you listen to?

examples.ch: 她一直在说——我只是坐在那里听。
examples.en: She does all the talking - I just sit and listen.

examples.ch: 我说的话你一个字都没听！
examples.en: You haven't listened to a word I've said!

examples.ch: 宣读死者的名字时我们都默默地听着。
examples.en: We listened in silence as the names of the dead were read out.

examples.ch: 听着，我们确实需要在本周末解决我们的保险索赔问题。
examples.en: Listen, we really need to submit our insurance claim this weekend.

examples.ch: 听听这个！只要回答出3个简单的问题你就有可能赢得法国南部双人度假游。
examples.en: Listen to this! You can win a car just by answering three simple questions.

defines.trans_en: a written message from one person to another, usually put in an envelope and sent by post

examples.ch: 今天早晨我收到了一封银行的来函。
examples.en: I got a letter from the bank this morning.

defines.trans_en: any of the set of symbols used to write a language, representing a sound in the language

examples.ch: 字母D
examples.en: the letter D

phrases.trans_en: the exact words of the law and not its more important general meaning

defines.trans_ch: （美国）标准信纸（长11英寸，宽8.5英寸）
defines.trans_en: used to refer to a standard size of paper in the US, 8.5 inches by 11 inches

examples.ch: 印传单的纸一般是标准信纸或法律规格纸。
examples.en: Fliers are usually printed either on letter size or legal size paper.

defines.trans_en: the regular work that a person does to earn money

examples.ch: 临时的／固定的工作
examples.en: a temporary/permanent job

examples.ch: 大学毕业后她在一家出版公司当编辑。
examples.en: When she left college, she got a job as an editor in a publishing company.

examples.ch: 一边抚育两个孩子一边做全职工作很困难。
examples.en: It's very difficult trying to bring up two children while doing a full-time job.

examples.ch: 他从来没能保住一份稳定的工作。
examples.en: He's never managed to hold down (= keep) a steady (= permanent) job.

examples.ch: 她已向一家保险公司求职。
examples.en: She's applied for a job with an insurance company.

examples.ch: 你有了小孩后会放弃工作吗？
examples.en: Are you going to give up your job when you have your baby?

examples.ch: 由于任职的第一个月表现很糟，许多人开始怀疑新总统是否胜任。
examples.en: After a disastrous first month in office, many people are beginning to wonder if the new president is up to (= able to do) the job.

examples.ch: 成百上千的工人可能会失业。
examples.en: Hundreds of workers could lose their jobs.

defines.trans_en: a particular piece of work

examples.ch: 施工人员打算在月末前将活儿干完。
examples.en: The builders are aiming to get the job done by the end of the month.

examples.ch: 他一下午都在家里干杂活儿。
examples.en: He spent the afternoon doing jobs around the house.

examples.ch: 你能把买来的东西都用自行车带回家吗，是不是还得用汽车？
examples.en: Will you be able to carry all the shopping back home on your bike, or will it have to be a car job (= will you need the car)?

defines.trans_en: something that is your responsibility

examples.ch: 她认为自己身为政治家就是要做自己政党和选民的代言人。
examples.en: She believed her job as a politician was to represent the views of her party and the people who voted for her.

examples.ch: 我知道不该由我来告诉你如何生活，但我的确认为你犯了错。
examples.en: I know it's not my job to tell you how to run your life, but I do think you've made a mistake.

defines.trans_en: a problem or an activity that is difficult

examples.ch: 把自行车轮子卸下来可真费劲儿。
examples.en: It was a real job getting the wheel off the bike.

examples.ch: 我们考试的时间只有1小时，我好不容易才做完。
examples.en: We were only given an hour for the exam, and I had a job finishing it.

defines.trans_en: an example of a particular type

examples.ch: 这是原件，不是仿制品。
examples.en: It's an original, not one of those imitation jobs.

defines.trans_en: a crime in which money or goods are stolen, or an action or activity that is dishonest or unpleasant

examples.ch: 他因抢劫银行被判入狱5年。
examples.en: He was put in prison for five years for doing a bank job.

examples.ch: 他的确耍了她，告诉她自己会永远爱她，后来却和别人一起跑到斐济去了。
examples.en: He really did a job on her, telling her that he would always love her and then moving to Fiji with someone else.

phrases.trans_en: without a job

examples.ch: 你没有工作已有多久了？
examples.en: How long have you been out of a job?

defines.trans_en: a period of 60 minutes

examples.ch: 考试持续了一个半小时。
examples.en: The exam lasted an hour and a half.

examples.ch: 1天有24小时。
examples.en: There are 24 hours in a day.

examples.ch: 你需要睡多少个小时？
examples.en: How many hours' sleep do you need?

examples.ch: 我会在一小时／两小时之后回来。
examples.en: I'll be back in an hour's/two hours' time (= after one/two hours).

examples.ch: 我家乡离休斯顿有一小时的路程。
examples.en: My hometown is an hour from Houston/an hour away (= it takes an hour to travel there).

examples.ch: 他拿的是按小时计酬的工资。
examples.en: He gets paid by the hour (= gets a particular amount of money for each hour he works).

examples.ch: 火车每小时整点发车。
examples.en: Trains leave every hour on the hour (= at exactly one o'clock, two o'clock, etc.).

examples.ch: 公共汽车每整点过10分／差10分发一班车。
examples.en: Buses leave at ten minutes past/to the hour (= at ten past/to one o'clock, two o'clock, etc.).

examples.ch: 宣战时间是晚上6点。
examples.en: War was declared at eighteen hundred hours/18.00 hours (= at six o'clock in the evening).

defines.trans_ch: （用于做某事的）时间;（商店或公共场所）开放时间
defines.trans_en: the period of time when a particular activity happens or when a shop or public building is open

examples.ch: 我试着把午餐时间用在步行上。
examples.en: I try to spend my lunch hour walking.

examples.ch: 办公／工作时间
examples.en: office/working hours

examples.ch: 我们的开放时间是8点到6点。
examples.en: Our opening hours are from 8.00 to 6.00.

defines.trans_ch: （白天或夜里的）某个时间，某个时刻
defines.trans_en: a particular time during the day or night

examples.ch: 谁会在夜里这么晚给我们打电话？
examples.en: Who could be calling us at this unearthly/ungodly hour (= so late at night)?

examples.ch: 他凌晨才回来。
examples.en: He returned in the early/small hours (= at night, after midnight).

phrases.text: work long, regular, unsocial, etc. hours
phrases.trans_ch: 长时间工作／工作时间规律／在其他人不上班的时间工作（等等）
phrases.trans_en: used to describe how many hours in the day you work or what part of the day you work

examples.ch: 她是名护士，所以经常要上早班、值夜班。
examples.en: She's a nurse so she often works unsocial hours.

examples.ch: 他薪水很高，可是工作时间也很长。
examples.en: He's paid well but he works long hours.

phrases.trans_en: for a very long time

examples.ch: 我等了他很长时间。
examples.en: I waited for him for hours.

phrases.text: at all hours (of the day and night)
phrases.trans_ch: 整天不断地;昼夜不停地
phrases.trans_en: repeatedly during the day and the night

examples.ch: 他们整天不停地给我打电话。
examples.en: They keep calling me at all hours (of the day and night).

defines.trans_en: a building where you pay to have a room to sleep in, and where you can sometimes eat meals

examples.ch: 四星级酒店
examples.en: a four-star hotel

examples.ch: 克拉伦登酒店
examples.en: the Clarendon Hotel

examples.ch: 我们住在一家滨海酒店。
examples.en: We stayed in/at a hotel on the beach.

examples.ch: 宾馆的客人
examples.en: hotel guests

defines.trans_en: a building where alcoholic drinks can be bought and drunk and where food is often available
a restaurant
work that teachers give their students to do at home

examples.ch: 做完家庭作业之后你才能看电视。
examples.en: You can't watch TV until you've done your homework.

examples.ch: 历史／地理家庭作业
examples.en: history/geography homework

defines.trans_en: the house, apartment, etc. where you live, especially with your family

examples.ch: 这位参议员有两个家——一个是位于华盛顿的公寓，另一个是科罗拉多的家。
examples.en: The senator has two homes - an apartment in Washington and a house in Colorado.

examples.ch: 他在大街上住了3个月了，他的家就是一个纸板箱。
examples.en: He was living on the streets for three months, and his home was a cardboard box.

examples.ch: 4点之后打家里的电话找我。
examples.en: Call me at home after four o'clock.

examples.ch: 决定留在家里带孩子的妇女
examples.en: women who decide to stay at home and look after their children

examples.ch: 他23岁时离家独立生活。
examples.en: He left home (= stopped living with his parents) when he was 23.

examples.ch: 越来越多的伴侣不结婚就组成家庭。
examples.en: More and more couples are setting up home together without getting married.

defines.trans_en: a house, apartment, etc. when it is considered as property that you can buy or sell

examples.ch: 豪华住宅／作为过渡房而买的第一所小房子
examples.en: luxury/starter homes

defines.trans_en: the type of family you come from

examples.ch: 我们有一个幸福的家庭。
examples.en: We had a happy home.

examples.ch: 来自离异家庭的孩子
examples.en: children from a broken home (= from a family in which the parents had separated)

defines.trans_en: a place where people or animals live and are cared for by people who are not their relations or owners

examples.ch: 孤儿院／养老院／流狼狗收容所
examples.en: a children's home/an old people's home/a dogs' home

examples.ch: 他的幼年时期在孤儿院度过。
examples.en: He spent his early years in a home.

defines.trans_en: someone's or something's place of origin, or the place where a person feels they belong

examples.ch: 我住在伦敦，但我出生在希腊。
examples.en: I live in London, but my home (= where I was born) is in Greece.

examples.ch: 我实际上出生在新西兰，但我在香港住了这么久，现在感觉就像我的故乡一样了。
examples.en: I was actually born in New Zealand, but I've lived in Hong Kong for so long that it feels like home now.

defines.trans_en: your own country or your own area

examples.ch: 她爱法国，但是她想念自己的国家。
examples.en: She loves France, but she misses home.

examples.ch: 在我们国家，这叫做猪油饼。
examples.en: At home we call this "lardy cake".

examples.ch: 我纳闷他们在国内做什么。
examples.en: I wonder what they're doing back at home.

phrases.trans_en: If a sports team are/play at home, they play on their own sports field.

defines.trans_en: at or to your house or the place where you live

examples.ch: 别担心，我很快就回家了。
examples.en: Don't worry, I'll be home soon.

examples.ch: 对不起他现在不在家。
examples.en: I'm sorry, he's not home right now.

examples.ch: 孩子们独自在家。
examples.en: The kids were home alone.

examples.ch: 她决定放弃，回家了。
examples.en: She decided to give up and go home.

examples.ch: 他破晓时回到家。
examples.en: He came home as the dawn was breaking.

examples.ch: 乔西疲倦了，所我我们把他带回了家。
examples.en: Josh was tired so we took him home.

examples.ch: 我带了一两本书回家看。
examples.en: I took home a couple of books to read.

examples.ch: 晚会结束后我会把所有人都带回家。
examples.en: I'll bring everyone home after the party.

examples.ch: 当你回家晚时，就不想还要煮饭了。
examples.en: When you get home late you don't feel like cooking.

examples.ch: 我希望你昨晚回家时一路安全？
examples.en: I hope you made it home safely last night?

examples.ch: 决定留在家里带孩子的妇女
examples.en: women who decide to stay home and care for their children

defines.trans_en: in or to the country or area where you come from

examples.ch: 我们祈祷我们的军队都能平安回国。
examples.en: We pray all our troops will come home safely.

examples.ch: 我纳闷他们在国内在做什么。
examples.en: I wonder what they're doing back home.

examples.ch: 在家乡我们把这叫做果冻。
examples.en: Back home we call this jelly.

defines.trans_en: relating to the house, flat, etc. where someone lives

examples.ch: 住所拥有权
examples.en: home ownership

examples.ch: 居家改善／维护
examples.en: home improvements/maintenance

examples.ch: 住房价格
examples.en: home prices

defines.trans_en: done at home, or intended to be used at home

examples.ch: 家庭烹饪
examples.en: home cooking

examples.ch: 家酿啤酒
examples.en: home-brewed beer

examples.ch: 家庭用计算机
examples.en: a home computer

examples.ch: 家庭电话号码
examples.en: my home telephone number

defines.trans_en: relating to your family or your life at home

examples.ch: 他的家庭生活影响了他的工作。
examples.en: His home life is affecting his work.

examples.ch: 家庭困难的学生
examples.en: students who have a difficult home situation

defines.trans_en: connected with or done in your own country

examples.ch: 他的书在本国市场很畅销，可在国外却没有什么读者。
examples.en: His books were a success in his home country/market, but failed to find an audience abroad.

defines.trans_en: relating to the place where a team is based and plays a lot of its games

examples.ch: 主队／东道主
examples.en: the home team/side

examples.ch: 主场
examples.en: a home ground

examples.ch: 主场比赛
examples.en: a home match/game

examples.ch: 主场队服
examples.en: the home strip (= clothing worn by a team when they play a home match)

examples.ch: 主场优势
examples.en: home advantage (= the improved chance of success that playing at home gives to a team)

defines.trans_ch: （尤指奇怪少见的一类）衣服，装束
defines.trans_en: a set of clothes, especially strange and unusual ones

examples.ch: 他穿着竖条纹西装和宽领带，像是黑手党的装束。
examples.en: He was in some kind of Mafia get-up, with a pinstriped suit and wide tie.

defines.trans_en: the part of the day between the end of the afternoon and night

examples.ch: 寒冷的夜晚
examples.en: a chilly evening

examples.ch: 我在一家饭店工作，每周只有一个晚上歇班。
examples.en: I work in a restaurant and only get one evening off a week.

examples.ch: 多谢你让我度过了一个如此美妙的夜晚。
examples.en: Thank you for such an enjoyable evening.

examples.ch: 我总是在星期五晚上去看电影。
examples.en: I always go to see a movie on Friday evenings.

examples.ch: 每到晚上，我喜欢放松一下。
examples.en: In the evenings, I like to relax.

examples.ch: 今晚我要加班。
examples.en: I'm working late this evening.

examples.ch: 明天晚上你要做什么？
examples.en: What are you doing tomorrow evening?

examples.ch: 傍晚大雨倾盆而下，几乎下了一整夜。
examples.en: It poured down all evening and most of the night as well.

examples.ch: 你晚上通常几点到家？
examples.en: What time do you usually get home in the evening?

defines.trans_en: a friendly way of greeting someone when you meet them in the evening

examples.ch: 晚上好，汤姆！你今天晚上去哪里？
examples.en: Evening, Tom! Where are you off to this evening?

defines.trans_en: a large vehicle in which people are driven from one place to another

examples.ch: 如果你想看风景，应该乘公共汽车去。
examples.en: You should take the bus/go by bus (= travel by bus) if you want to see the sights.

defines.trans_ch: （计算机中的）总线，其不同输出线路向计算机各部件传送数据
defines.trans_en: a set of wires in a computer along which information can be sent to and from other parts of the computer
to take people somewhere by bus

examples.ch: 示威者乘车从全国各地来参加抗议集会。
examples.en: Demonstrators were bussed in from all parts of the state to attend the protest rally.

defines.trans_en: to take children by bus to school in another area every day
an object with short pieces of stiff hair, plastic, or wire attached to a base or handle, used for cleaning, arranging your hair, or painting

examples.ch: 我找不到发刷，不过我还有梳子。
examples.en: I can't find my brush, but I still have my comb.

examples.ch: 你需要用硬刷子把锈迹刷掉。
examples.en: You'll need a stiff brush to scrape off the rust.

examples.ch: 衣服刷
examples.en: a clothes brush

examples.ch: 硬毛刷
examples.en: a scrubbing (US scrub) brush

examples.ch: 软毛刷
examples.en: a pastry brush

defines.trans_en: used as a combining form

examples.ch: 发刷
examples.en: a hairbrush

examples.ch: 牙刷
examples.en: a toothbrush

examples.ch: 油漆刷
examples.en: a paintbrush

defines.trans_en: an act of cleaning with a brush

examples.ch: 这些鞋子需要好好刷一下。
examples.en: These shoes need a good brush.

examples.ch: 出门前别忘了梳一下头发。
examples.en: Don't forget to give your hair a brush before you go out.

defines.trans_en: a quick, light touch

examples.ch: 他感觉到她的手轻擦过自己的手。
examples.en: He felt the brush of her hand on his.

defines.trans_en: small, low bushes or the rough land they grow on

examples.ch: 我们看见一只长耳大野兔躲在灌木丛中。
examples.en: We spotted a jackrabbit hidden in the brush.

examples.ch: 干旱的天气增加了灌木丛着火的危险。
examples.en: The dry weather has increased the risk of brush fires.

defines.trans_en:
→ 
brushwood
the tail of a fox

phrases.trans_en: a situation in which you experience something, or almost experience something, especially something unpleasant

examples.ch: 吉姆在高速公路上差点丧命。
examples.en: Jim had a brush with death (= was nearly killed) on the motorway.

examples.ch: 那是你第一次和警察打交道吗？
examples.en: Was that your first brush with the law (= experience of being in trouble with the police)?

defines.trans_en: to touch (something) quickly and lightly or carelessly

examples.ch: 夏洛特离开房间时轻轻碰了他一下。
examples.en: Charlotte brushed against him (= touched him quickly and lightly with her arm or body) as she left the room.

examples.ch: 他的嘴唇轻触了一下她的脸颊后便离去了。
examples.en: His lips gently brushed her cheek and he was gone.

defines.trans_en: to move something somewhere using a brush or your hand

examples.ch: 杰姬把头发从她眼睛上拨开。
examples.en: Jackie brushed the hair out of her eyes.

examples.ch: 他拭去一滴泪水。
examples.en: He brushed away a tear.

examples.ch: 她站起来，拉了拉弄皱了的裙子。
examples.en: She stood up and brushed the wrinkles from her dress.

defines.trans_en: to clean something or make something smooth with a brush

examples.ch: 她想知道他上次是什么时候刷的牙。
examples.en: When did he last brush his teeth, she wondered.

examples.ch: 她一下一下有规律地梳着头。
examples.en: She brushed her hair with long, regular strokes.

examples.ch: 我的裤子上沾满了泥，不过幸运的是我能够把它们刷干净。
examples.en: My trousers got covered in mud, but luckily I was able to brush them clean.

defines.trans_ch: 最好的；最出色的；最优秀的
defines.trans_en: of the highest quality, or being the most suitable, pleasing, or effective type of thing or person

examples.ch: 这是我吃过的最好的一餐。
examples.en: This is the best meal I've ever had.

examples.ch: 他是我们最优秀的学生之一。
examples.en: He's one of our best students.

examples.ch: 你肯定这是做这事的最佳方法吗？
examples.en: Are you sure this is the best way of doing it?

examples.ch: 哪条路去他们家最方便？
examples.en: What's the best (= shortest or quickest) way to get to their house?

examples.ch: 你父母只想把最好的给你。
examples.en: Your parents only want what is best for you.

examples.ch: 她是我最好的朋友。
examples.en: She was my best friend (= the friend I liked most).

examples.ch: 最好早点儿赶到超市。
examples.en: It's best (= it is wise) to get to the supermarket early.

defines.trans_en: in the most suitable, pleasing, or satisfactory way, or to the greatest degree

examples.ch: 晚会哪天晚上举行对你最合适？
examples.en: Which evening would suit you best for the party?

examples.ch: 大峡谷日落时最美。
examples.en: The Grand Canyon is best seen at sunset.

examples.ch: 他不知道自己最喜欢哪一个。
examples.en: He couldn't decide which one he liked best (= preferred).

defines.trans_ch: （以 good 或 well 开头的形容词的最高级）
defines.trans_en: to the greatest degree when used as the superlative of adjectives beginning with "good" or "well"

examples.ch: 他们是舞会上衣着最华丽的一对。
examples.en: They were the best-dressed couple at the party.

examples.ch: 他被选为好莱坞最英俊的男演员。
examples.en: He was voted the best-looking (= most attractive) actor in Hollywood.

phrases.trans_en: as well as you can

examples.ch: 这段文章确实很难，不过你尽力翻译就可以了。
examples.en: It is a difficult passage, but just translate it as best you can.

defines.trans_en: the most excellent in a group of things or people

examples.ch: 我的品位很简单——我只喜欢最好的。
examples.en: My tastes are simple - I only like the best.

examples.ch: 他想让自己的孩子们享受到最好的一切——上好学校，住漂亮房子，还有去国外旅行。
examples.en: He wanted the best for his children - good schools, a nice house, and trips abroad.

examples.ch: 我喜欢希区柯克所有的电影，不过我认为《美人计》是最棒的一部。
examples.en: I like all of Hitchcock's films, but I think "Notorious" is the best.

examples.ch: 克里斯和我是最好的朋友。
examples.en: Chris and I are the best of friends (= we are very close friends).

phrases.trans_en: used at the end of a friendly message or letter before writing your name

examples.ch: 我下周初来电约你吃午饭。迫不及待地想见到你。祝好，贝斯·莫里斯
examples.en: I'll call you early next week to set up a lunch date. Can't wait to meet you. Best, Beth Morris

phrases.trans_ch: （用于告别或信末祝福）祝一切顺利！
phrases.trans_en: used to say goodbye, or to end a letter to someone you know well, or to send good wishes to someone

examples.ch: 祝你父母万事如意!
examples.en: All the best to your parents!

phrases.trans_en: even when considered in the most positive way

examples.ch: 这种食品往好了说，是清淡无味，往差了说，则根本不能吃。
examples.en: The food was bland at best, and at worst completely inedible.

phrases.trans_en: at the highest standard that can be achieved

examples.ch: 这部纪录片是调查性新闻报道的最佳范例。
examples.en: The documentary was an example of investigative journalism at its best.

phrases.trans_en: to be as active or intelligent as you can be

examples.ch: 上午我不在最佳状态。
examples.en: I'm not at my best in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: this is the most pleasing thing

examples.ch: 那儿有丰盛的食物，热情的伙伴，最棒的是还有一支爵士乐队。
examples.en: There was wonderful food, good company, and, best of all, a jazz band.

phrases.trans_en: used to wish someone success before a test, etc. or a difficult activity

examples.ch: 祝你期终考试好运！
examples.en: Best of luck on your finals!

examples.ch: 祝你期终考试好运！
examples.en: Best of luck with your finals!

examples.ch: 我们祝你搬到法国之后一切顺利。
examples.en: We would like to wish you the (very) best of luck on/with your move to France.

phrases.trans_en: In a sport such as tennis, if you play the best of a particular number of games, you play that number of games and the winner is the player who wins the greatest number of those games.

examples.ch: 我们打五局三胜好吗？
examples.en: Shall we play the best of five?

phrases.trans_en: to make the greatest effort possible

examples.ch: 即使失败了也没关系，只要你尽了力就行。
examples.en: It doesn't matter if you fail, just do your best.

phrases.trans_en: If you have had the best of something, you have enjoyed the most pleasant part of it, and everything that is left is worse.

examples.ch: 我想我们已经度过了今年夏天最舒服的日子。
examples.en: I think we've already had the best of the hot weather this summer.

phrases.text: to the best of your ability
phrases.trans_en: as well as you can

examples.ch: 只要你尽力工作就行了。
examples.en: Just do the job to the best of your ability.

phrases.text: to the best of my knowledge/belief
phrases.trans_en: from what I know and understand from the information that I have

examples.ch: 据我所知，那些被发现的化学品没有危险性。
examples.en: To the best of my knowledge, the chemicals which were found are not dangerous.

phrases.trans_en: If an action is for the best, it is done to improve a situation or produce a good result, although it might seem unpleasant at the time.

examples.ch: 结束一段感情总是很难的，但这样做终究会对你有好处的。
examples.en: Ending a relationship is always hard but in this case it's for the best.

phrases.trans_ch: 尽可能善用（不令人满意的处境）
phrases.trans_en: to make an unsatisfactory situation as pleasant as possible

examples.ch: 我们得在这地方住一夜，所以还是将就一下吧。
examples.en: We'll have to spend the night here, so we might as well make the best of it.

defines.trans_en: to defeat someone in a fight or competition

examples.ch: 仅仅两个回合他就击败了对手。
examples.en: He bested his opponent in just two rounds.

defines.trans_en:
I form of
be

examples.ch: 包括我吗？
examples.en: Am I included?

defines.trans_en: used when referring to a time between twelve o'clock at night and twelve o'clock in the middle of the day

examples.ch: 第一轮的选举结果预计在凌晨1点钟左右揭晓。
examples.en: The first election results are expected around 1 a.m.

defines.trans_ch: 调幅（电台的广播方式之一，amplitude modulation的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for amplitude modulation: a type of radio broadcasting in which the strength of the signal changes, producing sound of a lower quality than FM

examples.ch: 您正在收听的是黄金广播电台，全天24小时调幅909播出。
examples.en: You're listening to Radio Gold, broadcasting 24 hours a day on 909 AM.

defines.trans_ch: 威尔士议会议员（Assembly Member的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for Assembly Member: a person who has been elected to the Welsh Assembly
every one (of), or the complete amount or number (of), or the whole (of)

examples.ch: 所有动物都必须吃东西才能生存。
examples.en: All animals have to eat in order to live.

examples.ch: 她有4个孩子，都不到5岁。
examples.en: She has four children, all under the age of five.

examples.ch: 全体演员都在台上站成一排向观众鞠躬。
examples.en: The cast all lined up on stage to take their bow.

examples.ch: 你把牛奶都喝光了？
examples.en: Have you drunk all (of) the milk?

examples.ch: 你把它全喝光了？
examples.en: Have you drunk it all?

examples.ch: 鸡蛋都破了。
examples.en: All the eggs got broken.

examples.ch: 现在钱全都是我的了！
examples.en: Now the money's all mine!

examples.ch: 我的朋友全都同意。
examples.en: All my friends agree.

examples.ch: 整整一天／星期我都在设法联系你。
examples.en: I've been trying all day/week to contact you.

examples.ch: 她把2000英镑藏在了床底下，贼全都给偷走了。
examples.en: She had £2,000 under the bed and the thieves took it all.

examples.ch: 我不得不使出浑身解数劝她同意。
examples.en: I had to use all my powers of persuasion to get her to agree.

examples.ch: 你还记得去年我们跟警察闹出的那一堆麻烦事儿吗？
examples.en: Remember all that trouble we had with the police last year?

examples.ch: 只要他幸福就行了——那是最重要的。
examples.en: So long as he's happy - that's all that matters (= the most important thing).

examples.ch: 我需要的不过是一个栖身之处和一顿饱饭。
examples.en: All (= the only thing) I need is a roof over my head and a decent meal.

examples.ch: 法官命令所有人退出法庭，只留下她自己和证人。
examples.en: The judge cleared the court of all but (= everyone except) herself and the witness.

examples.ch: 你为什么老是对我怒气冲冲的？
examples.en: Why do you get so angry with me all the time (= very often)?

examples.ch: 你这么大老远赶来接我，真是太感谢了。
examples.en: It's very kind of you to come all the way to meet me.

phrases.trans_ch: 总的说来，从各方面来说；总之
phrases.trans_en: considering all the different parts of the situation together

examples.ch: 总的说来，我觉得你做得很不错。
examples.en: All in all, I think you've done very well.

phrases.trans_ch: （提意见或批评时用来缓和语气）我只是觉得
phrases.trans_en: used when you make a comment or criticism, so that it seems less severe or is less likely to offend someone

examples.ch: 我只是觉得结尾处可以稍微短一点儿。
examples.en: All I'm saying is I think the end part could have been a little shorter.

examples.ch: 我只是觉得我们应该尽力而为。
examples.en: We should do our best, that's all I'm saying.

phrases.trans_en: the only and small amount or number of something you have

examples.ch: 她尚在襁褓之中的时候双亲就过世了，因此我是她唯一的亲人。
examples.en: Her parents died when she was a baby, so I was all the family she ever had.

defines.trans_en: completely

examples.ch: 昨晚蛋糕全都吃完了。
examples.en: The cake was all eaten last night.

examples.ch: 楼下的房间全都粉刷成了绿色和蓝色。
examples.en: The downstairs rooms were painted all in greens and blues.

examples.ch: 宝宝弄得身上都是饭。
examples.en: The baby got food all over her dress.

examples.ch: 不要因为她的缘故而伤心烦恼。
examples.en: Don't let her get you all upset.

examples.ch: 她跑遍全城到处找你。
examples.en: She's been all over town looking for you.

examples.ch: 你周末发生的事我全都听说了！
examples.en: I've been hearing all about your weekend!

examples.ch: 有段日子我们确实过得很艰难，但是现在一切都过去了。
examples.en: We had a difficult time but it's all over now.

examples.ch: 公主一个人孤零零地住在森林深处。
examples.en: The princess lived all alone/by herself in the middle of the forest.

defines.trans_en: used after a number to mean that both teams or players in a game have equal points

examples.ch: 到中场时，比分仍然是4平。
examples.en: The score at half-time was still four all.

phrases.trans_en: almost

examples.ch: 我们到那儿时，比赛差不多要结束了。
examples.en: The game was all but over by the time we arrived.

examples.ch: 我差不多要放弃你了。
examples.en: I'd all but given up on you.

phrases.trans_en: in every way

examples.ch: 从哪方面说这都是笔极其糟糕的生意。
examples.en: It was a ghastly business all round.

examples.ch: 这一天过得真好，十全十美。
examples.en: It's been a good day all around.

phrases.text: all the better, stronger, more exciting, etc.
phrases.trans_en: even or much better, stronger, more exciting, etc.

examples.ch: 喝下饮料后她感觉好多了。
examples.en: She felt all the better for the drink.

examples.ch: 我已经减了10磅，现在感觉身体更健康了。
examples.en: I've lost ten pounds and I feel all the fitter for it.

defines.trans_ch: （用在很多名词前，构成形容词）每，各种，全部
defines.trans_en: used in front of many nouns to form adjectives meaning "every", "every type of", or "the whole of" that particular thing

examples.ch: 通宵营业的酒吧
examples.en: an all-night bar (= a bar that is open for the whole night)

defines.trans_ch: （用在很多形容词和现在分词前）所有，任何
defines.trans_en: used in front of many adjectives and present participles to mean "everything" or "everyone"

examples.ch: 包括所有费用的价格
examples.en: an all-inclusive price

examples.ch: 攻无不克的军队
examples.en: all-conquering armies

defines.trans_ch: （用在很多名词和形容词前）完全，十分
defines.trans_en: used in front of many nouns and adjectives to mean "completely"

examples.ch: 纯棉短袜
examples.en: all-cotton socks (= socks that are made completely of cotton)

examples.ch: 做调味汁时，不要忘了加上最重要的配料——新鲜的罗勒。
examples.en: When cooking the sauce, don't forget that all-important (= most or very important) ingredient, fresh basil.

examples.ch: 你相信存在一个全能的神吗？
examples.en: Do you believe in an all-powerful god (= one with unlimited power)?

defines.trans_en: the period that starts at about twelve o'clock or after the meal in the middle of the day and ends at about six o'clock or when the sun goes down

examples.ch: 那是一个阳光明媚的下午。
examples.en: It was a sunny afternoon.

examples.ch: 她每周在图书馆工作3个下午。
examples.en: She works three afternoons a week at the library.

examples.ch: 那是在一个星期六的下午。
examples.en: It was on a Saturday afternoon.

examples.ch: 我的宝宝通常在下午睡一觉。
examples.en: My baby usually sleeps in the afternoon.

examples.ch: 我们今天下午去公园吧。
examples.en: Let's go to the park this afternoon.

examples.ch: 我昨天下午跟她说过话。
examples.en: I spoke to her yesterday afternoon.

examples.ch: 我将在明天下午3点半左右和你见面。
examples.en: I'll meet you tomorrow afternoon at about 3.30.

examples.ch: 她将在周三下午到这儿来。
examples.en: She's coming round on Wednesday afternoon.

examples.ch: 他整个下午心情都不好。
examples.en: He's been in a bad mood all afternoon.

examples.ch: 她喜欢在下午小睡一会儿。
examples.en: She likes to have an afternoon nap.

examples.ch: 我们乘坐的是下午一两／三四／五六点钟的飞机。
examples.en: We got an early-/mid-/late-afternoon flight.

defines.trans_en: a friendly way of greeting someone when you meet them in the afternoon

examples.ch: 下午好，鲍勃！
examples.en: Afternoon, Bob!

defines.trans_ch: （时间、地点或顺序）在…之后;（一个）接着（一个）
defines.trans_en: following in time, place, or order

examples.ch: 我们吃过早饭去散步吧。
examples.en: Let's go for a walk after breakfast.

examples.ch: 一些人相信死后灵魂依然存在。
examples.en: Some people believe in life after death.

examples.ch: 名单上她的名字排在我后面。
examples.en: Her name came after mine on the list.

examples.ch: 后天有一部不错的电影。
examples.en: There's a good film on the day after tomorrow.

examples.ch: 她一直等到后半夜很晚的时候。
examples.en: She waited until well after midnight.

examples.ch: 4点1刻了。
examples.en: It's a quarter after four.

examples.ch: 她日复一日地工作下去。
examples.en: She just keeps on working, day after day, week after week (= continuously).

examples.ch: 我们一次又一次地开会讨论这个问题。
examples.en: We've had meeting after meeting (= many meetings) to discuss this point.

examples.ch: 与迈克尔的孩子们比起来，杰西显得很矮小。
examples.en: Jessie seemed very small after (= in comparison with) Michael's children.

examples.ch: 我什么都为你做了，你就这样对待我吗？
examples.en: After (= despite) everything I've done for you, is this the way you treat me?

examples.ch: 她对我做出这种事情，我再也不会信任她了。
examples.en: After (= because of) what she did to me, I'll never trust her again.

examples.ch: 孩子们必须意识到，自己弄乱了东西，就得自己收拾整齐。
examples.en: The children have to learn to tidy up after themselves (= after they have made things untidy).

examples.ch: 她随手砰地关上了门。
examples.en: She slammed the door after (= behind) her.

examples.ch: 我们去追他，但是他逃脱了。
examples.en: We ran after (= followed) him, but he escaped.

examples.ch: 请你离开时锁好门好吗？
examples.en: Could you lock up after you (= when you leave), please?

defines.trans_en: typical of or similar to the style of

examples.ch: 一幅模仿提香的画作
examples.en: a painting after Titian

examples.ch: 模仿莫扎特风格的协奏曲
examples.en: a concerto after Mozart

defines.trans_en: used when giving someone or something the same name as another person or thing

examples.ch: 他以祖父的名字命名为马克。
examples.en: He was named Mark after his grandfather.

phrases.trans_en: to be looking for someone or something or trying to find or get him, her, or it

examples.ch: 警察正在追捕他。
examples.en: The police are after him.

examples.ch: 我要找一条和这件衬衫相配的领带。
examples.en: I'm after a tie to go with this shirt.

examples.ch: 我敢肯定她在打我丈夫的主意。
examples.en: I'm sure she's after my husband.

examples.ch: 他想抢简的工作。
examples.en: He's after Jane's job (= wants it for himself).

phrases.trans_ch: （用于让别人先走或先用饮食）你先请
phrases.trans_en: used to say politely that someone can go in front of you or serve themselves with food before you

examples.ch: “我给你倒点咖啡吧？”“噢，不用，你先来吧。”
examples.en: "Can I pour you some coffee?" "Oh no, after you."

defines.trans_en: later than someone or something else

examples.ch: 希拉里中午到了这儿，随后不久尼克也到了。
examples.en: Hilary got here at midday and Nick arrived soon after.

examples.ch: 下星期我去不了，下下星期怎么样？
examples.en: I can't go next week - how about the week after (= the following week)?

examples.ch: 她4点半回来的，随后就去看望埃米莉了。
examples.en: She got back at 4.30 and went to see Emilie after (= after she got back).

defines.trans_en: at a time that is later than another event

examples.ch: 他们搬出去3个月了，这座房子仍然空着。
examples.en: Three months after they moved out, the house was still empty.

examples.ch: 我们出发不久，车子就发出奇怪的噪音。
examples.en: Soon/shortly after we set off, the car started to make a strange noise.

examples.ch: 离开你以后我马上／立刻就去了邮局。
examples.en: I went to the post office straight/immediately after I left you.

defines.trans_en: coming after

examples.ch: 宴会后的讲话
examples.en: an after-dinner speech

examples.ch: 深夜营业的夜总会
examples.en: an after-hours club

examples.ch: 售后服务
examples.en: after-sales service

defines.trans_en: the day of the week after Friday and before Sunday

examples.ch: 他星期六动身。
examples.en: He's leaving on Saturday.

examples.ch: 大部分足球比赛都在星期六进行。
examples.en: Most football matches are played on Saturdays.

examples.ch: 聚会下个星期六举行。
examples.en: The party is next Saturday.

examples.ch: 上周六我们出去吃了一顿饭。
examples.en: We went out for a meal last Saturday.

examples.ch: 乔尔出生在一个星期六。
examples.en: Joel was born on a Saturday.

examples.ch: 星期六上午／下午／傍晚／晚上
examples.en: Saturday morning/afternoon/evening/night

defines.trans_ch: 偷工减料建成的，用劣质材料草草建成的
defines.trans_en: built quickly and badly using cheap materials
for what reason

examples.ch: “我要回家了。”“为什么？”
examples.en: "I'm going home." "Why?"

examples.ch: 你为什么选择在伦敦生活？
examples.en: Why did you choose to live in London?

examples.ch: 为什么要等？我们现在就走吧。
examples.en: Why wait? Let's leave now.

examples.ch: 我为什么要帮他——他从来都没帮过我？
examples.en: Why should I help him - he never helps me?

examples.ch: 为什么我觉得巧克力如此让人上瘾呢？
examples.en: Why is it that I find chocolate so addictive?

examples.ch: 警方要我解释为什么没有及时报告这起事故。
examples.en: The police asked me to explain why I hadn't reported the accident sooner.

examples.ch: 我不知道为什么她没在这儿。
examples.en: I don't know why she isn't here.

examples.ch: 他今天为什么不在这里真是个谜。
examples.en: Quite why he isn't here today is a mystery.

examples.ch: 我们没有理由不成功。
examples.en: There is no reason why we shouldn't succeed.

defines.trans_ch: 哟，嗨，哎呀（表示惊讶或生气）
defines.trans_en: used to express surprise or anger

examples.ch: 哟，这不是老乔吉‧弗雷泽吗？
examples.en: Why, if it isn't old Georgie Frazer!

examples.ch: 哇，我从没见过这样的事！
examples.en: Why, I've never seen anything like it!

phrases.trans_en: the reasons for something

examples.ch: 我根本不知道是什么原因导致出现了这种情况。
examples.en: I know very little about the whys and the wherefores of the situation.

defines.trans_en: a wooden musical instrument with four strings that is held against the neck and played by moving a bow across the strings
a brass musical instrument consisting of a metal tube with one narrow end, into which the player blows, and one wide end. Three buttons are pressed in order to change notes.
(of a large animal, especially an elephant) to produce a loud call

examples.ch: 我们可以听见远处大象的吼声。
examples.en: We could hear the elephants trumpeting in the distance.

defines.trans_en: to announce or talk about something proudly to a lot of people

examples.ch: 该博物馆一直在大肆吹嘘自己是世界上最好的博物馆之一。
examples.en: The museum has been loudly trumpeting its reputation as one of the finest.

examples.ch: 他们极力吹嘘的“一降再降”活动只包括他们所卖商品的5%。
examples.en: Their much-trumpeted "low low prices" affect only five percent of the goods that they sell.

defines.trans_ch: 在当时（过去或未来）（的）;在那时（的）
defines.trans_en: (at) that time (in the past or in the future)

examples.ch: 那时我在城里工作。
examples.en: I was working in the city then.

examples.ch: 我希望住在城里，可我当时的丈夫想住在乡下。
examples.en: I wanted to live in the city, but my then husband (= the man who was my husband at that time) preferred the country.

examples.ch: 下周给我吧——我只有到那时才有时间看。
examples.en: Give it to me next week - I won't have time to read it before/until then.

examples.ch: 我明天会给你打电话——到那时我应该知道详情了。
examples.en: I'll call you tomorrow - I should have the details by then.

defines.trans_en: next or after that

examples.ch: 让我把这工作做完，我们再走。
examples.en: Let me finish this job, then we'll go.

examples.ch: 把那封信给她看，然后她就会明白了。
examples.en: Give her the letter to read, then she'll understand.

defines.trans_en: in addition

examples.ch: 这是普通版，另外还有价钱比较贵的豪华版。
examples.en: This is the standard model - then there's the deluxe version which costs more.

defines.trans_ch: 这么说来，那么，既然如此
defines.trans_en: as a result; in that case; also used as a way of joining a statement to an earlier piece of conversation

examples.ch: 现在休息一会儿，这样的话今晚你就不会那么累了。
examples.en: Have a rest now, and then you won't be so tired tonight.

examples.ch: 这么说你要卖掉你的房子？
examples.en: You'll be selling your house, then?

defines.trans_en: to move through water by moving the body or parts of the body

examples.ch: 我们一整天都呆在海滩上，但天气太冷，不能游泳。
examples.en: We spent the day on the beach but it was too cold to go swimming.

examples.ch: 她的目标是横渡英吉利海峡。
examples.en: Her ambition is to swim (across) the English Channel.

examples.ch: 我今天早上游了两英里。
examples.en: I swam two miles this morning.

defines.trans_en: (of an object) to seem to move around

examples.ch: 因为起身太猛，她一时间觉得整个房子似乎都在旋转。
examples.en: Getting up too suddenly made the room swim before her eyes.

defines.trans_en: If your head swims, you feel confused and are unable to think or see clearly.

examples.ch: 两三杯酒下肚之后，我就开始觉得头晕了。
examples.en: After the second or third drink, my head began to swim.

phrases.trans_en: If food is swimming in/with a liquid, it has too much of that liquid in it or on it.

examples.ch: 色拉里的油太多了。
examples.en: The salad was swimming in oil.

defines.trans_en: a time when you swim

examples.ch: 我们今天下午去游泳吧。
examples.en: Let's go for/have a swim this afternoon.

defines.trans_en: to say words, to use the voice, or to have a conversation with someone

examples.ch: 请你再慢点说，好吗？
examples.en: Would you mind speaking more slowly, please?

examples.ch: “请问丹在吗？”
examples.en: "Can I speak to Dan please?"

examples.ch: “请问斯科特在吗？”
examples.en: "Can I speak with Scott please?"

examples.ch: “我就是。”
examples.en: "Speaking." (= This is Scott.)

examples.ch: 如果他把我说的话告诉朱莉，我就再也不和他说话。
examples.en: If he tells Julie what I said, I'll never speak to him again.

examples.ch: 她谈起了父亲过世带给她的悲伤。
examples.en: She spoke of her sadness over her father's death.

examples.ch: 她对新导演的评价很高。
examples.en: She speaks very highly of (= says good things about) the new director.

examples.ch: 我肯定能来，可我不能确定我妻子能不能来。
examples.en: I can certainly come but I can't speak for my wife (= I can't tell you whether she can or not).

examples.ch: 谁将为被告辩护？
examples.en: Who is going to speak for (= represent in a court of law) the accused?

examples.ch: 他已经到了能发表自己看法的年龄。
examples.en: He's old enough to speak for himself (= to say what he thinks).

examples.ch: 我和艾娃一起去的——说起艾娃，你见过她的新发型了吗？
examples.en: I went with Ava - speaking of (= on the subject of) Ava, have you seen her new haircut?

examples.ch: 我们应邀参加了雷切尔和杰米的婚礼——说起这个，你知道他们要搬到纽约去吗？
examples.en: We've been invited to Rachel and Jamie's wedding - speaking of which, did you know that they're moving to New York?

examples.ch: 作为4个孩子的母亲，我可以这么说，孩子真会让人筋疲力尽。
examples.en: Speaking as (= with my experience as) a mother of four, I can tell you that children are exhausting.

examples.ch: 苏说话带美国口音。
examples.en: Sue speaks with an American accent.

examples.ch: 你为什么说话这么小声？
examples.en: Why are you speaking in a whisper (= very quietly)?

examples.ch: 足有5分钟的时间，他俩谁都没说话。
examples.en: For five whole minutes, neither of them spoke a word (= they both said nothing).

defines.trans_en: to (be able to) talk in a language

examples.ch: 他法语说得很流利。
examples.en: He speaks fluent French.

examples.ch: 你会说几种外语？
examples.en: How many foreign languages do you speak?

examples.ch: 我初到那里的时候，一句西班牙语都不会说。
examples.en: I couldn't speak a word of (= I did not know any) Spanish when I got there.

examples.ch: 我无法理解他们说的是什么语言。
examples.en: I couldn't figure out what language they were speaking.

defines.trans_en: to give a formal talk to a group of people

examples.ch: 今天晚上的辩论谁发言？
examples.en: Who is speaking in the debate tonight?

examples.ch: 每年圣诞节女王都会在电视上向全国发表讲话。
examples.en: The Queen speaks to the nation on television every Christmas.

examples.ch: 珍妮特发言支持这项动议，而彼得却打算表示反对。
examples.en: Janet is speaking for the motion (= trying to persuade the people listening that the idea is good) and Peter is speaking against (it) (= trying to persuade them that it is bad).

defines.trans_en: to show or express something without using words

examples.ch: 她没有说话，不过她的眼神流露出了对他的真实感情。
examples.en: She was silent, but her eyes spoke her real feelings for him.

examples.ch: 整个抢劫事件表明罪犯掌握了内情。
examples.en: The whole robbery spoke of (= made it seem that there had been) inside knowledge on the part of the criminals.

phrases.trans_ch: （表示看问题的角度）大体上说／从历史的角度看／严格地说（等等）
phrases.trans_en: talking from a particular point of view

examples.ch: 从历史的角度说，那个岛很值得关注。
examples.en: Historically speaking, the island is of great interest.

examples.ch: 总的来说，这是一所不错的学校。
examples.en: Generally speaking, it's a good school.

examples.ch: 严格地说，我应该向警方告发这件事。
examples.en: Strictly speaking (= if I behave according to the rules), I should report it to the police.

phrases.trans_en: to tell someone that they have done something wrong

examples.ch: 经理答应说，她会告诫当事人的。
examples.en: The manager promised that she would speak to the person responsible.

defines.trans_ch: （用于构成名词，指某一领域或行业的特殊用语）…术语，…行话
defines.trans_en: used to form nouns to mean the special language used in a particular subject area or business

examples.ch: 计算机术语
examples.en: computer-speak

examples.ch: 营销术语
examples.en: marketing-speak

defines.trans_en: to make musical sounds with the voice, usually a tune with words

examples.ch: 在学校音乐会上，孩子们演唱了舒伯特的两首歌曲。
examples.en: The children sang two songs by Schubert at the school concert.

examples.ch: 我们很早就被鸟儿的鸣唱声唤醒。
examples.en: We were woken early by the sound of the birds singing.

examples.ch: 你祖母想让你给她唱首歌。
examples.en: Your grandmother would like you to sing for/to her.

examples.ch: 你能为我们唱首歌吗?
examples.en: Will you sing us a song/sing a song to us?

examples.ch: 她每天晚上唱歌哄孩子入睡。
examples.en: She sang her baby to sleep every night.

examples.ch: 帕瓦罗蒂本周将在拉斯卡拉剧院扮演歌剧《波希米亚人》中的鲁道夫。
examples.en: Pavarotti is singing Rodolfo (= singing the part of Rodolfo) in "La Bohème" at La Scala this week.

examples.ch: 请你大声点儿唱。
examples.en: You need to sing up (= sing louder).

defines.trans_en: to make or be filled with a (high) ringing sound

examples.ch: 一颗子弹从士兵头顶嗖的一声飞过。
examples.en: A bullet sang past the top of the soldier's head.

defines.trans_en: to make it possible for something to be seen

examples.ch: 给你看看我刚买的这本新书。
examples.en: Let me show you this new book I've just bought.

examples.ch: 在这张地图上，城区用灰色表示。
examples.en: On this map, urban areas are shown in grey.

examples.ch: 你应该让医生看看那些皮疹。
examples.en: You ought to show that rash to your doctor.

examples.ch: 为什么不让我看你手里的东西？
examples.en: Why won't you show me what's in your hand?

examples.ch: 秘密拍摄的录像中出现了王子和王妃接吻的画面。
examples.en: The secretly filmed video shows the prince and princess kissing.

examples.ch: 这些照片显示了这种化学品对树木的影响。
examples.en: These photographs show the effects of the chemical on the trees.

examples.ch: 他开始出现了好转的迹象。
examples.en: He began to show signs of recovery.

examples.ch: “我这里有一枚维多利亚时代金币。”“真的吗？让我看看。”
examples.en: "This is a Victorian gold coin." "Is it? Show me (= allow me to see it)."

defines.trans_ch: 记录，显示（数字或测量值）
defines.trans_en: to record or express a number or measurement

examples.ch: 右面的刻度盘显示温度，左面的刻度盘显示气压。
examples.en: The right-hand dial shows the temperature, and the left-hand one shows the air pressure.

examples.ch: 该公司去年亏损了200万英镑。
examples.en: The company showed a loss of $2 million last year.

examples.ch: 最新的犯罪数据表明，入室盗窃案急剧增加。
examples.en: The latest crime figures show a sharp rise in burglaries.

defines.trans_en: to explain something to someone, by doing it or by giving instructions or examples

examples.ch: 你能教我如何设置DVD播放机吗?
examples.en: Can you show me how to set the DVD player?

examples.ch: 这本词典包括许多说明单词实际用法的例子。
examples.en: This dictionary contains many examples that show how words are actually used.

examples.ch: 你能告诉我去公共汽车站怎么走吗？
examples.en: Could you show me the way to the bus station?

defines.trans_en: to prove something or make the truth or existence of something known

examples.ch: 她已经证明了自己是一个非常有能力的管理者。
examples.en: She has shown herself (to be) a highly competent manager.

examples.ch: 他的日记表明他一直是一个极不自信的人。
examples.en: His diaries show him to have been an extremely insecure person.

examples.ch: 日记表明他曾经极不自信。
examples.en: The diaries show (that) he was very insecure.

examples.ch: 证明给我看，让我可以相信你。
examples.en: Show me (that) I can trust you.

examples.ch: 我们的研究表明，我们对这种疾病知之甚少。
examples.en: Our research has shown (us) how little we know about this disease.

defines.trans_en: to express ideas or feelings using actions or words

examples.ch: 他发现表达爱意很难。
examples.en: He finds it difficult to show affection.

examples.ch: 她把他从火里救出来时，表现出了极大的勇气。
examples.en: She showed enormous courage when she rescued him from the fire.

examples.ch: 你应该对你的父母更尊重一些。
examples.en: You should show your parents more respect/show more respect to your parents.

defines.trans_ch: 显眼;容易看到（或注意到）
defines.trans_en: to be easy to see or notice

examples.ch: “啊，不好，我把葡萄酒洒到夹克上了！”“没事儿，看不出来。”
examples.en: "Oh no, I've spilled red wine on my jacket!" "Don't worry, it doesn't show."

examples.ch: 不管她在想什么，她都从不表现出来。
examples.en: Whatever she's thinking, she never lets it show.

examples.ch: 我已把这些涂鸦粉刷过两遍了，可是仍然能看出来。
examples.en: I've painted over the graffiti twice, but it still shows through.

examples.ch: 血液检验不会发现这些药物，因为只需极小的剂量它就能发挥作用。
examples.en: The drug does not show up in blood tests because it is effective in very small quantities.

examples.ch: 我们搬进去时，那房子已有20年没有装修过了，这能看得出来。
examples.en: When we moved in, the house hadn't been decorated for 20 years, and it showed.

defines.trans_ch: 展出，展览，陈列（艺术作品）
defines.trans_en: to make an artist's work available for the public to see

examples.ch: 我们的目的是方便不知名的年轻艺术家展出他们的作品。
examples.en: Our aim is to make it easier for young unknown artists to show their work.

defines.trans_en: If a cinema or television station shows a film or programme, or if a film or programme is showing somewhere, you can see it there.

examples.ch: 这是该电影首次在电视上播出。
examples.en: It's the first time this movie has been shown on television.

examples.ch: 各大影院正在上映！
examples.en: Now showing at a cinema near you!

defines.trans_en:
to 
show up informal
to take someone somewhere by going there with them

examples.ch: 你能领桑切斯博士去起居室吗?
examples.en: Could you show Dr Sanchez into the living room?

examples.ch: 服务员领我们到餐桌前。
examples.en: The waiter showed us to our table.

defines.trans_en: to fail to hide something, or to make it possible to see or know something that is not intended to be seen or known

examples.ch: 你的衬衫太薄，里面的胸罩都透出来了。
examples.en: Your shirt's so thin that it shows your bra.

examples.ch: 浅色地毯不耐脏。
examples.en: Light-coloured carpets show the dirt.

examples.ch: 他考试未获通过，这恰恰表明他的老师们有多么糟糕。
examples.en: His failure in the exams shows (up) just how bad his teachers are.

defines.trans_en: to make someone understand something by directing their attention to it

examples.ch: 你能指给我看哪里疼吗?
examples.en: Can you show me where it hurts?

examples.ch: 指给我看你想要哪一个。
examples.en: Show me which one you want.

phrases.trans_ch: 显出老态;显出真实年龄
phrases.trans_en: to look as old as you really are

examples.ch: 最近，他真的开始显出老态了。
examples.en: Recently, he's really starting to show his age.

defines.trans_en: a theatre performance or a television or radio programme that is entertaining rather than serious

examples.ch: 电台节目／电视节目／舞台演出
examples.en: a radio/television/stage show

examples.ch: 智力竞赛／游戏节目
examples.en: a quiz/game show

examples.ch: 我们星期六为什么不去伦敦看场演出呢？
examples.en: Why don't we go to London on Saturday and see a show?

examples.ch: 我们得筹集6万英镑来上演该剧。
examples.en: We had to raise £60,000 to stage the show.

examples.ch: 我们在杰米的生日聚会上看了一场木偶戏。
examples.en: We had a puppet show for Jamie's birthday party.

defines.trans_en: an event at which a group of related things are available for the public to look at

examples.ch: 时装／花卉展
examples.en: a fashion/flower show

examples.ch: 车展上展出了一些令人惊叹的新车型。
examples.en: There were some amazing new cars at the motor show.

examples.ch: 他们在美国国家艺术博物馆为他举行了一次作品回顾展。
examples.en: They put on a retrospective show of his work at the National Museum of American Art.

defines.trans_en: an action that makes other people know what your feelings, beliefs, or qualities are

examples.ch: 管理层和工人们团结一致，共同反对关闭工厂。
examples.en: In a show of solidarity, the management and workers have joined forces to campaign against the closure of the factory.

examples.ch: 100多辆军车列队驶过首都以展示实力。
examples.en: Over 100 military vehicles paraded through the capital in a show of strength.

defines.trans_en: an appearance of something that is not really sincere or real

examples.ch: 尽管在公众面前表现得很团结，实际上王室和其他家庭一样也存在着分歧。
examples.en: Despite its public show of unity, the royal family had its share of disagreements just like any other.

examples.ch: 他们假装很感兴趣，但我认为其实并非如此。
examples.en: They put on a show of being interested, but I don't think they really were.

defines.trans_en: an activity, business, or organization, considered in relation to who is managing it

examples.ch: 梅格退休后谁来负责此事？
examples.en: Who will run the show when Meg retires?

examples.ch: 婚礼是他们的事——让他们按自己的方式办吧。
examples.en: The wedding is their show - let them do it their way.

defines.trans_en: a small amount of blood and mucus (= thick liquid) that comes out of the vagina at the start of labour (= the process of giving birth)

examples.ch: 见红
examples.en: the bloody show

phrases.trans_en: Something that is on show has been made available for the public to look at.

examples.ch: 她的雕塑作品将会在博物馆中展览至月底。
examples.en: Her sculptures will be on show at the museum until the end of the month.

phrases.trans_en: an activity or piece of work that appears to be done with great, little, etc. effort

examples.ch: 尽管她没有获胜，但的确表现不俗。
examples.en: She may not have won, but she certainly put up a good show.

phrases.trans_en: Something that is for show has no practical value and is used only to improve the appearance of something else.

examples.ch: 电话上的灯是有什么实际用处呢，还是仅仅作为装饰？
examples.en: Do the lights on this phone have any useful function or are they just/only for show?

defines.trans_en: the dry solid part of the earth's surface, or any large piece of this that sticks up out of the ground or the sea

examples.ch: 山和悬崖都是由岩石构成的。
examples.en: Mountains and cliffs are formed from rock.

examples.ch: 船在海湾外撞上了一块礁石，沉没了。
examples.en: The boat struck a rock outside the bay and sank.

defines.trans_en: a piece of rock or stone

examples.ch: 示威者向警察投掷石块。
examples.en: The demonstrators were hurling rocks at the police.

defines.trans_en: slang for a valuable stone used in jewellery, especially a diamond

examples.ch: 你看见他结婚周年纪念时送给她的钻石有多大了吗？
examples.en: Have you seen the size of the rock he gave her for their anniversary?

defines.trans_en: a type of popular music with a strong, loud beat that is usually played with electric guitars and drums

examples.ch: 摇滚乐队
examples.en: a rock group

examples.ch: 摇滚歌星
examples.en: a rock star

phrases.trans_en: a line of large stones sticking up from the sea

examples.ch: 暴风雨致使这艘轮船触礁。
examples.en: The storm forced the ship onto the rocks.

defines.trans_en: to (cause someone or something to) move backwards and forwards or from side to side in a regular way

examples.ch: 他抱起了婴儿轻轻摇着哄她入睡。
examples.en: He picked up the baby and gently rocked her to sleep.

examples.ch: 你坐在那把椅子上要是往后摇，椅子会散架的。
examples.en: If you rock back on that chair, you're going to break it.

defines.trans_ch: 使剧烈震动;使猛烈摇动
defines.trans_en: If a person or place is rocked by something such as an explosion, the force of it makes the person or place shake.

examples.ch: 这次爆炸使整座城市剧烈震动，致使300人丧生。
examples.en: The explosion, which rocked the city, killed 300.

defines.trans_en: If an event rocks a group of people or society, it causes feelings of shock.

examples.ch: 总经理的辞职震惊了整个公司。
examples.en: The managing director's resignation rocked the whole company.

defines.trans_ch: 因穿戴而显得好看（或时髦）
defines.trans_en: to wear a particular style of clothing, etc. and look good or fashionable

examples.ch: 有的名流已经40多岁了，但是刺上一个纹身依然显得时髦。
examples.en: There are celebrities over 40 years old who can still rock a tattoo.

defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for
prime minister

examples.ch: 首相想见你。
examples.en: The PM wants to see you.

defines.trans_ch: 项目经理（project manager 的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for 
project manager

examples.ch: 谁是这个项目的经理？
examples.en: Who's PM on this project?

defines.trans_en: abbreviation for private message: a message sent on a social media website that only the person it is sent to can see

examples.ch: 我昨天给你发了一条私信，你收到了吗？
examples.en: I sent you a PM yesterday. Did you get it?

defines.trans_en: abbreviation for private message: to send someone a private message on a social media website
