examples.ch: 有问题的话，私信我。
examples.en: PM me if you have any questions.

defines.trans_en: a large musical instrument with a row of black and white keys that are pressed to play notes

examples.ch: 我们准备买一架新钢琴。
examples.en: We're buying a new piano.

examples.ch: 我会弹钢琴。
examples.en: I play the piano.

examples.ch: 她以前在一支爵士乐队演奏钢琴。
examples.en: She used to play piano in a jazz band.

examples.ch: 这支曲子是为钢琴谱写的。
examples.en: The music was written for piano.

examples.ch: 我们合唱了那支歌，帕特用钢琴伴奏。
examples.en: We all joined in the song, with Pat at the piano/on piano.

defines.trans_en: a coloured liquid that is put on a surface such as a wall to decorate it

examples.ch: 一罐漆
examples.en: a tin of paint

examples.ch: 一罐漆
examples.en: a can of paint

examples.ch: 这面墙需要再刷一层漆。
examples.en: This wall needs another coat of paint.

examples.ch: 牌子上写着：“小心，油漆未干！”
examples.en: The sign said "Caution! Wet paint."

examples.ch: 亮光漆
examples.en: gloss paint

examples.ch: 亚光漆
examples.en: matt paint

examples.ch: 亚光漆
examples.en: matte paint

examples.ch: 有这么多种油漆可供选择，我很难决定买哪一种。
examples.en: There were so many paints (= types of paint) to choose from that I couldn't decide which to buy.

phrases.trans_en: tubes of paint or blocks of dried paint used for making pictures

examples.ch: 油画颜料
examples.en: oil paints

defines.trans_en: to cover a surface with paint

examples.ch: 我们把卧室漆成了蓝色。
examples.en: We've painted the bedroom blue.

examples.ch: 我整个早上都在刷油漆。
examples.en: I've been painting all morning.

examples.ch: 我得用油漆遮盖一下墙上这些污迹。
examples.en: I'll need to paint over (= cover with another layer of paint) these dirty marks on the wall.

defines.trans_en: to make a picture using paints

examples.ch: 所有这些画都是当地画家画的。
examples.en: All these pictures were painted by local artists.

defines.trans_en: If you paint your nails or face, you put make-up on that part of your body.

examples.ch: 她把指甲涂成鲜红色。
examples.en: She painted her nails bright red.

defines.trans_en: of or belonging to us

examples.ch: 我们的房子是几年前买的。
examples.en: We bought our house several years ago.

examples.ch: 他拂袖而去，丢下我们不管。
examples.en: He walked off and left us on our own.

examples.ch: 毒品是对我们社会最大的威胁之一。
examples.en: Drugs are one of the greatest threats in our society.

examples.ch: 我们今年买辆新车没有意义。
examples.en: There's no point in our buying a new car this year.

defines.trans_ch: （用于连接不同的可能性）或，或者；还是，亦或
defines.trans_en: used to connect different possibilities

examples.ch: 今天是星期二还是星期三？
examples.en: Is it Tuesday or Wednesday today?

examples.ch: 你可以现在付款，也可以等你回来取油漆时再付。
examples.en: You can pay now or when you come back to pick up the paint.

examples.ch: 你有没有在听我说话？
examples.en: Are you listening to me or not?

examples.ch: 该专利是在1962年或1963年授予的——我记不清是哪一年了。
examples.en: The patent was granted in (either) 1962 or 1963 - I can't quite remember which.

examples.ch: 输赢没有关系——重在参与。
examples.en: It doesn't matter whether you win or lose - it's taking part that's important.

examples.ch: 房间里有10个或12个人。
examples.en: There were ten or twelve (= approximately that number of) people in the room.

examples.ch: 他只是在开玩笑——或许他不是？
examples.en: He was just kidding - or was he (= but it is possible that he was not)?

defines.trans_en: used after a negative verb to mean not one thing and also not another

examples.ch: 这孩子从不微笑，也不大笑。
examples.en: The child never smiles or laughs.

defines.trans_en: if not

examples.ch: 你应该多吃点，否则你会生病的。
examples.en: You should eat more, or you'll make yourself ill.

defines.trans_ch: （用于引出同义词、同义短语或解释性、限定性、纠正性词语或短语）或者说，也就是，即
defines.trans_en: used to show that a word or phrase means the same as, or explains, limits, or corrects, another word or phrase

examples.ch: 罗莎琳德，她的朋友们叫她罗兹，首先采取了行动。
examples.en: Rosalind, or Roz to her friends, took the initiative.

examples.ch: 近来事情进展得一直都很顺利。或者说，直到两天以前还一直很顺利。
examples.en: Things have been going very well recently. Or they were, until two days ago.

defines.trans_ch: 手术室（operating room 的缩写）
defines.trans_en:
abbreviation for
operating room US

defines.trans_ch: （美国）俄勒冈州（写地址时Oregon的缩写）
defines.trans_en: written abbreviation for the US state of Oregon: used in addresses
someone who is skilled in playing music, usually as a job

examples.ch: 这场音乐会云集了各国的舞蹈家和音乐家。
examples.en: The concert features dancers and musicians of all nationalities.

defines.trans_en: small in size or amount

examples.ch: 它是装在一个小盒子里送来的。
examples.en: It came in a little box.

examples.ch: 小狗／鼻子／房间
examples.en: a little dog/nose/room

examples.ch: 一个小老头走进了房间。
examples.en: A little old man came into the room.

examples.ch: 他微微笑了笑。
examples.en: He gave a little smile.

examples.ch: 用不了多少时间就能把厨房收拾好。
examples.en: It'll only take a little while to clear up the kitchen.

defines.trans_en: young

examples.ch: 你小的时候头发卷得很厉害。
examples.en: When you were little your hair was really curly.

examples.ch: 她是我妹妹，我负责照顾她。
examples.en: She was my little (= younger) sister and I took care of her.

examples.ch: 她的小儿子身体有些不适。
examples.en: Her little boy (= her young son) isn't well.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调对某人或某物的意见）真，确实
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize an opinion that is being given about something or someone

examples.ch: 她穿的那身套装真的很漂亮。
examples.en: That was a nice little suit she was wearing.

examples.ch: 这家饭馆确实不错，是不是？
examples.en: It's not a bad little restaurant, is it?

examples.ch: 他可真是个讨厌的家伙。
examples.en: He's a nasty little man.

defines.trans_ch: 不太重要的，不很严重的；微小的，轻微的
defines.trans_en: not very important or serious

examples.ch: 我的车有点小毛病，不过现在已经修好了。
examples.en: I had a little problem with my car, but it's been fixed now.

examples.ch: 常常是一些微不足道的东西发挥的作用最大。
examples.en: It's often the little things that count the most.

examples.ch: 我能和你聊几句吗？
examples.en: Can I have a little word (= a short discussion about something not very important) with you?

phrases.trans_en: a small amount of food or drink

examples.ch: 我总喜欢在上午11点左右吃点东西。
examples.en: I always like to have a little something around eleven o'clock in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: a present that is not of great value

examples.ch: 我去医院看瓦尔的时候想给她买个小礼物。
examples.en: I want to buy a little something to give to Val when I visit her in hospital.

defines.trans_en: not much or enough

examples.ch: 看来停火的希望很渺茫了。
examples.en: There seems little hope of a ceasefire.

examples.ch: 他们手头钱很少。
examples.en: They have very little money.

examples.ch: 可选择的余地太小了。
examples.en: There's so little choice.

phrases.trans_en: a small amount of something

examples.ch: 这种酱汁需要加点盐。
examples.en: This sauce needs a little salt.

examples.ch: 只要稍加培训她就能做得很好。
examples.en: With a little training she could do very well.

examples.ch: 我可以给你提一点建议吗？
examples.en: Can I give you a little advice?

defines.trans_en: a small amount

examples.ch: 他们说的话我只能听到一点。
examples.en: I could only hear a little of what they were saying.

examples.ch: 他上班时能偷懒就偷懒。
examples.en: He does as little as possible at work.

examples.ch: 虽然面粉剩得不多了，但你可以随便拿。
examples.en: There's not much flour left but you're welcome to the/what little there is.

defines.trans_en: an amount that is not much or not enough

examples.ch: 星期天我们没有做太多事情。
examples.en: We did very little on Sunday.

examples.ch: 他说的话我几乎一点儿都不明白。
examples.en: Very little of what he said made any sense to me.

examples.ch: 不幸的是，这位画家的作品几乎无一幸存。
examples.en: Unfortunately, little of the artist's work has survived.

examples.ch: 政府几乎没有采取任何举措来帮助国内最贫穷的人们。
examples.en: The government has done little or nothing to help the poorest people in this country.

examples.ch: 我们对那些曾经在这里生活过的人们知之甚少，但可以确定的是他们当时的社会已经相当成熟。
examples.en: The little we do know about the people who lived here suggests they had a very sophisticated society.

defines.trans_en: not much

examples.ch: 她那天晚上睡得很少。
examples.en: She slept very little that night.

examples.ch: 鲜为人知的事实
examples.en: a little-known fact

examples.ch: 他几乎一点儿也不知道等待他的将会是什么。
examples.en: Little did he know what lay in store for him.

phrases.trans_en: slightly

examples.ch: 她的话让我有点担心。
examples.en: I was a little bit worried by what she said.

examples.ch: 我们再稍微等一等，还不来的话我会给他们打电话的。
examples.en: We'll wait a little longer and then I'll phone them.

examples.ch: 再走一会就到了。
examples.en: There's only a little further to go.

phrases.trans_ch: 一点一点地，逐渐地，渐渐地
phrases.trans_en: slowly or gradually

examples.ch: 渐渐地她明白了他为什么会那么做。
examples.en: Little by little she came to understand why he had behaved the way he did.

phrases.trans_en: not much more or better

examples.ch: 他们给我们的葡萄酒比醋好不了多少。
examples.en: The wine they gave us was little better than vinegar.

defines.trans_en: a Chinese method of fighting that involves using your hands and feet and not using weapons
a child

examples.ch: 我工作时他把孩子们带到公园去了。
examples.en: He took the kids to the park while I was working.

defines.trans_en: a young person

examples.ch: 他才16岁，还是个毛头小子。
examples.en: He was only 16, just a kid really.

examples.ch: 年轻人，怎么啦？
examples.en: What's up, kid?

defines.trans_en: a young goat
very soft leather made from the skin of a young goat

examples.ch: 小山羊皮手套
examples.en: kid gloves

phrases.trans_en: someone's younger sister or brother

phrases.text: be like a kid in a candy store
phrases.trans_ch: 像进了糖果店的孩子（形容对周围的事物感到非常高兴、激动，以致于行为表现的可笑，难以控制）
phrases.trans_en: to be very happy and excited about the things around you, and often react to them in a way that is silly and not controlled

examples.ch: 你真应该看看他们来的时候他的样子，简直就像是进了糖果店的孩子。
examples.en: You should have seen him when they arrived. He was like a kid in a candy store.

defines.trans_en: to say something as a joke, often making someone believe something that is not true

examples.ch: 啊，我把你的生日忘了！嘿，开玩笑的！
examples.en: Oh no, I forgot your birthday! Hey, just/only kidding!

examples.ch: 你得了第一？开玩笑吧！
examples.en: You won first prize? You're kidding! (= I'm really surprised.)

examples.ch: 我不过和你开个玩笑！
examples.en: I'm just kidding you!

phrases.trans_en: to believe something that is not true, usually because you want it to be true

examples.ch: 他说她很可能会回到他身边，但我觉得他是在自欺欺人。
examples.en: He says there's a good chance she'll come back to him but I think he's kidding himself.

defines.trans_en: to connect or fasten things together

examples.ch: 一座长长的吊桥将两个岛屿连接起来。
examples.en: A long suspension bridge joins the two islands.

examples.ch: 用强力胶把这两片粘起来。
examples.en: Join the two pieces together using strong glue.

examples.ch: 一座公路桥将小岛和大陆连接起来。
examples.en: The island is joined to the mainland by a road bridge.

examples.ch: 如果你将纸上的小点连起来，就会变成一幅画。
examples.en: If you join (up) the dots on the paper, you'll get a picture.

defines.trans_en: If roads or rivers join, they meet at a particular point.

examples.ch: A11 干道在剑桥以南与 M11 高速公路交汇。
examples.en: The A11 joins the M11 south of Cambridge.

examples.ch: 墨累河和达令河在阿德莱德以东汇合。
examples.en: The River Murray and the River Darling join east of Adelaide.

defines.trans_en: to get involved in an activity or journey with another person or group

examples.ch: 我现在没有时间，稍后会和你们一起喝上一杯。
examples.en: I don't have time for a drink now, but I'll join you later.

examples.ch: 为什么不问问你姐姐是否愿意和我们一起吃晚饭？
examples.en: Why don't you ask your sister if she would like to join us for supper?

examples.ch: 我们乘渡船过了英吉利海峡，然后在加来上了去巴黎的火车。
examples.en: We took the ferry across the Channel and then joined (= got on) the Paris train at Calais.

examples.ch: 如果你要买票，请排队。
examples.en: If you're buying tickets, please join the queue (= stand at the end of it).

examples.ch: 我相信大家都会和我一样祝你退休生活愉快。
examples.en: I'm sure everyone will join me in wishing you a very happy retirement (= everyone else will do this too).

examples.ch: 警方和缉毒队联手抓捕大毒贩。
examples.en: The police have joined with (= they have begun to work with) the Drug Enforcement Agency in trying to catch major drug traffickers.

examples.ch: 这家设计公司正计划与一家鞋厂联合推出一系列新鞋。
examples.en: The design company is planning to join up with a shoe manufacturer and create a new line of footwear.

defines.trans_en: to become a member of an organization

examples.ch: 圣诞节后我觉得身体不佳，决定加入一家健身房。
examples.en: I felt so unfit after Christmas that I decided to join a gym.

examples.ch: 这家俱乐部很棒。你为什么不加入呢？
examples.en: It's a great club. Why don't you join?

phrases.trans_en: to become one of a particular large group of people

examples.ch: 我本月底毕业后很可能不得不加入失业大军。
examples.en: When I leave school at the end of this month, I'll probably have to join the ranks of the unemployed.

defines.trans_en: a place where two things meet or are fastened together

examples.ch: 她将两块布非常仔细地缝在了一起，你看不到接缝。
examples.en: She'd stitched the two pieces together really carefully so that you couldn't see the join.

defines.trans_en: a musical instrument, usually made of wood, with six strings and a long neck, played with the fingers or a plectrum

examples.ch: 他坐在草地上弹着吉他。
examples.en: He sat on the grass, strumming his guitar.

examples.ch: 原声吉他
examples.en: an acoustic guitar

examples.ch: 电子吉他
examples.en: an electric guitar

defines.trans_en: the system for using computers to send messages over the internet

examples.ch: 你可以通过电子邮件或者传真联系我们。
examples.en: You can contact us by email or fax.

examples.ch: 你的电子邮件地址是什么？
examples.en: What's your email address?

defines.trans_en: a message or document sent using this system

examples.ch: 我上周收到丹妮尔的一封电子邮件。
examples.en: I got an email from Danielle last week.

defines.trans_en: to send an email to someone

examples.ch: 有空给我发电子邮件。
examples.en: Email me when you've got time.

examples.ch: 他把通讯录用电子邮件发给你了吗？
examples.en: Has he emailed you that list of addresses yet?

defines.trans_en: a musical instrument, especially one made from a skin stretched over the end of a hollow tube or bowl, played by hitting with the hand or a stick

examples.ch: 大／小／定音鼓
examples.en: a bass/snare/kettle drum

examples.ch: 他们随着鼓点翩翩起舞。
examples.en: They danced to the beat of the drums (= sound of the drums being hit).

defines.trans_en: a large tube-like container

examples.ch: 油桶
examples.en: an oil drum

examples.ch: 5加仑的塑料桶
examples.en: a five-gallon plastic drum

examples.ch: 一桶放射性废料
examples.en: a drum of radioactive waste

defines.trans_en: the hollow metal cylinder in a washing machine into which clothes and other things are put for washing
to hit a surface regularly and make a sound like a drum, or to make something do this

examples.ch: 她不耐烦地用手指敲打桌子。
examples.en: She drummed her fingers impatiently on the table.

examples.ch: 雨点打在屋顶上，发出很大的声响。
examples.en: The rain drummed loudly on the roof.

defines.trans_en: to make a picture of something or someone with a pencil or pen

examples.ch: 乔纳森的画画得相当棒。
examples.en: Jonathan can draw very well.

examples.ch: 孩子们画了自己的家人。
examples.en: The children drew pictures of their families.

examples.ch: 在本页的底部画一条线。
examples.en: Draw a line at the bottom of the page.

defines.trans_en: to attract attention or interest

examples.ch: 他很擅长演讲，总能吸引大批的听众。
examples.en: He's an excellent speaker who always draws a crowd.

examples.ch: 我可以请你看一看议程的第3项内容吗？
examples.en: Could I draw your attention to item number three on the agenda?

examples.ch: 他穿那些滑稽的衣服就是想吸引人们的注意吗？
examples.en: Does he wear those ridiculous clothes to draw attention to himself?

defines.trans_en: to make or show a comparison between things

examples.ch: 你不能拿这两个案子相比较——因为它们完全不同。
examples.en: You can't really draw a comparison between the two cases - they're completely different.

examples.ch: 有时很难明确区分不同单词的含义。
examples.en: It's sometimes very difficult to draw a clear distinction between the meanings of different words.

defines.trans_en: to move in a particular direction, especially in a vehicle

examples.ch: 火车慢慢开进车站。
examples.en: The train slowly drew into the station/drew in.

examples.ch: 当我们来到那辆黑色汽车跟前的时候，我突然发现开车的是我以前的男朋友。
examples.en: As we drew alongside (= reached) the black car, I suddenly recognized my ex-boyfriend at the wheel.

examples.ch: 在100米决赛中蒙哥马利和格林并驾齐驱，但却一直未能超过他。
examples.en: Montgomery drew level with Greene in the 100 metres final, but never passed him.

defines.trans_en: If something draws a reaction, people react in the stated way.

examples.ch: 昨晚她在参议院的讲话引起了人们的愤怒。
examples.en: Her speech last night in the Senate drew an angry response.

defines.trans_en: to pull or direct something in a particular direction

examples.ch: 她在肩膀处把外衣拉紧。
examples.en: She drew her coat tightly around her shoulders.

examples.ch: 人们看到裁判把那名运动员带到一边和他说了些什么。
examples.en: The crowd watched as the referee drew the player aside/to one side and spoke to him.

defines.trans_en: to choose a number, card, etc. from several numbers, cards, etc. without first seeing it, in a competition or a game

examples.ch: 发牌时我得到两张 A 牌，后来我又抽到了一张。
examples.en: I was dealt two aces, and I drew a third.

defines.trans_ch: 拿出，拔出，抽出（尤指武器）
defines.trans_en: to take something out of a container or your pocket, especially a weapon

examples.ch: 突然他拿出一把枪／刀抵住我的喉咙。
examples.en: Suddenly he drew a gun/knife and held it to my throat.

defines.trans_ch: 使（尤指血液）流出，使渗出
defines.trans_en: to cause a substance, especially blood, to come out of a body

examples.ch: 他把我咬得都出血了。
examples.en: He bit me so hard that it drew blood.

defines.trans_en: to get a feeling, idea, etc. from something or someone

examples.ch: 他去世时很安详，为此她感到欣慰。
examples.en: She drew comfort from the fact that he died peacefully.

defines.trans_en: to take air or smoke into your lungs

examples.ch: 她深吸一口气然后猛地跳入水中。
examples.en: She drew a deep breath and plunged into the water.

defines.trans_en: to finish a game with the same number of points as the other person or team

examples.ch: 考文垂队在半决赛中以1:1与曼联队战平。
examples.en: Coventry drew 1–1 with United in the semifinal.

defines.trans_en: to get money from a bank, account, etc. so that you can use it

examples.ch: 我从账户中取了些钱给我们作旅费。
examples.en: I drew some money out of my account to pay for our trip.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指从雇主或政府那里）定期领取（一定数额的钱）
defines.trans_en: to receive money regularly, especially as an employee or from the government

examples.ch: 他领取养老金已经10年了。
examples.en: He's been drawing a pension for ten years.

phrases.trans_en: to attract someone's attention

examples.ch: 她的注意力立即被吧台旁站着的一位高个头的金发男子吸引住了。
examples.en: Her eyes were immediately drawn to the tall blond man standing at the bar.

phrases.trans_en: to consider the facts of a situation and make a decision about what is true, correct, likely to happen, etc.

examples.ch: 我常看见他们在一起，所以认为他们是夫妻。
examples.en: I'd seen them together so often, I drew the logical conclusion that they were husband and wife.

phrases.trans_en: to become nearer in space or time

examples.ch: 随着圣诞节的临近，商店开始变得拥挤不堪。
examples.en: As Christmas draws nearer, the big stores start to get unbearably crowded.

examples.ch: 等她走近一些后我才发现我认识她。
examples.en: As she drew closer, I realized that I knew her.

phrases.trans_en: to gradually finish

examples.ch: 晚会即将结束的时候人们开始去拿自己的外套。
examples.en: As the evening drew to a close, people started reaching for their coats.

phrases.trans_en: to pull curtains so that they are either together or apart

defines.trans_en: someone or something that a lot of people are interested in

examples.ch: 我们需要一个深受大家喜欢的人到场，以吸引人们花钱买票。
examples.en: We need someone at the event who'll be a big draw and attract the paying public.

defines.trans_en: a situation in which each team in a game has equal points and neither side wins

examples.ch: 结果是平局。
examples.en: The result was a draw.

defines.trans_en: a competition that is decided by choosing a particular ticket or number by chance
to move the body and feet to music

examples.ch: 我们跳了一夜的舞。
examples.en: We danced all night.

examples.ch: 我们去夜总会跳舞了。
examples.en: We went dancing at a club.

examples.ch: 你喜欢伴着哪种曲子跳舞？
examples.en: What kind of music do you like dancing to?

examples.ch: 昨晚舞会上她在和谁跳舞？
examples.en: Who was she dancing with at the party last night?

examples.ch: 你会跳探戈舞吗？
examples.en: Can you dance the tango?

examples.ch: 我们放上音乐，跳了一晚上的舞。
examples.en: We played our music and danced the night away.

defines.trans_en: to move quickly and lightly

examples.ch: 黄水仙在微风中轻轻舞动。
examples.en: The daffodils were dancing in the breeze.

examples.ch: 她注视着水面上的粼粼波光。
examples.en: She watched the sunlight dancing on the water.

defines.trans_en: a particular series of movements that you perform to music or the type of music that is connected with it

examples.ch: 乐队演奏了一支舒缓的舞曲。
examples.en: The band played a slow dance.

defines.trans_en: a social occasion where people dance, especially a formal occasion in a large room

examples.ch: 他们要举办一场期末餐舞会。
examples.en: They're having an end-of-term dinner-dance.

defines.trans_en: the act of moving your feet and body to music

examples.ch: 我们跳了一支舞。
examples.en: We had a dance.

examples.ch: 新娘的父亲在婚礼上跟新娘跳第一支舞。
examples.en: The bride's father gets the first dance at the wedding.

examples.ch: 舞蹈课
examples.en: a dance class

defines.trans_en: the art of performing dances, especially as a form of entertainment

examples.ch: 演员们载歌载舞演绎了那个故事。
examples.en: The performers tell the story through song and dance.

defines.trans_en: a game played by two people on a square board, in which each player has 16 pieces that can be moved on the board in different ways

defines.trans_ch: （尤指关于宗教或道德话题的）假话，空话，伪善言语
defines.trans_en: statements, especially on religious or moral subjects, that are not sincerely believed by the person making them

examples.ch: 雪莱和拜伦的友谊源于他们均蔑视假话空话和伪善行为。
examples.en: Shelley's friendship with Byron was rooted in their shared contempt for cant and hypocrisy.

defines.trans_en: special words used by a particular group of people such as thieves, lawyers, or priests, often in order to keep things secret

defines.trans_ch: （用来说明人、事物或状态，表示性质、状态、工作等）
defines.trans_en: used to say something about a person, thing, or state, to show a permanent or temporary quality, state, job, etc.

examples.ch: 他很富有。
examples.en: He is rich.

examples.ch: 今天天冷。
examples.en: It's cold today.

examples.ch: 我叫安迪。
examples.en: I'm Andy.

examples.ch: 现在到此结束。
examples.en: That's all for now.

examples.ch: 你长大后想做什么？
examples.en: What do you want to be (= what job do you want to do) when you grow up?

examples.ch: 这些书每本3美元。
examples.en: These books are (= cost) $3 each.

examples.ch: 她怕黑，总是开着灯睡觉。
examples.en: Being afraid of the dark, she always slept with the light on.

examples.ch: 他自己从未生过病，所以听到别人的病情时并不怎么同情。
examples.en: Never having been ill himself, he wasn't a sympathetic listener.

examples.ch: 安静！
examples.en: Be quiet!

examples.ch: 问题在于要决定干什么。
examples.en: The problem is deciding what to do.

examples.ch: 最困难的就是找代替者。
examples.en: The hardest part will be to find a replacement.

examples.ch: 大家普遍认为她应该被辞退。
examples.en: The general feeling is that she should be asked to leave.

examples.ch: 并不是我不喜欢她，只是我们看法很少相同！
examples.en: It's not that I don't like her - it's just that we rarely agree on anything!

defines.trans_en: used to show the position of a person or thing in space or time

examples.ch: 食品已经摆在桌上了。
examples.en: The food was already on the table.

examples.ch: 那儿有人吗？
examples.en: Is anyone there?

examples.ch: 会议将于下周二召开。
examples.en: The meeting is now (= will happen) next Tuesday.

examples.ch: 我的汤里有根头发。
examples.en: There's a hair in my soup.

defines.trans_en: used to show what something is made of

examples.ch: 这个盘子是纯金的吗？
examples.en: Is this plate pure gold?

defines.trans_en: used to say that someone should or must do something

examples.ch: 你要坐在角落里，保持安静。
examples.en: You're to sit in the corner and keep quiet.

examples.ch: 妈妈告诉他们不准在河边玩。
examples.en: Their mother said they were not to (= not allowed to) play near the river.

examples.ch: 没有钱了——我们该怎么办？
examples.en: There's no money left - what are we to do?

defines.trans_en: used to show that something will happen in the future

examples.ch: 我们春天将去澳大利亚。
examples.en: We are to (= we are going to) visit Australia in the spring.

examples.ch: 她此后再也没有见过她的弟弟。
examples.en: She was never to see (= she never saw) her brother again.

defines.trans_ch: （用于条件句中，表示可能）万一，假如
defines.trans_en: used in conditional sentences to say what might happen

examples.ch: 如果我拒绝，他们会很气恼的。
examples.en: If I were to refuse they'd be very annoyed.

examples.ch: 倘若我拒绝，他们会很气恼的。
examples.en: Were I to refuse they'd be very annoyed.

defines.trans_en: used to say what can happen

examples.ch: 现在去市美术馆可以看到现代版画展。
examples.en: The exhibition of modern prints is currently to be seen at the City Gallery.

defines.trans_en: to exist or live

examples.ch: 这种苦难绝不应该存在。
examples.en: Such terrible suffering should never be.

examples.ch: 当信件到他们手上时，他们的姐姐已经去世了。
examples.en: By the time the letter reached them their sister had ceased to be (= had died).

defines.trans_ch: （与动词的现在分词连用，表示动作正在进行）正在，在
defines.trans_en: used with the present participle of other verbs to describe actions that are or were still continuing

examples.ch: 我还在吃饭。
examples.en: I'm still eating.

examples.ch: 她在学习，将来想当律师。
examples.en: She's studying to be a lawyer.

examples.ch: 观众显然不喜欢这个节目。
examples.en: The audience clearly wasn't enjoying the show.

examples.ch: 你总是在抱怨。
examples.en: You're always complaining.

examples.ch: 我将于周二回来。
examples.en: I'll be coming back (= I plan to come back) on Tuesday.

defines.trans_ch: （与动词的过去分词连用，表示被动）被
defines.trans_en: used with the past participle of other verbs to form the passive

examples.ch: 我倒是想去，但没有受到邀请。
examples.en: I'd like to go but I haven't been asked.

examples.ch: 闹事者被力劝赶快离开。
examples.en: Troublemakers are encouraged to leave.

examples.ch: 警察发现了一具尸体。
examples.en: A body has been discovered by the police.

defines.trans_en: a group of musicians who play modern music together

examples.ch: 爵士／摇滚乐队
examples.en: a jazz/rock band

examples.ch: 披头士乐队大概是世界上最有名的乐队。
examples.en: The Beatles were probably the most famous band in the world.

defines.trans_en: a thin, flat piece of cloth, elastic, metal, or other material put around something, or a long, narrow piece of colour, light, etc. that is different from what surrounds it

examples.ch: 腕带
examples.en: a wrist band

examples.ch: 红丝带
examples.en: a red silk band

examples.ch: 窄窄的一片草地把温室和菜地隔开了。
examples.en: A narrow band of grass separated the greenhouse from the vegetable garden.

defines.trans_en: a particular range of values, numbers, etc.

examples.ch: 该方案是为15岁至20岁年龄段的年轻人设计的。
examples.en: The scheme is devised for young people in the 15–20 age band.

defines.trans_en: a group of people who share the same interests or beliefs, or who have joined together for a special purpose

examples.ch: 前总统仍然有一小群支持者。
examples.en: The former president still has a small band of supporters.

phrases.trans_en: a group of young men or women who perform popular songs together and dance as a group

examples.ch: 他90年代成名于“男孩地带”这一少男组合，后来单独发展，获得了巨大的成功。
examples.en: He made his name in the 90s boy band Boyzone, before going on to a highly successful solo career.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指在动物身上）套环，戴上环套
defines.trans_en: to put a band on something, especially an animal

examples.ch: 我们给鸟腿上戴上环套，以便将来可以辨识出它们。
examples.en: We banded the birds (= put bands around their legs) so that we could identify them later.

defines.trans_en: the number of the house, name of the road, and name of the town where a person lives or works, and where letters can be sent

examples.ch: 她的公司地址／家庭住址
examples.en: her business/home address

examples.ch: 地址变更
examples.en: a change of address

defines.trans_en: a series of letters and symbols that tell you where to find something on the internet or show where an email is sent to

examples.ch: 你的邮件地址是什么？
examples.en: What's your email address?

examples.ch: 你知道他们的网址吗？
examples.en: Do you have their Web address?

defines.trans_ch: （计算机内存存储信息的）地址
defines.trans_en: the place where a piece of information is stored in a computer's memory
a formal speech

examples.ch: 她在皇家艺术院作了场演讲。
examples.en: She gave an address to the Royal Academy.

defines.trans_ch: 对…讲话，对…发表演说，致词;给…写信，致函
defines.trans_en: to speak or write to someone

examples.ch: 他向观众说了几句开场白。
examples.en: He addressed a few introductory remarks to the audience.

examples.ch: 他喜欢被称为“先生”或“帕特里奇先生”。
examples.en: He likes to be addressed as "Sir" or "Mr Partridge".

defines.trans_en: to give attention to or deal with a matter or problem

examples.ch: 资金问题尚未得到解决。
examples.en: The issue of funding has yet to be addressed.

defines.trans_ch: 在（信封或包裹）上写上姓名（或地址）
defines.trans_en: to write a name or address on an envelope or parcel

examples.ch: 这个包裹上面的地址写错了。
examples.en: The parcel was wrongly addressed.

examples.ch: 那你为什么要拆写给我的信呢？
examples.en: So why did you open a letter that was addressed to me?

defines.trans_en: small in size or amount

examples.ch: 它是装在一个小盒子里送来的。
examples.en: It came in a little box.

examples.ch: 小狗／鼻子／房间
examples.en: a little dog/nose/room

examples.ch: 一个小老头走进了房间。
examples.en: A little old man came into the room.

examples.ch: 他微微笑了笑。
examples.en: He gave a little smile.

examples.ch: 用不了多少时间就能把厨房收拾好。
examples.en: It'll only take a little while to clear up the kitchen.

defines.trans_en: young

examples.ch: 你小的时候头发卷得很厉害。
examples.en: When you were little your hair was really curly.

examples.ch: 她是我妹妹，我负责照顾她。
examples.en: She was my little (= younger) sister and I took care of her.

examples.ch: 她的小儿子身体有些不适。
examples.en: Her little boy (= her young son) isn't well.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调对某人或某物的意见）真，确实
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize an opinion that is being given about something or someone

examples.ch: 她穿的那身套装真的很漂亮。
examples.en: That was a nice little suit she was wearing.

examples.ch: 这家饭馆确实不错，是不是？
examples.en: It's not a bad little restaurant, is it?

examples.ch: 他可真是个讨厌的家伙。
examples.en: He's a nasty little man.

defines.trans_ch: 不太重要的，不很严重的；微小的，轻微的
defines.trans_en: not very important or serious

examples.ch: 我的车有点小毛病，不过现在已经修好了。
examples.en: I had a little problem with my car, but it's been fixed now.

examples.ch: 常常是一些微不足道的东西发挥的作用最大。
examples.en: It's often the little things that count the most.

examples.ch: 我能和你聊几句吗？
examples.en: Can I have a little word (= a short discussion about something not very important) with you?

phrases.trans_en: a small amount of food or drink

examples.ch: 我总喜欢在上午11点左右吃点东西。
examples.en: I always like to have a little something around eleven o'clock in the morning.

phrases.trans_en: a present that is not of great value

examples.ch: 我去医院看瓦尔的时候想给她买个小礼物。
examples.en: I want to buy a little something to give to Val when I visit her in hospital.

defines.trans_en: not much or enough

examples.ch: 看来停火的希望很渺茫了。
examples.en: There seems little hope of a ceasefire.

examples.ch: 他们手头钱很少。
examples.en: They have very little money.

examples.ch: 可选择的余地太小了。
examples.en: There's so little choice.

phrases.trans_en: a small amount of something

examples.ch: 这种酱汁需要加点盐。
examples.en: This sauce needs a little salt.

examples.ch: 只要稍加培训她就能做得很好。
examples.en: With a little training she could do very well.

examples.ch: 我可以给你提一点建议吗？
examples.en: Can I give you a little advice?

defines.trans_en: a small amount

examples.ch: 他们说的话我只能听到一点。
examples.en: I could only hear a little of what they were saying.

examples.ch: 他上班时能偷懒就偷懒。
examples.en: He does as little as possible at work.

examples.ch: 虽然面粉剩得不多了，但你可以随便拿。
examples.en: There's not much flour left but you're welcome to the/what little there is.

defines.trans_en: an amount that is not much or not enough

examples.ch: 星期天我们没有做太多事情。
examples.en: We did very little on Sunday.

examples.ch: 他说的话我几乎一点儿都不明白。
examples.en: Very little of what he said made any sense to me.

examples.ch: 不幸的是，这位画家的作品几乎无一幸存。
examples.en: Unfortunately, little of the artist's work has survived.

examples.ch: 政府几乎没有采取任何举措来帮助国内最贫穷的人们。
examples.en: The government has done little or nothing to help the poorest people in this country.

examples.ch: 我们对那些曾经在这里生活过的人们知之甚少，但可以确定的是他们当时的社会已经相当成熟。
examples.en: The little we do know about the people who lived here suggests they had a very sophisticated society.

defines.trans_en: not much

examples.ch: 她那天晚上睡得很少。
examples.en: She slept very little that night.

examples.ch: 鲜为人知的事实
examples.en: a little-known fact

examples.ch: 他几乎一点儿也不知道等待他的将会是什么。
examples.en: Little did he know what lay in store for him.

phrases.trans_en: slightly

examples.ch: 她的话让我有点担心。
examples.en: I was a little bit worried by what she said.

examples.ch: 我们再稍微等一等，还不来的话我会给他们打电话的。
examples.en: We'll wait a little longer and then I'll phone them.

examples.ch: 再走一会就到了。
examples.en: There's only a little further to go.

phrases.trans_ch: 一点一点地，逐渐地，渐渐地
phrases.trans_en: slowly or gradually

examples.ch: 渐渐地她明白了他为什么会那么做。
examples.en: Little by little she came to understand why he had behaved the way he did.

phrases.trans_en: not much more or better

examples.ch: 他们给我们的葡萄酒比醋好不了多少。
examples.en: The wine they gave us was little better than vinegar.

defines.trans_en: the winner of a game, competition, election, war, etc.

examples.ch: 1960年美国总统大选的获胜者是约翰·肯尼迪。
examples.en: The victor in/of the 1960 US presidential election was John F. Kennedy.

defines.trans_en: the day of the week after Saturday and before Monday, when most people in Western countries do not go to work

examples.ch: 我们周日要去看望我的叔叔和婶婶。
examples.en: We're going to visit my aunt and uncle on Sunday.

examples.ch: 他们星期天去教堂。
examples.en: They go to church on Sundays.

examples.ch: 合唱团下个星期天举行音乐会。
examples.en: The choir is giving a concert next Sunday.

examples.ch: 上个星期天以来，我什么练习也没有做。
examples.en: I haven't done any exercise since last Sunday.

examples.ch: 今年元旦是一个星期天。
examples.en: New Year's Day this year is a Sunday.

examples.ch: 星期天上午／下午／傍晚／晚上
examples.en: Sunday morning/afternoon/evening/night

examples.ch: 一顿吃烤牛肉配蔬菜的传统英式礼拜日午餐
examples.en: a traditional British Sunday lunch of roast beef and vegetables

phrases.trans_en: to want something very much

examples.ch: 我很想喝杯咖啡——我们能休息一下吗？
examples.en: I'm jonesing for a coffee - can we take a break?

defines.trans_en: used to say that people or things are in a place together or are doing something together

examples.ch: 那时我和西尔维娅在一起。
examples.en: I was with Sylvia at the time.

examples.ch: 他和奶奶一起生活。
examples.en: He lives with his grandmother.

examples.ch: 没法和他一起工作。
examples.en: He's impossible to work with.

examples.ch: 我要和几位朋友一起去法国。
examples.en: I'm going to France with a couple of friends.

examples.ch: 英格丽‧褒曼同汉弗莱‧博加特联袂主演了电影《卡萨布兰卡》。
examples.en: Ingrid Bergman starred with Humphrey Bogart in the movie "Casablanca".

examples.ch: 我把书交给了桑德拉。
examples.en: I left my books with Sandra.

examples.ch: 苹果派要不要配上冰激凌？
examples.en: Ice cream with your apple pie?

examples.ch: 把黄油和糖搅在一起，然后加鸡蛋。
examples.en: Mix the butter with the sugar and then add the egg.

examples.ch: 我马上就过来。
examples.en: I'll be with you (= I will give you my attention) in a second.

examples.ch: 她要在父母的家里住几个月。
examples.en: She's staying with her parents (= at their house) for a few months.

examples.ch: 他从2010年就开始在这个部门工作了。
examples.en: He's been with the department (= working in it) since 2010.

defines.trans_en: using something

examples.ch: 他被手枪近距离击中。
examples.en: He was shot at close range with a pistol.

examples.ch: 她用纸巾擦掉了口红。
examples.en: She wiped her lipstick off with a tissue.

examples.ch: 用胶把这两块粘在一起。
examples.en: Join the two pieces together with glue.

examples.ch: 这个包裹请轻拿轻放。
examples.en: Please handle this package with care.

examples.ch: 他们用一笔银行贷款开了家公司。
examples.en: They set up a business with the help of a bank loan.

defines.trans_en: having or including something

examples.ch: 高个黑发女子
examples.en: a tall woman with dark hair

examples.ch: 他结了婚，并有了3个孩子。
examples.en: He's married with three children.

examples.ch: 他们被分成了两组，一组没有女孩，一组没有男孩。
examples.en: They were divided into two groups, with no girls in one group and no boys in the other.

examples.ch: 他讲话时带有轻柔的爱尔兰口音。
examples.en: He spoke with a soft Irish accent.

examples.ch: 我们是一家跨国公司，在巴黎、纽约和悉尼都有办事处。
examples.en: We're an international company with offices in Paris, New York, and Sydney.

examples.ch: 请来两杯咖啡，一杯加奶，一杯不加。
examples.en: Two coffees please, one with milk and one without.

examples.ch: 他到了洛杉矶，除了衣服之外一无所有。
examples.en: He arrived in Los Angeles with nothing but the clothes he was wearing.

examples.ch: 他醒来后头痛欲裂。
examples.en: He woke up with a terrible headache.

examples.ch: 我在赛跑中得了第二名，成绩是14.2秒。
examples.en: I was second in the race with a time of 14.2 seconds.

examples.ch: 要是运气好的话，我们还可以及时赶回来吃晚饭。
examples.en: With a bit of luck, we should be back in time for dinner.

examples.ch: 他们的两个孩子获得的都是经济学学位。
examples.en: Both their children graduated with degrees in economics.

defines.trans_en: used at the beginning of various phrases written at the end of a letter

examples.ch: 致以美好的祝愿，查尔斯。
examples.en: With best wishes from Charles.

examples.ch: 爱你的罗伯塔。
examples.en: With love, Roberta.

defines.trans_en: including

examples.ch: 算上你的捐款，一共是45英镑。
examples.en: With your contribution, that makes a total of £45.

defines.trans_en: relating to or in the case of a person or thing

examples.ch: 你过得怎么样？
examples.en: How are things with you?

examples.ch: 俄罗斯刚刚与挪威草拟了一份贸易合约。
examples.en: Russia has just drawn up a trade agreement with Norway.

examples.ch: 这与你毫不相干。
examples.en: This hasn't got anything to do with you (= this is not something you should be interested in).

examples.ch: 政府的政策并不受选民的欢迎。
examples.en: The government's policies have not been popular with (= among) the voters.

examples.ch: 在金钱方面，他很不小心。
examples.en: He's very careless with his money.

examples.ch: 她说了很多有关自己与夏洛特之间的恋情。
examples.en: She talked a lot about her relationship with Charlotte.

defines.trans_en: used to show what is on or in something

examples.ch: 她在桌子上摆了最精美的瓷器。
examples.en: She laid the table with the best china.

examples.ch: 她的短衫溅上了血。
examples.en: Her blouse was spattered with blood.

examples.ch: 房间里玩具扔得到处都是。
examples.en: The room was littered with toys.

examples.ch: 那些卡车满载着食品和药品。
examples.en: The trucks were laden with food and medicine.

examples.ch: 她把罐子里装满了奶油。
examples.en: She filled the jug up with cream.

defines.trans_en: because of or caused by someone or something

examples.ch: 他疼得皱眉。
examples.en: He winced with pain.

examples.ch: 我吓得直发抖。
examples.en: I was trembling with fear.

examples.ch: 她上周因重感冒在家休息。
examples.en: She's been at home with a bad cold for the past week.

examples.ch: 噪声一直那么大，我根本没法工作。
examples.en: I can't work with all that noise going on.

examples.ch: 有消息说那一周所有的救援物资都难以送达遭受战火蹂躏的首都，人们的希望破灭了。
examples.en: Hopes were dashed in the war-torn capital with the news that no aid would be arriving that week.

examples.ch: 随着考试的临近，复习一下你的课堂笔记是个不错的主意。
examples.en: With exams approaching, it's a good idea to review your class notes.

examples.ch: 在兴奋和混乱的状态下，我忘了和她道别。
examples.en: (What) with all the excitement and confusion, I forgot to say goodbye to her.

defines.trans_en: against something

examples.ch: 我最终和她吵了一架。
examples.en: I ended up having an argument with her.

examples.ch: 在整个职业生涯中，她都在不停地与抑郁症作斗争。
examples.en: She has fought a constant battle with depression throughout her career.

examples.ch: 两国因为石油价格而交战。
examples.en: The two countries went to war with one another over oil prices.

examples.ch: 一辆卡车与一辆小汽车相撞。
examples.en: A truck had collided with a car.

defines.trans_en: used with words showing separation

examples.ch: 我不愿意花钱。
examples.en: I'd rather not part with my cash.

examples.ch: 他决定忘掉自己失败的婚姻，与过去彻底绝断。
examples.en: He decided to put his failed marriage behind him and make a clean break with the past.

defines.trans_en: and, or followed by

examples.ch: 我想要牛排和炸薯条，甜点要苹果派。
examples.en: I'd like a steak and fries with apple pie for dessert.

examples.ch: 马上付200美元，另外100美元交货时付清。
examples.en: $200 is payable immediately with a further $100 payable on delivery.

defines.trans_en: used in comparisons

examples.ch: 我和我兄弟没什么相似之处。
examples.en: I have nothing in common with my brother.

examples.ch: 这个蛋糕比你上次做的要松软多了。
examples.en: This cake's very light compared with the last one you made.

defines.trans_en: supporting someone or something

examples.ch: 如果你想去争取提升，我会一直支持你。
examples.en: If you want to go for a promotion, I'll be with you all the way.

examples.ch: 你得决定在这件事上的立场——要么支持我，要么反对我。
examples.en: You have to decide where you stand on this issue - you're either with me or against me.

defines.trans_en: in the same direction as something

examples.ch: 在赛跑的最后冲刺阶段赶上了顺风，所以我跑得很好。
examples.en: The wind was with me on the home stretch and I ran well.

defines.trans_en: at the same rate or time as something

examples.ch: 这种酒会随着时间变得更加醇厚。
examples.en: This wine will improve with age.

examples.ch: 汽车的刹车距离根据当时车速的高低而不尽相同。
examples.en: Stopping distances for cars vary with the speed they are travelling at.

defines.trans_en: despite something

examples.ch: 尽管有那么多缺点，她仍然是个真正的好朋友。
examples.en: With all her faults, she's still a really good friend.

defines.trans_en: used to express a wish or instruction

examples.ch: 滚开！
examples.en: Away with you! (= Go away!)

examples.ch: 快上床睡觉！
examples.en: Off to bed with you! (= Go to bed!)

examples.ch: 继续演出吧！
examples.en: On with the show! (= Let it continue.)

examples.ch: 不要上学！
examples.en: Down with school! (= We don't want/like it.)

phrases.trans_en: to understand what someone is saying

examples.ch: 你看起来很迷惑——听懂我说什么了吗？
examples.en: You look puzzled - are you with me?

examples.ch: 对不起，我没听懂你的话。
examples.en: I'm sorry, I'm not with you.

defines.trans_ch: 周末（周六和周日，有时也包括周五晚上）
defines.trans_en: Saturday and Sunday, or Friday evening until Sunday night; the part of the week in which many people living in the West do not go to work

examples.ch: 本／下周末我们要去拜访一些朋友。
examples.en: This/Next weekend we're going to see some friends.

examples.ch: 我周末有很多作业要做。
examples.en: I have a lot of homework to do over the weekend.

examples.ch: 他周末跟哥哥一起去钓鱼了。
examples.en: He spent the weekend fishing with his brother.

examples.ch: 你周末有什么安排吗？
examples.en: Do you have anything planned for the weekend?

defines.trans_en: a trip or a visit at a weekend

examples.ch: 两个人去纽约度周末要花多少钱？
examples.en: How much would a weekend for two in New York cost?

examples.ch: 他们在乡下有一栋周末度假小屋。
examples.en: They own a weekend retreat in the country.

phrases.trans_en: on Saturday or Sunday, or on both Saturday and Sunday

examples.ch: 你周末做什么了？
examples.en: What did you do at the weekend?

examples.ch: 下班后和周末时，我们偶尔会出去玩。
examples.en: We go out once in a while after work and at the weekend.

phrases.trans_en: usually or often between Friday evening and Sunday night, or on Saturdays and Sundays

examples.ch: 他们周末通常去玩帆板冲浪。
examples.en: They go windsurfing at weekends.

defines.trans_en: more than is needed or wanted; more than is suitable or enough

examples.ch: 我太胖了。
examples.en: I'm too fat.

examples.ch: 我够不着书架——它（有点儿）太高了。
examples.en: I can't reach the shelf - it's (a bit) too high.

examples.ch: 这么小的房间人太多了。
examples.en: There were (far) too many people for such a small room.

examples.ch: 这太难了，（我）无法解释。
examples.en: It's too hard (for me) to explain.

examples.ch: 作为孩子房间的书桌，这个太贵了。
examples.en: It was too expensive a desk for a child's room.

examples.ch: 这太过分了，我受不了。
examples.en: It's (all) too much (= more than I can deal with) - I can't stand it.

defines.trans_en: (especially at the end of a sentence) in addition, also

examples.ch: 我也想来。
examples.en: I'd like to come too.

examples.ch: “我喜欢巧克力。”“我也喜欢。”
examples.en: "I love chocolate." "Me too."

defines.trans_en: used to show surprise

examples.ch: 这张阳光穿过树林的照片很漂亮——还是一个孩子拍的！
examples.en: It's a wonderful picture of light shining through trees - and by a child too!

defines.trans_en: very, or completely

examples.ch: 我告诉他这个错误时，他不太高兴。
examples.en: He wasn't too pleased/happy when I told him about the mistake.

examples.ch: 我妈妈最近身体不太好。
examples.en: My mother hasn't been too well recently.

examples.ch: 谢谢，你太好了。
examples.en: Thank you, you're too kind.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调对否定陈述的肯定回答）
defines.trans_en: used to emphasize a positive answer to a negative statement

examples.ch: “我今天不想上学。”“你必须上！”
examples.en: "I'm not going to school today." "You are too!"

phrases.trans_ch: 太，过于（用于形容词或副词前，强调不好的意味）
phrases.trans_en: used before an adjective or adverb to emphasize a negative meaning

examples.ch: 假期过得太快了。
examples.en: The holidays flew by all too quickly.

phrases.trans_ch: 太，非常（用于形容词前，强调积极的意味）
phrases.trans_en: used before an adjective to emphasize a positive meaning

examples.ch: “你想捐助吗？”“我非常乐意。”
examples.en: "Would you like to make a donation?" "I'd be only too pleased."

defines.trans_ch: （常指关于侦破罪案的）惊悚小说（或戏剧、电影）
defines.trans_en: a book, play, or film that has an exciting story, often about solving a crime

examples.ch: 此处该作品被称为结构严密的心理惊悚小说。
examples.en: It's described here as a taut psychological thriller.

defines.trans_en: to believe something or have an opinion or idea

examples.ch: 我觉得以前见过你。
examples.en: I think (that) I've met you before.

examples.ch: 我认为埃玛不会获得这份工作。
examples.en: I don't think Emma will get the job.

examples.ch: 你进城的时候帮我买些邮票好吗？
examples.en: "Do you think (that) you could get me some stamps while you're in town?"

examples.ch: 据信他已在纽约上了飞机。
examples.en: He was thought to have boarded the plane in New York.

examples.ch: 你觉得这部电影怎么样？
examples.en: What did you think of the film?

examples.ch: 鲑鱼一度被认为是昂贵的／是奢侈品。
examples.en: Salmon used to be thought of as expensive/a luxury.

examples.ch: 你觉得这个改善地铁系统的最新计划怎么样？
examples.en: What do you think about the latest plans for improving the underground system?

examples.ch: 我认为学英语是很重要的。
examples.en: I think it is important to learn English.

defines.trans_en: to consider a person's needs or wishes

examples.ch: 她总是替他人着想。
examples.en: She's always thinking of others.

defines.trans_ch: 思考，考虑（动脑筋决定做某事）
defines.trans_en: to use the brain to decide to do something

examples.ch: 我在考虑开始跑步。
examples.en: I'm thinking of taking up running.

examples.ch: 我想午饭后去游泳。
examples.en: I think (that) I'll go swimming after lunch.

examples.ch: 我在考虑买辆新车。
examples.en: I'm thinking about buying a new car.

defines.trans_en: to use the brain to plan something, solve a problem, understand a situation, etc.

examples.ch: 彼得，你在想什么呢？
examples.en: What are you thinking, Peter?

examples.ch: 他做这些没有经过仔细考虑，结果弄得一团糟。
examples.en: He just does these things without thinking and he gets himself into trouble.

examples.ch: 你想得太多——这是你的问题。
examples.en: You think too much - that's your problem.

examples.ch: 对不起，我忘了提你的名字。我真糊涂。
examples.en: I'm sorry I forgot to mention your name. I just wasn't thinking.

defines.trans_en: to remember or imagine

examples.ch: 你打来电话时我正在想你。
examples.en: I was just thinking about you when you called.

examples.ch: 她实在是太忙了，没有想起要告诉我这件事。
examples.en: She was so busy she didn't think to tell me about it.

phrases.trans_en: to have a low opinion of someone or something

examples.ch: 我觉得她最新出版的书不怎么样。
examples.en: I didn't think much of her latest book.

phrases.trans_en: to think very carefully about something

examples.ch: 在你作出重要决定之前要深思熟虑。
examples.en: Think long and hard before you make any important decisions.

examples.ch: 我知道这很让人兴奋，但是在假期上花那么多钱之前要仔细考虑一下。
examples.en: I know it's exciting, but you should think twice before you spend that much money on a vacation.

phrases.trans_en: to automatically say what you are thinking

examples.ch: “你说什么了？”“啊，没什么，我只是在自言自语。”
examples.en: "What did you say?" "Oh, nothing, I was just thinking aloud."

phrases.trans_en: to consider something for some time

examples.ch: 在我作出决定前先让我考虑考虑。
examples.en: Let me have a think about it before I decide.

examples.ch: 周末先好好想想，再告诉我你的决定。
examples.en: Have a think over the weekend and tell me what you've decided.

defines.trans_en: achieving the results wanted or hoped for

examples.ch: 成功的手术
examples.en: a successful operation

examples.ch: 我第二次尝试做面包时就做得好一些了。
examples.en: My second attempt at making bread was a little more successful.

examples.ch: 今年的收成是自1985年创纪录的大丰收以来最好的一年。
examples.en: This year's harvest was one of the most successful since the record crop of 1985.

defines.trans_ch: 获得成功的，大受欢迎的；非常赚钱的
defines.trans_en: having achieved a lot, become popular, and/or made a lot of money

examples.ch: 成功的事业
examples.en: a successful career

examples.ch: 她的电脑公司生意非常兴隆。
examples.en: She runs a very successful computer business.

examples.ch: 他是几部大获成功的儿童读物的作者。
examples.en: He's the author of several hugely successful children's books (= books which have been bought by a lot of people).

examples.ch: 伯明翰皇家芭蕾舞团这一季的表演获得了巨大的成功。
examples.en: The Birmingham Royal Ballet has had a highly successful season.

defines.trans_en: a person who is learning at a college or university

examples.ch: 法律／哲学／医学专业的学生
examples.en: a law/philosophy/medical student

examples.ch: 研究生
examples.en: a graduate/postgraduate student (= one who has completed a first degree)

examples.ch: 全职／兼职学生
examples.en: a full-time/part-time student

examples.ch: 师范生／学生护士／医学生
examples.en: a student teacher/nurse/doctor (= a person training to become a teacher, nurse, etc.)

examples.ch: 他是芝加哥大学的学生。
examples.en: He was a student at the University of Chicago.

defines.trans_en: someone who is learning at a school

examples.ch: 教师用各种材料来激发学生的学习热情。
examples.en: Teachers use a variety of materials to inspire their students.

examples.ch: 学生不允许把手机带到考场来。
examples.en: Students are not allowed to bring mobile phones in to the test.

examples.ch: 学校的幼儿园有24个孩子。
examples.en: The school has 24 students in kindergarten.

defines.trans_en: If someone is a student of a particular subject, they know about it and are interested in it.

examples.ch: 当护士的，一定得对人性有一点儿认识。
examples.en: As a nurse, you have to be a student of (= to know and learn about) human nature.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a single person when you do not know who they are or when it is not important who they are

examples.ch: 屋子外面有人。
examples.en: There's someone outside the house.

examples.ch: 肯定有人看见了所发生的一切。
examples.en: Someone must have seen what happened.

examples.ch: 观众里终于有人开口说话了。
examples.en: Eventually someone in the audience spoke.

examples.ch: 你得问问别人。
examples.en: You'll have to ask someone else.

examples.ch: 我们的项目组中需要有个软件工程师之类的人。
examples.en: We'll need a software engineer or someone (= a person with skill of or like the stated type) on the project team.

defines.trans_en: of or relating to the form of a word used when talking or writing about one thing

examples.ch: 单数词尾／形式／名词／动词
examples.en: a singular ending/form/noun/verb

examples.ch: woman 这个单词是单数形式。
examples.en: The word "woman" is singular.

defines.trans_en: of an unusual quality or standard; noticeable

examples.ch: 这座建筑物非常雅致、漂亮。
examples.en: It was a building of singular grace and beauty.

examples.ch: 他绘画技巧非常欠缺。
examples.en: He showed a singular lack of skill in painting.

defines.trans_en: unusual or strange; not ordinary
the form of a word used when talking or writing about one thing

examples.ch: children 的单数形式是 child。
examples.en: The singular of "children" is "child".

examples.ch: 单词 teeth 是复数形式——单数形式是 tooth。
examples.en: The word "teeth" is plural - in the singular it's "tooth".

defines.trans_en: frightening

examples.ch: 恐怖电影／故事
examples.en: a scary movie/story

defines.trans_ch: 伤心的，悲哀的;令人难过的，令人遗憾的
defines.trans_en: unhappy or sorry

examples.ch: 我刚刚得到一些令人伤心的消息。
examples.en: I've just received some very sad news.

examples.ch: 她露出了一丝苦笑。
examples.en: She gave a sad smile.

examples.ch: 很遗憾旅行被迫取消了。
examples.en: It's sad (that) the trip had to be cancelled.

examples.ch: 你不能来，我很遗憾。
examples.en: I'm so sad (that) you can't come.

examples.ch: 今年看到这么多失败的事情真是令人难过。
examples.en: It's sad to see so many failures this year.

examples.ch: 听说他们分手了，我很难过。
examples.en: I was sad to hear that they'd split up.

defines.trans_en: If something looks sad, it looks worse than it should because it is not being cared for.

examples.ch: 给那些花浇点儿水——它们看上去蔫巴巴的。
examples.en: Give those flowers some water - they're looking a little sad.

defines.trans_ch: 令人遗憾的;令人不快的
defines.trans_en: not satisfactory or pleasant

examples.ch: 令人遗憾的事实是，我们无法为所有的人提供住所。
examples.en: The sad fact/truth is we can't afford to provide homes for all.

examples.ch: 十分糟糕的时局
examples.en: a very sad state of affairs

defines.trans_ch: 老土的;乏味的;不受欢迎的
defines.trans_en: showing that you are not fashionable or interesting or have no friends

examples.ch: 你喜欢读时间表？你可真无聊！
examples.en: You enjoy reading timetables? You sad man!

examples.ch: 星期六晚上呆在家里真是无聊。
examples.en: Staying at home on a Saturday night is just sad.

phrases.trans_en: something you say when you are telling someone about something bad that happened

examples.ch: 真可惜，那枚戒指一直没有找到。
examples.en: Sad to say, the ring was never found.

defines.trans_ch: 季节性不适（冬季因日照时间缩短而引发的精力不济，seasonal affective disorder的缩写）
defines.trans_en: abbreviation for seasonal affective disorder: a medical condition in which a person does not have much energy and enthusiasm during the winter because of the reduced period of natural light
in fact

examples.ch: 他不是真生气——他只是假装的。
examples.en: He isn't really angry - he's just pretending.

examples.ch: 你实际上并没料到他们会拒绝，是不是？
examples.en: You don't really expect them to refuse, do you?

defines.trans_en: used to say that something is certain

examples.ch: 多谢，但是我真的什么也吃不下了。
examples.en: Thank you, but I really couldn't eat another thing.

examples.ch: 这一次他是真的要去做这件事了。
examples.en: He's really going to do it this time.

defines.trans_en: very or very much

examples.ch: 她人很好。
examples.en: She's really nice.

examples.ch: 这个房间里太热了。
examples.en: This room is really hot.

examples.ch: 那真是太有趣了。
examples.en: That's really interesting.

examples.ch: 这确实是个很难做的决定。
examples.en: It's a really difficult decision.

examples.ch: 你喜欢它吗？ "不太喜欢。"
examples.en: "Did you like it? Not really (= no)."

defines.trans_ch: （用于表示感兴趣、惊奇或恼怒）真的，是吗，真是的
defines.trans_en: used to express interest, surprise, or anger

examples.ch: “我就要和弗雷德结婚了。”“是吗？什么时候？”
examples.en: "I'm getting married to Fred." "Really? When?"

examples.ch: “她已经答应为慈善事业剃掉自己的头发。”“真的吗？你觉得她会做吗？”
examples.en: "She's promised to shave her head for charity." "Really? Do you think she'll do it?"

examples.ch: “他没把书带回来。”“哎呀，真是的！我都跟他说了两次了！”
examples.en: "He hasn't brought the book back." "Oh, really! That's the second time I've asked him!"

defines.trans_en: a word or form that expresses more than one

examples.ch: geese 是 goose 的复数形式。
examples.en: "Geese" is the plural of "goose".

examples.ch: woman 的复数形式是 women。
examples.en: "Woman" in the plural is "women".

defines.trans_en: consisting of lots of different races or types of people or of different things

examples.ch: 我们必须意识到我们现在生活在一个多元社会中。
examples.en: We need to recognize that we are now living in a plural society.

defines.trans_en: for or relating to more than one person or thing

examples.ch: 极少数几个国家允许公民拥有多重国籍。
examples.en: Very few countries allow people to have plural citizenship (= citizenship of more than one country).

defines.trans_en: of or relating to the form that expresses more than one

examples.ch: cattle 和 trousers 均为复数名词。
examples.en: "Cattle" and "trousers" are both plural nouns.

defines.trans_en: a musical play in which most of the words are sung, or plays and music of this type

examples.ch: 《卡门》是我最喜爱的歌剧。
examples.en: "Carmen" is my favourite opera.

examples.ch: 我对歌剧一向不是很着迷。
examples.en: I've never been a huge fan of opera.

examples.ch: 他一有机会就去看歌剧。
examples.en: He goes to the opera (= to see an opera) whenever he can.

examples.ch: 歌剧演唱家
examples.en: an opera singer

defines.trans_en: many times

examples.ch: 我常见他在花园里。
examples.en: I often see him in the garden.

examples.ch: 你多久洗一次头发？
examples.en: How often do you wash your hair?

examples.ch: 我不常喝啤酒。
examples.en: I don't often drink beer.

examples.ch: 你不会经常遇到一见面就把你吸引住的人。
examples.en: It's not often that you meet someone who you're instantly attracted to.

examples.ch: 我看父母的次数没有我期望的那样多。
examples.en: I don't see my parents as often as I'd like to.

examples.ch: 在这个国家，圣诞节时的气候往往很暖和。
examples.en: Christmas is often mild in this country.

defines.trans_en: recently created or having started to exist recently

examples.ch: 新车
examples.en: a new car

examples.ch: 她极富创造力，总会想出新点子。
examples.en: She's very creative and always coming up with new ideas.

examples.ch: 他们决定给刚出生的宝宝起什么名字？
examples.en: What have they decided to name the new baby?

examples.ch: 时尚界有什么新潮流？
examples.en: What's new in the fashion world?

examples.ch: 如果我们要保持竞争力，就必须投资开发新技术。
examples.en: We have to invest in new technology if we are to remain competitive.

defines.trans_en: different from one that existed earlier

examples.ch: 你见过新秘书了吗？
examples.en: Have you met the new secretary?

examples.ch: 她在找新工作。
examples.en: She's looking for a new job.

examples.ch: 你去过安的新居吗？
examples.en: Have you seen Ann's new house (= where she has just started living)?

examples.ch: 他们刚刚推出了比旧款功能强大许多的新一代计算机。
examples.en: They've just launched a new generation of computers that are much more powerful than earlier models.

defines.trans_en: not yet familiar or experienced

examples.ch: 对这个地区很陌生
examples.en: to be new to the area

examples.ch: 她才刚刚开始做这份工作，因此你不能期望她什么都知道。
examples.en: She's new to the job so you can't expect her to know everything yet.

defines.trans_en: not previously used or owned

examples.ch: 由于新车价格上涨，二手车销售量有所增加。
examples.en: Used car sales have risen because of the increased cost of new cars.

examples.ch: 你买的自行车是新的还是二手货？
examples.en: Did you buy your bike new or second-hand?

defines.trans_en: recently discovered or made known

examples.ch: 这种新型疗法给许多癌症患者带来希望。
examples.en: This new cancer treatment offers hope to many sufferers.

examples.ch: 只有出现新证据才会进行重审。
examples.en: A retrial can only take place when new evidence has emerged.

phrases.trans_en: new things

examples.ch: 除旧迎新
examples.en: Out with the old and in with the new.

defines.trans_en: recent or recently

examples.ch: 政府最近表现出来的对环保问题的热情受到环境保护主义者的欢迎。
examples.en: The government's new-found enthusiasm for green issues has been welcomed by environmentalists.

defines.trans_en: a film shown in a cinema or on television and often telling a story

examples.ch: 我最喜爱的电影是《卡萨布兰卡》。
examples.en: My favourite movie is "Casablanca".

phrases.trans_en: a cinema or group of cinemas

examples.ch: 这星期电影院有什么电影上映？
examples.en: What's on/showing at the movies this week?

examples.ch: 你今晚想去看电影吗？
examples.en: Do you want to go to the movies tonight?

phrases.trans_en: the business of making films

examples.ch: 她一辈子都在电影行业工作。
examples.en: She has worked in the movies all her life.

defines.trans_en: to get knowledge or skill in a new subject or activity

examples.ch: 他们在学校学俄语。
examples.en: They learn Russian at school.

examples.ch: “你会开车吗？”“我正在学。”
examples.en: "Can you drive?" "I'm learning."

examples.ch: 自从到这里工作后我学到了不少计算机知识。
examples.en: I've learned a lot about computers since I started work here.

examples.ch: 我正在学弹钢琴。
examples.en: I'm learning to play the piano.

examples.ch: 首先你要学习（怎样）使用这台机器。
examples.en: First you'll learn (how) to use this machine.

defines.trans_en: to make yourself remember a piece of writing by reading it or repeating it many times

examples.ch: 我不知道演员是怎样记住那么多台词的。
examples.en: I don't know how actors manage to learn all those lines.

examples.ch: 我们被告知家庭作业是熟练背诵鲍西娅的演说。
examples.en: We were told to learn Portia's speech by heart (= be able to say it from memory) for homework.

defines.trans_en: to start to understand that you must change the way you behave

examples.ch: 她必须明白她不可能想要什么就有什么。
examples.en: She'll have to learn that she can't have everything she wants.

examples.ch: 她很快就明白了不能和他对着干。
examples.en: She soon learned not to contradict him.

examples.ch: 他勇于从错误中汲取教训。
examples.en: He's not afraid to learn from his mistakes.

defines.trans_en: to be told facts or information that you did not know

examples.ch: 听到他的死讯我们都很震惊。
examples.en: We were all shocked to learn of his death.

examples.ch: 我后来听说从来就没有收到过那条消息。
examples.en: I later learned (that) the message had never arrived.

examples.ch: 那起事故我只是后来才听说的。
examples.en: I only learned about the accident later.

defines.trans_en: generous, helpful, and thinking about other people's feelings

examples.ch: 她是个非常宽容体贴的人。
examples.en: She's a very kind and thoughtful person.

examples.ch: 承蒙惠助，不胜感激。
examples.en: It's very kind of you to help us.

examples.ch: 请对你的妹妹好些！
examples.en: Please be kind to your sister!

examples.ch: 请把门关上好吗？
examples.en: Would you be kind enough to/so kind as to close the door? (= please would you do this)

defines.trans_en: not causing harm or damage

examples.ch: 对环境无害
examples.en: kind to the environment

examples.ch: 这种肥皂对皮肤的损害较小。
examples.en: This soap is kinder to the skin.

defines.trans_en: a group with similar characteristics, or a particular type

examples.ch: 当今的交通工具使用两种燃料——汽油和柴油。
examples.en: Today's vehicles use two kinds of fuel - petrol and diesel.

examples.ch: 你在找什么样的工作？
examples.en: What kind of (a) job are you looking for?

examples.ch: 我确实没有那么多钱。
examples.en: I just don't have that kind of money (= I don't have so much money).

examples.ch: 橱柜里有各种各样稀奇古怪的东西。
examples.en: The cupboard contained all kinds of strange things.

examples.ch: 她的旅游公司是同类中的首家。
examples.en: Her travel company was the first of its kind (= of others that are similar).

defines.trans_en: (the study of or a record of) past events considered together, especially events of a particular period, country, or subject

examples.ch: 我在大学里学的是欧洲现代史。
examples.en: I studied modern European history at college.

examples.ch: 美国历史
examples.en: American history

examples.ch: 安妮已经决定写一本关于电子音乐历史的书。
examples.en: Annie's decided to write a history of electronic music.

examples.ch: 我只是跟他要支烟抽而已，可两小时之后他把他的整个身世都告诉了我。
examples.en: I only asked him for a cigarette, but two hours later he'd told me his whole life history.

defines.trans_ch: 过去的事，过去的人（现已不再重要）
defines.trans_en: something that happened or ended a long time ago and is not important now, or a person who is not important now, although they were in the past

examples.ch: 去年的报告已经是老早以前的事了，与当前的情况毫无关系。
examples.en: Last year's report is ancient history and totally irrelevant to the current situation.

examples.ch: “那么丹呢──你还在和他交往吗？”“噢，他已经是历史了。”
examples.en: "What about Dan - are you still seeing him?" "Oh, he's history."

defines.trans_en: something that has been done or experienced by a particular person or thing repeatedly over a long period

examples.ch: 她的家族有心脏病史。
examples.en: Her family has a history of heart problems.

examples.ch: 那家工厂有很长的劳资纠纷史。
examples.en: There's a long history of industrial disputes at the factory.

examples.ch: 他的信用记录很好。
examples.en: He has a good credit history (= a good record of paying money that he owes).

defines.trans_en: to travel or move to another place

examples.ch: 我们走进了那座房子。
examples.en: We went into the house.

examples.ch: 去年夏天我去了巴黎，你去过那儿吗？
examples.en: I went to Paris last summer. Have you ever been there?

examples.ch: 近来我们不大常看电影。
examples.en: We don't go to the cinema very often these days.

examples.ch: 坐火车去不是更快一些吗？
examples.en: Wouldn't it be quicker to go by train?

examples.ch: 这趟火车去纽卡斯尔吗？
examples.en: Does this train go to Newcastle?

examples.ch: 这是到哪去啊？你现在应该在学校里，不是吗？
examples.en: Where do you think you're going? Shouldn't you be at school?

defines.trans_en: to be in the process of moving

examples.ch: 我们能不能走得再快点儿？
examples.en: Can't we go any faster?

examples.ch: 我们正在以每小时50英里左右的速度行进。
examples.en: We were going along at about 50 miles an hour.

examples.ch: 沿着这条路走
examples.en: to go down the road

examples.ch: 上／下楼梯
examples.en: to go up/down stairs

examples.ch: 过桥
examples.en: to go over the bridge

examples.ch: 穿过隧道
examples.en: to go through a tunnel

examples.ch: 一支曲调时时在我脑海萦绕，但我就是想不起它的名字。
examples.en: I've got a tune going around/round in my head (= I am continually hearing it) and I just can't remember the name of it.

defines.trans_en: to move or travel somewhere in order to do something

examples.ch: 我们每周五晚上去购物。
examples.en: We go shopping every Friday night.

examples.ch: 我从来没去滑过雪。
examples.en: I've never gone skiing.

examples.ch: 他们去散步了，但是应该很快就会回来。
examples.en: They've gone for a walk, but they should be back soon.

examples.ch: 她去火车站接布雷克了。
examples.en: She went to meet Blake at the station.

examples.ch: 奥登影院正在放映一部好片子，我们去看吧？
examples.en: There's a good film on at the Odeon. Shall we go?

defines.trans_ch: （尤指为了去别的地方）离开，离去，出发
defines.trans_en: to leave a place, especially in order to travel to somewhere else

examples.ch: 都已经到半夜了？我真的得走了。
examples.en: Is it midnight already? I really must go/must be going.

examples.ch: 她感到不舒服，所以提前离开回家了。
examples.en: She wasn't feeling well, so she went home early.

examples.ch: 去巴斯的最后一趟火车什么时侯开？
examples.en: What time does the last train to Bath go?

examples.ch: 恐怕他得走人了——他实在太不称职，没法继续在这儿干下去。
examples.en: I'm afraid he'll have to go (= be dismissed from his job) - he's far too inefficient to continue working for us.

examples.ch: 这张地毯破旧不堪，磨损严重——必须得换了。
examples.en: This carpet's terribly old and worn out - it really will have to go (= be got rid of).

defines.trans_en: polite word for to die

examples.ch: 她在睡眠中安详辞世。
examples.en: She went peacefully in her sleep.

defines.trans_en: If a road, path, etc. goes in a particular direction, it leads there.

examples.ch: 这条路通向伯明翰。
examples.en: This road goes to Birmingham.

examples.ch: 墙上裂了一条很大的裂缝，从房顶一直延伸到地面。
examples.en: A huge crack went from the top to the bottom of the wall.

defines.trans_en: to continue for a particular length

examples.ch: 这棵树的根一直到地下3米。
examples.en: The tree's roots go down three metres.

defines.trans_en: to become

examples.ch: 我不在乎我的头发会变灰白，但是我真的很受不了变成个秃头。
examples.en: The idea of going grey doesn't bother me, but I'd hate to go bald.

examples.ch: 她父亲变老了／失明了／变聋了。
examples.en: Her father's going senile/blind/deaf.

examples.ch: 如出现任何问题，你可以拨打我们的免费紧急热线。
examples.en: If anything goes wrong, you can call our emergency hotline free of charge.

examples.ch: 在共和党人做了12年的总统后，美国在1992年进入了民主党执政的时代。
examples.en: After twelve years of Republican presidents, the US went Democratic in 1992.

defines.trans_en: to move a part of the body in a particular way or the way that is shown

examples.ch: 这样伸出手，示意你要往左转弯了。
examples.en: Go like this with your hand to show that you're turning left.

defines.trans_en: to operate (in the right way)

examples.ch: 你知道为什么这块手表不走了吗？
examples.en: Have you any idea why this watch won't go?

examples.ch: 你能帮我把车发动起来吗？
examples.en: Can you help me get my car going?

examples.ch: 我们公司已经有20年的历史了。
examples.en: Our company has been going (= has been in business) for 20 years.

defines.trans_en: If a period of time goes, it passes.

examples.ch: 我周末过得很愉快，可就是时间过得太快了。
examples.en: I had a wonderful weekend but it went very quickly.

examples.ch: 随着年龄变大，时间也好像过得更快了。
examples.en: Time seems to go faster as you get older.

examples.ch: 只要再过一个星期我的考试结果就出来了。
examples.en: There's only a week to go before (= until) I get my exam results.

defines.trans_ch: 处于（尤指令人不快的状况）
defines.trans_en: to be or stay in a particular condition, especially an unpleasant one

examples.ch: 尽管提供了救济，仍有数以千计的人继续处于饥饿状态。
examples.en: In spite of the relief effort, thousands of people continue to go hungry.

examples.ch: 为什么有那么多人被强奸后没有报案呢？
examples.en: Why do so many rapes go unreported?

defines.trans_en: to start doing or using something

examples.ch: 我只要把打印机和电脑连接上，我们就可以开始了。
examples.en: I'll just connect the printer to the computer and then we'll be ready to go.

defines.trans_en: to use your opportunity to play in a game

examples.ch: 轮到你来玩了。
examples.en: It's your turn to go now.

defines.trans_en: (of a number) to fit into another number especially resulting in a whole number

examples.ch: 5除11除不尽。
examples.en: 5 into 11 won't go.
3 goes into 15 fives times.

defines.trans_en: to say, especially when a story is being told

examples.ch: “我一辈子都不想再见到你，”他说着，怒气冲冲地冲出了房子。
examples.en: "I never want to see you ever again," he goes, and storms out the house.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指因为过度使用）变薄弱，衰退，损坏，垮掉
defines.trans_en: to become weak or damaged, especially from being used (too much), or to stop working

examples.ch: 经过6个月紧张劳累的世界巡演，她的音质开始变差，这不足为奇。
examples.en: After a gruelling six months singing on a world tour, it is hardly surprising that her voice is starting to go.

examples.ch: 我真的得去买件新外套了——这一件肘部都快磨坏了。
examples.en: I really must get a new jacket - this one's starting to go at the elbows.

examples.ch: 她的听力开始下降，但除此以外，对于一个95岁高龄的老人来说，她还是很健康的。
examples.en: Her hearing is going, but otherwise she's remarkably fit for a 95-year-old.

defines.trans_en: to produce a noise

examples.ch: 我觉得刚才听到门铃响了。
examples.en: I think I heard the doorbell go (= ring) just now.

examples.ch: 我希望我的电脑不要我一出错误就“嘟嘟”响。
examples.en: I wish my computer would stop going "beep" whenever I do something wrong.

defines.trans_ch: 用某种措词表达;（音乐）有某种调子;（以特定方式）唱
defines.trans_en: to be expressed, sung, or played

examples.ch: 我永远也记不住怎么唱那首歌。
examples.en: I can never remember how that song goes.

examples.ch: “它是不是这个调子？”琼说着，用吉他奏出开头几个小节。
examples.en: "Doesn't it go something like this?" said Joan, and played the first couple of bars on her guitar.

examples.ch: 据说他盗窃公司的财物被抓住后就被开除了。
examples.en: The story goes (= people say) (that) he was fireds after he was caught stealing company property.

examples.ch: 一个无头鬼晚上在城堡中游荡——反正人们都是这样说的。
examples.en: A headless ghost walks the castle at night - or so the story goes (= so people say).

defines.trans_ch: 与（…）同时存在；与（…）相伴而生
defines.trans_en: to happen or be found regularly or typically with each other or another

examples.ch: 智慧不在年高，年成未必有智。
examples.en: Wisdom and maturity don't necessarily go together.

examples.ch: 抽烟引起的所有健康问题她都很清楚。
examples.en: She knows all about the health problems that go with smoking.

examples.ch: 巨富者常悭吝。
examples.en: Great wealth often goes hand in hand with meanness.

defines.trans_ch: 被放置，被置于（尤指通常的位置）
defines.trans_en: to be put in a particular place, especially as the usual place

examples.ch: 安装暖气片前沙发是靠着那面墙放的。
examples.en: The sofa went against that wall before we had the radiator put in.

examples.ch: 你告诉我所有这些东西该放哪儿，我会放好的。
examples.en: I'll put it all away if you tell me where everything goes.

defines.trans_ch: 被卖掉，被出售；现成可用
defines.trans_en: to be sold or be available

examples.ch: 那家商店正举行停业甩卖——一切货物都得售完。
examples.en: The shop is having a closing-down sale - everything must go.

examples.ch: 这幅油画将会卖给出价最高的人。
examples.en: The painting will go to the highest bidder.

examples.ch: 我买了一些减价出售的花。
examples.en: I bought some flowers that were going cheap.

examples.ch: “要卖出了——要卖出了——成交！”拍卖人边喊边敲下了拍卖槌。
examples.en: "Going... going... gone! (= Sold!)" said the auctioneer, banging down the hammer.

defines.trans_ch: 可以接受；匹配；适合；相称
defines.trans_en: to look or be acceptable or suitable

examples.ch: 那幅画挂在客厅墙上正合适。
examples.en: That picture would go well on the wall in the living room.

examples.ch: 电视放在那个角落正好，是不是？
examples.en: The TV would go nicely in that corner, wouldn't it?

examples.ch: 我穿那件蓝色连衣裙戴这顶橘红色的帽子，你觉得相配吗？
examples.en: If I wear the orange hat with the blue dress, do you think it will go?

examples.ch: 请记住我是老板，我说一不二。
examples.en: Just remember that I'm the boss and what I say goes (= you have to accept what I say).

examples.ch: 我做什么我父母都不是太担心，所以大多数情况下我都能做自己想做的事。
examples.en: My parents don't worry too much about what I am up to, and most of the time anything goes (= I can do what I want).

defines.trans_ch: 被叫做，被称为（某个名字或名称）;名叫
defines.trans_en: to be known (by a particular name)

examples.ch: 他有个肮脏破旧的玩具熊，名字叫奥古斯塔斯。
examples.en: He had a scruffy old teddy bear that went by the name of Augustus.

examples.ch: 在英国，这种面粉一般被称为玉米面。
examples.en: In Britain, this flour usually goes under the name of maize meal.

defines.trans_en: to develop or happen

examples.ch: “面试进行得怎么样？”“很好，多谢。”
examples.en: "How did the interview go?" "It went very well, thanks."

examples.ch: 他的公司倒闭后，他的生活变得一团糟。
examples.en: Things have gone badly for him since his business collapsed.

phrases.trans_ch: （用于找不到东西时）…跑哪去了？
phrases.trans_en: said when you cannot find something

examples.ch: 我的钥匙跑哪去了？
examples.en: Where have my keys gone?

phrases.trans_ch: （将在饭店所点食物）带走，外带
phrases.trans_en: If you ask for some food to go at a restaurant, you want it wrapped up so that you can take it away with you instead of eating it in the restaurant.

examples.ch: 我要外带一个奶酪汉堡包，一份草莓奶昔。
examples.en: I'd like a cheeseburger and strawberry milkshake to go, please.

phrases.trans_ch: 将要做／成为;打算做／成为
phrases.trans_en: to intend to do or be something in the future

examples.ch: 你打算去参加克莱尔的聚会吗？
examples.en: Are you going to go to Claire's party?

examples.ch: 他想让我给他补衬衫，我才不干呢！
examples.en: He wants me to mend his shirt for him, but I'm not going to!

examples.ch: 我长大了想做一个有名的流行歌星。
examples.en: I'm going to be a famous pop star when I'm older.

phrases.trans_ch: 肯定会做／成为;预期会做／成为
phrases.trans_en: to be certain or expected to happen in the future

examples.ch: 到春天他们就会有孩子了。
examples.en: They're going to have a baby in the spring.

examples.ch: 要是保罗发觉了这事儿，那就麻烦了。
examples.en: There's going to be trouble when Paul finds out about this.

examples.ch: 天气预报说，明天天气晴朗炎热。
examples.en: The forecast said it was going to be hot and sunny tomorrow.

phrases.trans_ch: 就某类…而言，和一般…相比（尤指认为此类事物不太好）
phrases.trans_en: in comparison with most other things of a particular type, especially when you do not think that type of thing is very good

examples.ch: 就恐怖片而言，这片子还算不错。
examples.en: It was quite a good film, as horror films go.

examples.ch: 就此类演出而言，我想这次音乐会还可以。
examples.en: I suppose the concert was OK, as these things go.

phrases.trans_en: to prove that something is true

examples.ch: 你女儿的态度恰恰证明了过去30年里社会的变化有多大。
examples.en: Your daughter's attitude only goes to prove how much society has changed over the last 30 years.

defines.trans_en: an attempt to do something

examples.ch: 我以前从来没有做过，但是我会尝试一下。
examples.en: I've never done this before but I'll give it a go.

examples.ch: “这个罐子没法打开。”“来，让我试一试。”
examples.en: "This jar is impossible to open." "Here, let me have a go."

examples.ch: 我想试试看今晚能不能把论文写完。
examples.en: I want to have a go at finishing my essay tonight.

examples.ch: 我们不可能一蹴而就，一下子完成工作。
examples.en: We can't do the work all in one go (= all at the same time).

defines.trans_en: an opportunity to play in a game, or to do or use something

examples.ch: 嗨，现在轮到肯了！你刚玩过。
examples.en: Hey, it's Ken's go now! You've just had your go.

examples.ch: 我能骑骑你的自行车吗？
examples.en: Please can I have a go (= can I ride) on your bike?

examples.ch: 你要是累了，我来替你开会儿车。
examples.en: I'll have a go at driving for a while if you're tired.

defines.trans_en: the condition of being energetic and active

examples.ch: 今天早晨你精力充沛。
examples.en: You're full of go this morning.

examples.ch: 他无精打采的，不是吗？
examples.en: He doesn't have much go about him, does he?

phrases.trans_ch: （通常指通过努力工作）使成功
phrases.trans_en: to try to make something succeed, usually by working hard

examples.ch: 她新开的古玩店经营得还真挺不错。
examples.en: She's really making a go of her new antique shop.

examples.ch: 我觉得会计这工作他永远也做不好。
examples.en: I can't see him ever making a go of accountancy.

phrases.trans_en: to criticize someone

examples.ch: 我爸爸总是指责我不找个正儿八经的工作干。
examples.en: My Dad's always having a go at me about getting a proper job.

defines.trans_en: humorous; causing laughter

examples.ch: 你知道什么有趣的笑话吗？
examples.en: Do you know any funny jokes?

examples.ch: 我从来都不觉得查理‧卓别林很滑稽。
examples.en: I've never found Charlie Chaplin very funny.

examples.ch: 这真是场滑稽的电影。
examples.en: It's a really funny film.

examples.ch: 没什么好笑的——不准笑！
examples.en: It's not funny - don't laugh!

examples.ch: 摔断了腿可不是好玩的。
examples.en: Breaking your leg isn't funny (= it is serious).

examples.ch: 无论情况有多糟，似乎总有其可笑的一面。
examples.en: No matter how disastrous the situation there always seems to be a funny side to it.

examples.ch: 少跟我没大没小的，小子！
examples.en: Don't you try to be funny with me (= be serious and show respect), young man!

defines.trans_ch: 奇怪的，古怪的；难以解释的，难以理解的
defines.trans_en: strange, surprising, unexpected, or difficult to explain or understand

examples.ch: 洗衣机又发出奇怪的声响了。
examples.en: The washing machine is making a funny noise again.

examples.ch: 他在抚养孩子方面有些奇思妙想。
examples.en: He's got some funny ideas about how to bring up children.

examples.ch: 真奇怪，我确信是把钥匙放在这儿了。
examples.en: That's funny - I'm sure I left my keys here.

examples.ch: 我在去火葬场的路上遇到一件怪事。
examples.en: A funny thing happened to me on the way to the crematorium.

examples.ch: 当我注意到所有人都在看着我时，感觉怪怪的。
examples.en: I felt funny when I realized everyone was watching me.

examples.ch: 真搞不懂，只要一有事要做，亚历克就不见人影了。
examples.en: It's funny how Alec always disappears whenever there's work to be done.

examples.ch: 她是个古怪的女孩。
examples.en: She's a funny girl (= she is strange and difficult to understand).

examples.ch: 那台电视机出毛病了。
examples.en: The television's gone funny (= isn't working correctly).

defines.trans_en: dishonest; involving cheating

examples.ch: 我认为隔壁房间里正在进行一些见不得人的勾当。
examples.en: I think there's something funny going on next door.

defines.trans_ch: 不友好的;似乎被冒犯了的，生气的
defines.trans_en: unfriendly or seeming to be offended

examples.ch: 我不是生气了或其他什么意思，不过我还是觉得自己一个人去好。
examples.en: I'm not being funny or anything but I think I'd rather go on my own.

examples.ch: 昨晚在电话里她听起来有点儿生我的气，不知道是不是我什么地方得罪了她。
examples.en: She sounded a bit funny with me on the phone last night and I wondered if I'd offended her.

defines.trans_en: slightly ill

examples.ch: 我不知道是不是我吃的东西有问题，反正觉得有点儿不舒服。
examples.en: I don't know if it was something I ate but I'm feeling a little bit funny.

defines.trans_ch: 有点发疯的，精神有点失常的
defines.trans_en: slightly crazy

examples.ch: 所有的压力弄得他精神有点儿不正常了。
examples.en: All the stress made him go a bit funny.

phrases.trans_en: the series of drawings in a newspaper that tell a humorous story

defines.trans_ch: （偶然）发现，碰上；找到，寻得；找出，查明
defines.trans_en: to discover, especially where a thing or person is, either unexpectedly or by searching, or to discover where to get or how to achieve something

examples.ch: 我刚在口袋里找到了一张10英镑的钞票。
examples.en: I've just found a ten-pound note in my pocket.

examples.ch: 我找不到安德鲁的电话号码。
examples.en: I couldn't find Andrew's phone number.

examples.ch: 你会发现刀叉在左手边的抽屉里。
examples.en: You'll find the knives and forks in the left-hand drawer.

examples.ch: 研究者们希望能找到治愈这种疾病的方法。
examples.en: Researchers are hoping to find a cure for the disease.

examples.ch: 他找到地方住了吗？
examples.en: Has he found himself a place to live yet?

examples.ch: 人们发现她时，她已不省人事而且血流不止。
examples.en: She was found unconscious and bleeding.

examples.ch: 这一研究发现已婚男人的寿命要比未婚男人长。
examples.en: The study found that men who were married lived longer than those who were not.

examples.ch: 你认为他们能找到办法给这个地区带来和平吗？
examples.en: Do you think they'll ever find a way of bringing peace to the region?

examples.ch: 我们眼下正想尽办法凑钱缴房租。
examples.en: We're really struggling to find (= get) enough money to pay the rent.

examples.ch: 在遭受丈夫多年的虐待之后，她终于鼓起勇气离开了他。
examples.en: After years of abuse from her husband, she eventually found the courage to leave him.

examples.ch: 我希望自己能挤出时间多看一点书。
examples.en: I wish I could find (the) time to do more reading.

defines.trans_en: to realize that something exists or has happened

examples.ch: 我们回到家时发现猫已经产崽了。
examples.en: We came home to find (that) the cat had had kittens.

examples.ch: 我发现自己轻轻松松就能游1英里。
examples.en: I found (that) I could easily swim a mile.

defines.trans_en: to think or feel a particular way about someone or something

examples.ch: 你是否发觉和克莱夫讲话有些困难？
examples.en: Do you find John difficult to talk to?

examples.ch: 我觉得他这个人不好相处。
examples.en: I don't find him an easy person to get on with.

examples.ch: 她感到很难开口谈论自己的问题。
examples.en: She doesn't find it easy to talk about her problems.

examples.ch: 我感到城市生活压力很大。
examples.en: I find living in the city very stressful.

defines.trans_en: to make a judgment in a law court

examples.ch: 陪审团一致裁定对他的谋杀指控罪名成立／不成立。
examples.en: In a unanimous verdict, the jury found him guilty/not guilty of the murder.

phrases.trans_en: to exist or be present somewhere

examples.ch: 许多动植物种类只在热带雨林中才有。
examples.en: Many plant and animal species are found only in the rainforests.

examples.ch: 柑橘类水果富含维生素C。
examples.en: Vitamin C is found in citrus fruit.

phrases.trans_en: to get somewhere you are trying to reach

examples.ch: 我有一张地图，可还是找不到回酒店的路。
