examples.en: I had a map but I still couldn't find my way back to the hotel.

phrases.trans_en: to criticize someone or something

examples.ch: 她总是挑剔他的工作方式。
examples.en: She's always finding fault with the way he works.

phrases.trans_ch: （不知不觉地）发现自己处于…中（或在…处，做…事）
phrases.trans_en: to realize that you are in a particular situation or place, or doing a particular thing, when you did not intend to

examples.ch: 如果他继续这样行事，他会发现自己一个朋友都没有了。
examples.en: He'll find himself with no friends at all if he carries on behaving this way.

examples.ch: 我们在火车上睡着了，醒来时发现已经到了加来。
examples.en: We fell asleep on the train and woke up to find ourselves in Calais.

phrases.trans_en: If you go somewhere or do something to find yourself, you go there or do it to discover your true character.

examples.ch: 为了寻找真正的自我，西蒙在印度的一处静修所呆了整整一年。
examples.en: Simon spent a year in an ashram in India to find himself.

defines.trans_ch: 发现物；被发现的人（尤指有价值或有用者）
defines.trans_en: a good or valuable thing or a special person that has been discovered but was not known about before

examples.ch: 这家咖啡馆真不错——我完全不知道这附近还有这么一个地方。
examples.en: This café's quite a find - I had no idea there was anywhere like it around here.

examples.ch: 近期发现的一些文物正在当地的博物馆展出。
examples.en: A recent find of ancient artefacts is on display at the local museum.

defines.trans_en:
US spelling of 
favourite

defines.trans_ch: 令人兴奋的;使人激动的;刺激的
defines.trans_en: making you feel excited

examples.ch: 扣人心弦的电影／电影配乐
examples.en: an exciting movie/soundtrack

examples.ch: 你要去非洲？真是太刺激了！
examples.en: You're going to Africa? How exciting!

examples.ch: 这的确是一场扣人心弦的比赛。
examples.en: It was a really exciting match.

defines.trans_ch: （电影或电视）纪录片；纪实性广播节目
defines.trans_en: a film or television or radio programme that gives facts and information about a subject

examples.ch: 这部纪录片从一个崭新的角度介绍了达尔文的一生。
examples.en: The documentary took a fresh look at the life of Darwin.

examples.ch: 他们放映了一部关于动物之间交流沟通的纪录片。
examples.en: They showed a documentary on animal communication.

defines.trans_en: in the form of documents

examples.ch: 人权活动家们已经发现了刑讯逼供的书面证据。
examples.en: Human rights campaigners have discovered documentary evidence of torture.

defines.trans_ch: （电影、电视、广播节目等的）纪实的，记录的
defines.trans_en: giving facts and information about a subject in the form of a film or television or radio programme

examples.ch: 她的电影大多是纪实风格的。
examples.en: Most of her movies have a documentary style.

defines.trans_en: a (type of) film, play, or book that is intentionally funny either in its characters or its action

examples.ch: 他的最新影片被描述为一部“浪漫喜剧”。
examples.en: His latest movie is described as a "romantic comedy".

examples.ch: 我喜欢莎士比亚的喜剧胜过他的悲剧。
examples.en: I prefer Shakespeare's comedies to his tragedies.

defines.trans_en: the humorous part of a situation

examples.ch: 牧师讲到一半忘了词这件事提供了很不错的笑料。
examples.en: The vicar's forgetting his lines in the middle of the speech provided some good comedy.

phrases.trans_en: a type of comedy in which the social behaviour of a particular group of people is made to appear silly

defines.trans_en: someone who pretends to be someone else while performing in a film, play, or television or radio programme

examples.ch: “你最喜欢的演员是谁？”“罗伯特•德尼罗。”
examples.en: "Who's your favourite actor?" "Robert de Niro."

defines.trans_ch: （尤指应对问题或困难的）行动；行动过程；行为
defines.trans_en: the process of doing something, especially when dealing with a problem or difficulty

examples.ch: 这一问题需要政府马上采取行动。
examples.en: This problem calls for swift/prompt action from the government.

examples.ch: 采取行动防止疾病蔓延是政府的当务之急。
examples.en: Action to prevent the spread of the disease is high on the government's agenda.

examples.ch: 在这一问题蔓延到其他地区之前我们一定要采取行动将其解决。
examples.en: We must take action (= do something) to deal with the problem before it spreads to other areas.

examples.ch: 那么行动计划是什么？
examples.en: So what's the plan of action? (= What are we going to do?)

examples.ch: 一旦有人提出索赔，马上启动投诉处理系统。
examples.en: The complaints system swings into action (= starts to work) as soon as a claim is made.

examples.ch: 政府威胁要削减经费，这促使委员会采取了行动。
examples.en: The committee was spurred into action (= encouraged to do something) by the threat of government cuts.

defines.trans_en: something that you do

examples.ch: 她必须对自己行为的后果负责。
examples.en: She has to accept the consequences of her actions.

examples.ch: 我要求他为自己的所作所为作出解释。
examples.en: I asked him to explain his actions.

defines.trans_en: a physical movement

examples.ch: 我会说出这些词，你可以做动作把它们的意思表达出来。
examples.en: I'll say the words and you can mime the actions.

examples.ch: 只需动一动手腕，程序就启动了。
examples.en: It only needs a small wrist action (= movement of the wrist) to start the process.

defines.trans_ch: 发生的事情；（尤指）令人激动的事或大事
defines.trans_en: things that are happening, especially exciting or important things

examples.ch: 我喜欢情节紧凑的影片。
examples.en: I like movies with a lot of action.

examples.ch: 在她最近发表的那本小说里，故事情节在希腊和西班牙南部交替展开。
examples.en: In her last novel, the action (= the main events) moves between Greece and southern Spain.

defines.trans_en: the effect something has on another thing

examples.ch: 他们记录下了这种药物对神经系统的作用。
examples.en: They recorded the action of the drug on the nervous system.

defines.trans_en: fighting in a war

examples.ch: 她的小儿子在战斗中阵亡。
examples.en: Her younger son was killed in action.

examples.ch: 报告称他在战斗中失踪了。
examples.en: He was reported missing in action.

examples.ch: 他参加了堑壕战。
examples.en: He saw action (= fought as a soldier) in the trenches.

defines.trans_en: the way something moves or works

examples.ch: 我们研究了消化系统的机能。
examples.en: We studied the action of the digestive system.

examples.ch: 这辆轿车刹车性能很平稳。
examples.en: The car has a very smooth braking action.

defines.trans_en: a legal process that is decided in a law court

examples.ch: 诽谤诉讼
examples.en: a libel action

examples.ch: 她起诉医院（玩忽职守）。
examples.en: She brought an action (for negligence) against the hospital.

examples.ch: 他被提起刑事诉讼。
examples.en: A criminal action was brought against him.

examples.ch: 因为遭到起诉的威胁，该书在南非停止发行。
examples.en: The book was halted in South Africa by a threat of legal action.

phrases.trans_ch: 大事（或趣事）发生的地方
phrases.trans_en: at the place where something important or interesting is happening

examples.ch: 记者必须要身临事件的现场。
examples.en: A journalist has to be where the action is.

defines.trans_ch: 对…采取行动；就…采取措施
defines.trans_en: to do something to deal with a particular problem or matter

examples.ch: 下面我将扼要重述一下上次会议的记录，把亟待处理的问题提出来。
examples.en: I'll just run through the minutes of the last meeting, raising those points that still have to be actioned.

defines.trans_en: on the subject of, or connected with

examples.ch: 这本书是关于什么的？
examples.en: What's that book about?

examples.ch: 一部反映西班牙内战的电影
examples.en: a film about the Spanish Civil War

examples.ch: 我们正谈论／笑话索苏菲呢。
examples.en: We were talking/laughing about Sophie.

examples.ch: 他总是喋喋不休地炫耀他的工作有多么好。
examples.en: He's always (going) on about what a great job he's got.

examples.ch: 我真为戴维担心。
examples.en: I'm worried about David.

examples.ch: 我真不知道这么大惊小怪到底是怎么回事。
examples.en: I really don't know what all the fuss is about.

examples.ch: 我希望你能收拾一下你的卧室——里面乱七八糟。
examples.en: I wish you'd do something about (= take action to solve the problem of) your bedroom - it's a real mess.

examples.ch: 你做咖啡的时候能不能给我也来一杯？
examples.en: Could you make me a coffee too while you're about it (= while you are making one for yourself)?

examples.ch: 这部剧哪些地方你不喜欢？
examples.en: What didn't you like about the play?

examples.ch: 她态度中表现出的一些问题让我担心。
examples.en: There's something about her attitude that worries me.

examples.ch: 他性格中有种与众不同的东西。
examples.en: There's something special about him (= in his character).

examples.ch: “那是你的车吗？”“是的，怎么啦？”（有时这种说话方式带有一种愤怒或威胁的口气）
examples.en: "Is that your car?" "Yes, what about it?" (= Why are you asking me?)

defines.trans_en: positioned around a place, often without a clear purpose or order

examples.ch: 他们的东西被凌乱地丢在房间里。
examples.en: Their belongings were flung about the room.

defines.trans_en: in a particular place

examples.ch: 你身上碰巧带笔了吗？
examples.en: Do you have such a thing as a pen about you/your person? (= Do you have a pen?)

defines.trans_en: a little more or less than the stated number or amount

examples.ch: 高约6英尺
examples.en: about six feet tall

examples.ch: 大约两个月前
examples.en: about two months ago

examples.ch: “你今天什么时候下班？”“5点左右。”
examples.en: "What time are you leaving work today?" "About five."

defines.trans_en: almost

examples.ch: 我们差不多准备好要走了。
examples.en: We're about ready to leave.

examples.ch: 好啦，我想现在已经干得差不多了。
examples.en: Well, I think that's about it for now (= we have almost finished what we are doing for the present).

defines.trans_en: in many different directions

examples.ch: 他们听到外面有人到处走动。
examples.en: They heard someone moving about outside.

examples.ch: 我跑了一上午到处找你。
examples.en: I've been running about all morning trying to find you.

defines.trans_en: positioned around a place, often without a clear purpose or order

examples.ch: 她的衣服总是东一件西一件乱丢在地板上。
examples.en: She always leaves her clothes lying about on the floor.

defines.trans_en: in or near a place

examples.ch: 约翰在附近吗？
examples.en: Is John about (= somewhere near)?

examples.ch: 目前这一带很多人患流感。
examples.en: There's a lot of flu about (= many people have it) at the moment.

phrases.trans_en: to be going to do something very soon

examples.ch: 马克到的时候我刚要走。
examples.en: I was about to leave when Mark arrived.

examples.ch: 她看上去好像马上就要哭出来了。
examples.en: She looked as if she was about to cry.

defines.trans_ch: （使）急速行进;（使）赶紧;（使）仓促行事;（使）急速做
defines.trans_en: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly

examples.ch: 我忙了整整一天，想把所有的事情都做完。
examples.en: I've been rushing (about/around) all day trying to get everything done.

examples.ch: 我飞奔上楼梯／匆匆赶到办公室／赶忙去找电话。
examples.en: I rushed up the stairs/to the office/to find a phone.

examples.ch: 她把它底朝上翻转过来时，水一下子倾泻出来。
examples.en: When she turned it upside down the water rushed out.

examples.ch: 我们不应该不问青红皂白就责备他们。
examples.en: We shouldn't rush to blame them.

examples.ch: 你不应该这样草草赶工。
examples.en: You can't rush a job like this.

examples.ch: 应急法案在一个上午就被议会快速通过了。
examples.en: The emergency legislation was rushed through Parliament in a morning.

examples.ch: 别催我！
examples.en: Don't rush me!

examples.ch: 联合国向发生饥荒的地区紧急提供了医疗和食品援助。
examples.en: The United Nations has rushed medical aid and food to the famine zone.

examples.ch: 他催赶着孩子们快点出门去学校，以免迟到。
examples.en: He rushed the children off to school so they wouldn't be late.

defines.trans_ch: 一起向…发起突袭;猛攻;向…猛冲
defines.trans_en: If a group of people rush an enemy or the place where an enemy is, they attack suddenly and all together.

examples.ch: 我们一起冲向宫殿大门，杀死了守卫。
examples.en: We rushed the palace gates and killed the guards.

defines.trans_en: In American football, to rush is to carry the ball forward across the place on the field where play begins. Also, a member of the opposite team rushes when they force their way to the back of the field quickly to catch the player carrying the ball.
a situation in which you have to hurry or move somewhere quickly

examples.ch: 慢点！那么快干什么？
examples.en: Slow down! What's the rush?

examples.ch: 为什么早晨老是得这么手忙脚乱一通才能准备好？
examples.en: Why is it always such a rush to get ready in the mornings?

examples.ch: 每个人似乎都是急急忙忙的。
examples.en: Everyone seemed to be in a rush.

examples.ch: 他急忙赶回家。
examples.en: He was in a rush to get home.

examples.ch: 他们并不急于卖出那个房子。
examples.en: They were in no rush to sell the house.

defines.trans_en: a time when a lot of things are happening or a lot of people are trying to do or get something

examples.ch: 人们总是抢着去占最好的位子。
examples.en: There's always a rush to get the best seats.

examples.ch: 我尽量在圣诞节购物潮来临之前把东西买好。
examples.en: I try to do my shopping before the Christmas rush.

examples.ch: 人们蜂拥而至抢购门票。
examples.en: There's been a rush for (= sudden popular demand for) tickets.

defines.trans_en: the act of suddenly moving somewhere quickly

examples.ch: 她一打开门，一阵风忽地吹了进来。
examples.en: There was a rush of air as she opened the door.

examples.ch: 他们猛地扑向他去抢他的枪。
examples.en: They made a rush at him to get his gun.

defines.trans_ch: （通常因经济利益驱动而发生的）蜂拥前往，蜂拥的人潮
defines.trans_en: a sudden movement of people to a certain area, usually because of some economic advantage

examples.ch: 加利福尼亚淘金潮
examples.en: the California gold rush

defines.trans_en: in American football, an attempt to run forwards carrying the ball, or an attempt to quickly reach and stop a player from the opposing team who is carrying the ball

defines.trans_ch: （突然的）一阵强烈感情；（身体的）一阵感觉
defines.trans_en: a sudden strong emotion or physical feeling

examples.ch: 他忽地一下子想起了自己是谁。
examples.en: The memory of who he was came back to him with a rush.

examples.ch: 这是我一年以来第一次抽烟，直感到一阵（晕乎乎的）腾云驾雾的感觉向我袭来。
examples.en: I had my first cigarette for a year and felt a sudden rush (of dizziness).

defines.trans_en: a plant like grass that grows in or near water and whose long, thin, hollow stems can be dried and made into floor coverings, containers, etc.

examples.ch: 灯心草垫子
examples.en: a rush mat

defines.trans_en: a large pile of straw or hay (= dried grass) that has been built in a regular shape
to twist a part of your body and hurt it

examples.ch: 我在打壁球时扭伤了颈部。
examples.en: I ricked my neck while I was playing squash.

defines.trans_en: a police vehicle used to transport prisoners
the sixth month of the year, after May and before July

examples.ch: 许多人在六月份结婚。
examples.en: A lot of people get married in June.

examples.ch: 他的生日是6月21日。
examples.en: His birthday is on 21 June.

examples.ch: 去年6月雨水很多。
examples.en: Last June we had a lot of rain.

defines.trans_en: an aircraft with a jet engine that is able to fly very fast

examples.ch: 喷气式飞机
examples.en: a jet plane

examples.ch: 私人喷气式飞机
examples.en: a private jet

examples.ch: 我们乘喷气式飞机到了纽约。
examples.en: We flew to New York by jet.

defines.trans_en: a thin stream of something, such as water or gas, that is forced out of a small hole

examples.ch: 她打开水管，一股水流喷向院子里。
examples.en: She turned on the hose and a jet of water sprayed across the yard.

defines.trans_en: a small hole in a piece of equipment through which gas or another fuel is forced before it is burned

examples.ch: 我想煤气喷嘴一定是堵了，因为炉子点不着。
examples.en: I think the gas jet must be blocked, because the oven won't light.

defines.trans_en: a hard, black stone that shines when it is rubbed and is used to make jewellery and other decorative objects
to travel somewhere by plane

examples.ch: 我下周要乘飞机到新西兰。
examples.en: I'm jetting off to New Zealand next week.

defines.trans_ch: 爱德华氏综合征（全部或部分身体细胞中有三条第18号染色体）
defines.trans_en: a rare and very serious genetic condition in which someone is born with three rather than two of chromosome number 18 in all or some of their body cells

examples.ch: 婴儿利奥患有爱德华氏综合征，影响全身绝大部分器官。
examples.en: Baby Leo suffers from Edwards' Syndrome, which severely affects most organs of the body.

defines.trans_ch: 用于苏格兰地区的山名中
defines.trans_en: used in the names of mountains in Scotland

examples.ch: 本纳维斯山
examples.en: Ben Nevis

defines.trans_ch: 年，年份;（尤指1月1日至12月31日间的）一年时间
defines.trans_en: a period of twelve months, especially from 1 January to 31 December

examples.ch: 安妮特在意大利工作了两年。
examples.en: Annette worked in Italy for two years.

examples.ch: 2005年是我生命中最糟糕的年份之一。
examples.en: 2005 was one of the worst years of my life.

examples.ch: 我们去年去埃及度假了。
examples.en: We went to Egypt on holiday last year.

examples.ch: 一年之中的这个时候，海滩几乎空寂无人。
examples.en: At this time of year the beaches are almost deserted.

examples.ch: 这一品种常年不落叶。
examples.en: This species keeps its leaves all year (round) (= through the year).

defines.trans_ch: （与某一活动有关的）一年，年度
defines.trans_en: a period of twelve months relating to a particular activity

examples.ch: 财政／纳税年度从4月份开始。
examples.en: The financial/tax year begins in April.

defines.trans_en: the part of the year, in a school or university, during which courses are taught

examples.ch: 学年
examples.en: the academic/school year

examples.ch: 她眼下在曼彻斯特大学读毕业班／一年级／二年级。
examples.en: She's now in her final/first/second year at Manchester University.

examples.ch: 我女儿现在读大学一年级／二年级／三年级／四年级。
examples.en: My daughter is in her freshman/sophomore/junior/senior year.

defines.trans_en: a group of students who start school, college, university, or a course together

examples.ch: 上大学时凯西比我高一届。
examples.en: Kathy was in the year above me at college.

defines.trans_en: used to refer to a student in a particular year group at a school, college, or university

examples.ch: 我喜欢教一年级的学生，而二年级的学生可能比较难应付。
examples.en: I like teaching the first-years, but the second-years can be difficult.

examples.ch: 一年级的学生
examples.en: a first-year student

defines.trans_en: at what time; at the time at which

examples.ch: “我确实告诉过你这件事。”“什么时候？我不记得了。”
examples.en: "I did tell you about it." "When? I don't remember."

examples.ch: 你什么时候走？
examples.en: When are you going?

examples.ch: 婴儿会在什么时候出生？
examples.en: When's the baby due?

examples.ch: 你准备好了我们就出发。
examples.en: We'll go when you're ready.

examples.ch: 告诉我什么时候开始。
examples.en: Tell me when to start.

examples.ch: 问问他下次什么时候回家。
examples.en: Ask him when he's next coming home.

examples.ch: 你预计这个项目什么时候完成？
examples.en: When do you expect to have the project completed (by)?

examples.ch: 她生第一个孩子时只有20岁。
examples.en: She was only 20 when she had her first baby.

examples.ch: 我告诉他时他非常震惊。
examples.en: He was shocked when I told him.

examples.ch: 我讨厌办公室里一个人也没有。
examples.en: I hate it when there's no one in the office.

examples.ch: 我小的时候去过那里。
examples.en: I went there when I was a child.

examples.ch: 我正要洗澡，电话响了。
examples.en: I was just getting into the bath when the phone rang.

defines.trans_en: what/which time

examples.ch: “你知道露西已经回到英格兰了吗？”“是吗──什么时候？”
examples.en: "Did you know Lucy was back in England?" "Is she - since when?"

defines.trans_en: considering the fact that

examples.ch: 你连试都没试过，怎么能说不喜欢呢？
examples.en: How can you say you don't like something when you've never even tried it!

examples.ch: 你自己不主动去认识别人，又怎么能抱怨孤独呢？
examples.en: You can't complain about being lonely when you don't make any effort to meet people.

examples.ch: 她既然连孩子都不喜欢，为什么要去接受培训当老师呢？
examples.en: Why is she training to be a teacher when she doesn't even like children?

examples.ch: 因为我吃鱼，所以我觉得不能称自己为真正的素食主义者。
examples.en: I don't suppose I can really call myself a vegetarian when I eat fish.

defines.trans_en: despite the fact that

examples.ch: 他说自己没有钱，可实际上他的银行账户里有几千美元。
examples.en: He says he doesn't have any money when in fact he has thousands of dollars in his account.

examples.ch: 我不明白他为什么要说一切都很好，实际情况显然并非如此。
examples.en: I don't understand how he can say that everything's fine when it's so obvious that it's not.

defines.trans_en: 20th written as a word
one of 20 equal parts of something
12th written as a word

examples.ch: 我们下一次会议是在（五月）十二日。
examples.en: Our next meeting is on the twelfth (of May).

defines.trans_en: one of twelve equal parts of something

examples.ch: 一英寸等于十二分之一英尺。
examples.en: An inch is one twelfth of a foot.

defines.trans_en: a journey in which you go somewhere, usually for a short time, and come back again

examples.ch: 乘火车从约克到纽卡斯尔大约要花1个小时。
examples.en: The trip from York to Newcastle takes about an hour by train.

examples.ch: 我们今年夏天去挪威旅行。
examples.en: We're going on a trip to Norway this summer.

examples.ch: 我觉得我们可以租一艘汽艇，绕着海湾兜一圈。
examples.en: I thought we might hire a motorboat and take a trip round/around the bay.

examples.ch: 今年我们没钱再次去国外旅行。
examples.en: We can't afford another trip abroad this year.

examples.ch: 从机场到市中心有10英里路。
examples.en: It's a ten-mile trip from the airport to the hotel.

examples.ch: 她出差了，下周才回来。
examples.en: She's away on a business trip and won't be back until next week.

examples.ch: 今年你想参加学校的法国旅行活动吗？
examples.en: Do you want to go on the school trip to France this year?

examples.ch: 我在想我们周末可以去纽约购物。
examples.en: I was thinking we could go on a shopping trip to New York this weekend.

defines.trans_en: an occasion when you knock your foot against something and fall or lose your balance, or someone causes you to do this, when you are walking or running

examples.ch: 她在楼梯上重重地绊了一跤，把脚踝摔断了。
examples.en: She broke her ankle when she had a nasty trip on the stairs.

defines.trans_en: an experience in which someone sees, hears, or feels things that do not exist as a result of taking an illegal drug

examples.ch: 如果你心情沮丧时服用这种东西，会产生一种特别不舒服的幻觉。
examples.en: If you take this stuff when you're depressed, you'll have a really bad trip.

defines.trans_ch: 奇怪的，有娱乐性的，令人激动的人（或经历）
defines.trans_en: a person or experience that is strange or entertaining and exciting

examples.ch: 我的科学课老师真有娱乐性，他会说一些最奇怪的事情。
examples.en: My science teacher is such a trip - he says the most bizarre things.

phrases.trans_ch: 强烈的内疚／拥有权力的快感／极度自负心理
phrases.trans_en: a period of time when you experience a particular feeling strongly

examples.ch: 自从成为办公室主管后，她就一直陶醉在拥有权力的喜悦之中。
examples.en: She's been on a real power trip since she became the office manager.

examples.ch: 我像众多有工作的妈妈一样，对孩子深感歉疚。
examples.en: I suffer from the classic working mother's guilt trip.

defines.trans_en: to lose your balance after knocking your foot against something when you are walking or running, or to cause someone to do this

examples.ch: 他绊了个跟头，擦伤了膝盖。
examples.en: He tripped and fell down, grazing his knee.

examples.ch: 那根电缆很危险，可能会绊到人。
examples.en: That cable is dangerous. Someone might trip over it.

examples.ch: 他因故意绊倒正要起脚射门得分的罗布森而被罚下场。
examples.en: He was sent off for deliberately tripping Robson when he was about to score.

defines.trans_en: to move with quick, gentle steps

examples.ch: 她身着晚礼服轻盈地走下楼梯，显得光彩照人。
