defines.trans_en: one of 15 equal parts of something
a special day or period, usually in memory of a religious event, with its own social activities, food, or ceremonies

examples.ch: 犹太教／基督教／印度教节日
examples.en: a Jewish/Christian/Hindu festival

defines.trans_en: an organized set of special events, such as musical performances

examples.ch: 民间音乐／流行音乐／摇滚音乐节
examples.en: a folk/pop/rock festival

examples.ch: 新奥尔良爵士乐节每年春天举行。
examples.en: The New Orleans Jazz Festival is held every year in the spring.

examples.ch: 戛纳电影节
examples.en: the Cannes Film Festival

defines.trans_en: 11th written as a word

examples.ch: 她的生日在十一号。
examples.en: Her birthday is on the eleventh (of this month).

defines.trans_en: one of eleven equal parts of something
8th written as a word

examples.ch: 他赛跑得了第8名。
examples.en: He was/came eighth in the race.

examples.ch: 鲍勃的生日是（6月）8号。
examples.en: Bob's birthday is on the eighth (of June).

defines.trans_en: one of eight equal parts of something

examples.ch: 三十二的八分之一是四。
examples.en: An eighth of 32 is 4.

defines.trans_en: 18th written as a word

examples.ch: 下周一是（2月）18日
examples.en: Next Monday is the eighteenth (of February).

defines.trans_en: one of 18 equal parts of something
a numbered day in a month, often given with a combination of the name of the day, the month, and the year

examples.ch: 今天几号？
examples.en: What's the date (today)?/What date is it?/What's today's date?

examples.ch: 今天是6月11号。
examples.en: Today's date is 11 June (the eleventh of June).

examples.ch: 今天是6月11号。
examples.en: Today's date is June 11 (June the eleventh).

examples.ch: 你的出生日期是哪一天？
examples.en: What is your date of birth?

examples.ch: 申请截止日期为本月底。
examples.en: The closing date for applications is the end of this month.

examples.ch: 我们定好晚些时候再会面。
examples.en: We agreed to meet again at a later date.

examples.ch: 我想定下我们下次会面的日期。
examples.en: I'd like to fix a date for our next meeting.

examples.ch: 我已与她说好了见面谈房子的日期。
examples.en: I made a date (= agreed a date and time) to see her about the house.

defines.trans_en: a particular year

examples.ch: 硬币上的年份是1789年。
examples.en: The date on the coin is 1789.

examples.ch: 阿尔伯特‧爱因斯坦生于1879年，卒于1955年。
examples.en: Albert Einstein's dates are 1879 to 1955 (= he was born in 1879 and died in 1955).

defines.trans_en: a month and a year

examples.ch: 本证书的失效日期为2017年8月
examples.en: The expiry (US expiration) date of this certificate is August 2017.

defines.trans_en: a social meeting planned before it happens, especially one between two people who have or might have a romantic relationship

examples.ch: 他把她约了出去。
examples.en: He asked her out on a date.

examples.ch: 她今晚有一个朝思暮想的约会。
examples.en: She has a hot date (= an exciting meeting) tonight.

defines.trans_en: a person you have a romantic meeting with

examples.ch: 你约了谁去参加舞会？
examples.en: Who's your date for the prom?

defines.trans_en: a performance

examples.ch: 他们刚刚结束了欧洲巡回表演，一共演了75场，可谓筋疲力尽。
examples.en: They've just finished an exhausting 75-date European tour.

defines.trans_en: the sweet fruit of various types of palm tree

defines.trans_ch: 在…上写上日子，在…上标明日期
defines.trans_en: to write the day's date on something you have written or made

examples.ch: 谢谢你8月30日的来信。
examples.en: Thank you for your letter dated 30 August.

defines.trans_ch: 确定…的年代，推算…形成的时间
defines.trans_en: to say how long something has existed or when it was made

examples.ch: 考古学家无法确定这些化石的生成年代。
examples.en: Archaeologists have been unable to date these fossils.

examples.ch: 古玩经销商推算那个花瓶的制造年代为1734年。
examples.en: An antique dealer had dated the vase at (= said that it was made in) 1734.

defines.trans_en: to regularly spend time with someone you have a romantic relationship with

examples.ch: 他们谈了5年恋爱才结婚。
examples.en: They dated for five years before they got married.

examples.ch: 你和尼基谈恋爱有多久了？
examples.en: How long have you been dating Nicky?

defines.trans_en: to stop being fashionable or become old-fashioned

examples.ch: 和另外一些电影相比，詹姆斯‧邦德系列电影中有一些很快就过时了。
examples.en: Some James Bond films have dated more than others.

defines.trans_ch: 表明…的年龄;揭示…的年代
defines.trans_en: to show the age of a person or thing

examples.ch: 我还能记得观看首次登月电视直播的情景，由此可以看出我的年纪。
examples.en: I can remember watching live TV coverage of the first lunar landing, so that dates me (= shows how old I am).

defines.trans_en: a competition to do better than other people, usually in which prizes are given

examples.ch: 舞蹈／体育比赛
examples.en: a dance/sports contest

examples.ch: 她多次在选美大赛中获胜。
examples.en: She's won a lot of beauty contests.

defines.trans_ch: （为赢得选举或权力而进行的）争取，争夺
defines.trans_en: an attempt, usually against difficulties, to win an election or to get power or control

examples.ch: 该党领袖职务的竞选争夺非常激烈。
examples.en: The contest for the leadership of the party was very bitter.

examples.ch: 爱荷华州的初选是争夺共和党提名候选人的第一站。
examples.en: The primary in Iowa is the first contest for the Republican nomination.

defines.trans_en: If you contest a formal statement, a claim, a judge's decision, or a legal case, you say formally that it is wrong or unfair and try to have it changed.

examples.ch: 我们肯定会驳斥任何批评我们产品安全性的说法。
examples.en: We will certainly contest any claims made against the safety of our products.

defines.trans_en: to compete for something

examples.ch: 八名体操运动员在激烈争夺这枚奖牌。
examples.en: The medal is being keenly contested by eight gymnasts.

defines.trans_ch: 争取，争夺（选举胜利或权力）
defines.trans_en: to attempt to win an election or to get power or control

examples.ch: 她大有希望获胜，因为只有两个人争夺这个位置，而另一个候选人很不得人心。
examples.en: She could win, since only two people are contesting the seat and the other candidate is very unpopular.

defines.trans_en: the day that is exactly a year or number of years after a person was born

examples.ch: 生日快乐，弗拉维奥！
examples.en: Happy birthday, Flavio!

examples.ch: 下周你去参加艾伦的生日聚会吗？
examples.en: Are you going to Ellen's birthday party next week?

examples.ch: 这是她21岁的生日。
examples.en: It's her 21st birthday.

defines.trans_en: the time when a baby or young animal comes out of its mother's body

examples.ch: 那是一次难产。
examples.en: It was a difficult birth.

examples.ch: 他出生时体重8磅。
examples.en: He weighed eight pounds at birth.

examples.ch: 现在更多的父亲在孩子出生时也在场。
examples.en: More men are present at the births of their children these days.

examples.ch: 申请表上会要求你填写出生国籍／出生地。
examples.en: The application form will ask for your country/place of birth (= where you were born).

defines.trans_en: a child that is born

examples.ch: 婴儿成活率不断提高。
examples.en: The percentage of live births (= children who are born alive and continue to live) continues to increase.

examples.ch: 出生登记和死亡登记于1871年成为一种强制性的义务。
examples.en: Registration of births and deaths became compulsory in 1871.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指标志社会地位的）血统，出身
defines.trans_en: the position of the family into which you are born, especially its social position

examples.ch: 他出身高贵且接受了良好的教育。
examples.en: He had received all the advantages of birth (= having been born into a family of a high social class) and an expensive education.

defines.trans_en: the beginning of something

examples.ch: 这些小行星是在太阳系形成时生成的。
examples.en: These asteroids were formed at the birth of the solar system.

phrases.trans_en: born in a particular place or having parents of a particular nationality

examples.ch: 奥斯卡·王尔德生于爱尔兰。
examples.en: Oscar Wilde was Irish by birth.

defines.trans_ch: （包括雕塑、绘画、音乐等的） 艺术
defines.trans_en: the making of objects, images, music, etc. that are beautiful or that express feelings

examples.ch: 电视和流行音乐真的能被当作艺术吗？
examples.en: Can television and pop music really be considered art?

examples.ch: 我很喜欢这出芭蕾舞剧，但它艺术性不高。
examples.en: I enjoyed the ballet, but it wasn't really great art.

defines.trans_ch: 美术（指绘画、素描、雕塑等）
defines.trans_en: the activity of painting, drawing, and making sculpture

examples.ch: 上学时美术和英语是我学得最好的科目。
examples.en: Art and English were my best subjects at school.

examples.ch: 美术老师
examples.en: an art teacher

defines.trans_en: paintings, drawings, and sculptures

examples.ch: 这家美术馆藏有一批优秀的现代艺术品。
examples.en: The gallery has an excellent collection of modern art.

examples.ch: 印第安人艺术展
examples.en: an exhibition of Native American art

examples.ch: 佩吉•古根海姆是20世纪最伟大的艺术收藏家之一。
examples.en: Peggy Guggenheim was one of the 20th century's great art collectors.

examples.ch: 弗里克是纽约的一家艺术品收藏馆。
examples.en: The Frick is an art gallery in New York.

defines.trans_en: an activity through which people express particular ideas

examples.ch: 戏剧是一门通常在剧院表演的艺术。
examples.en: Drama is an art that is traditionally performed in a theatre.

examples.ch: 你认为电影是一种娱乐还是一种表演艺术？
examples.en: Do you regard film as entertainment or as an art?

examples.ch: 她正在修一门表演艺术课。
examples.en: She is doing a course in the performing arts.

defines.trans_en: a skill or special ability

examples.ch: 会话技巧
examples.en: the art of conversation

examples.ch: 想让他出门交际可得好好动动脑筋。
examples.en: Getting him to go out is quite an art (= needs special skill).

phrases.trans_ch: （绘画、表演、舞蹈、音乐等的总称）艺术
phrases.trans_en: the making or showing or performance of painting, acting, dancing, and music

examples.ch: 政府需要拨更多的资金来扶持艺术。
examples.en: More government money is needed for the arts.

examples.ch: 公众对艺术的兴趣
examples.en: public interest in the arts

phrases.trans_en: subjects, such as history, languages, and literature, that are not scientific subjects

examples.ch: 上学时，我很擅长文科，但是理科却无可救药。
examples.en: At school I was quite good at arts, but hopeless at science.

examples.ch: 儿童应该接受文理兼顾的均衡完善的教育。
examples.en: Children should be given a well-balanced education in both the arts and the sciences.

examples.ch: 文科毕业生／学位
examples.en: arts graduates/degrees

defines.trans_ch: （在旧式英语中）be的现在时态单数第二人称
defines.trans_en: in the past, the second person singular of the present tense of "be"

examples.ch: 你是（相当于you are）
examples.en: thou art (= you are)

defines.trans_en: the period of time someone has been alive or something has existed

examples.ch: 你知道那座楼的历史有多久吗？
examples.en: Do you know the age of that building?

examples.ch: 你弟弟多大了？
examples.en: What age (= how old) is your brother?

examples.ch: 我猜她和我年龄差不多。
examples.en: I'd guess she's about my age (= she is about as old as I am).

examples.ch: 她写第一部小说时是74岁。
examples.en: She was 74 years of age when she wrote her first novel.

examples.ch: 他16岁时离开了家。
examples.en: He left home at the age of 16.

examples.ch: 像你这么大的时候我已经结了婚并且有了4个孩子。
examples.en: I was married with four children at your age.

examples.ch: 她开始看上去与实际年龄一般大了。
examples.en: She's starting to show/look her age (= to look as old as she is).

examples.ch: 我真的开始觉得老了。
examples.en: I'm really beginning to feel my age (= feel old).

examples.ch: 他的女朋友年龄比他大一倍。
examples.en: His girlfriend's twice his age (= twice as old as he is).

defines.trans_en: a particular period in time

examples.ch: 维多利亚时代
examples.en: the Victorian age

examples.ch: 现代
examples.en: the modern age

examples.ch: 核时代
examples.en: the nuclear age

defines.trans_en: the fact of being or getting older

examples.ch: 随着年事增高，她的背驼了。
examples.en: Her back was bent with age.

examples.ch: 这种奶酪／酒放的时间越长越好。
examples.en: This cheese/wine improves with age.

examples.ch: 她的脾气一点没有随着年龄增长而变好！
examples.en: Her temper hasn't improved with age!

phrases.trans_en: said to someone to tell them to stop behaving like someone who is much younger
the age at which someone is considered by the law to be old enough to agree to have sex with someone
a very long time

examples.ch: 做饭要花很长时间。
examples.en: It takes ages to cook.

examples.ch: 我已经等了很长时间了。
examples.en: I've been waiting for ages.

examples.ch: 我们好长时间没有交谈了。
examples.en: It's been ages/an age since we last spoke.

defines.trans_en: If someone ages or something ages them, they look older.

examples.ch: 她显得比我们上次见面时老了。
examples.en: She's aged since the last time we met.

defines.trans_en: to develop in flavour or leave something to do this

examples.ch: 这种白兰地在橡木桶中陈酿了10年。
examples.en: The brandy is aged in oak for ten years.

defines.trans_en: used to form nouns that refer to the action or result of something

examples.ch: 阻塞
examples.en: blockage

examples.ch: 收缩
examples.en: shrinkage

examples.ch: 浪费
examples.en: wastage

examples.ch: 损毁东西必须赔偿。
examples.en: All breakages must be paid for.

defines.trans_en: used to form nouns that refer to a state or condition

examples.ch: 束缚
examples.en: bondage

examples.ch: 婚姻
examples.en: marriage

examples.ch: 短缺
examples.en: shortage

defines.trans_en: used to form nouns that are names of places

examples.ch: 孤儿院
examples.en: orphanage

examples.ch: 教区牧师住宅
examples.en: vicarage

defines.trans_ch: 芦荟;芦荟叶汁（可用来治疗受损皮肤）
defines.trans_en: a type of plant with thick pointed leaves, or the thick liquid found in the leaves that is used to treat damaged skin
the ninth month of the year, after August and before October

examples.ch: 我妈妈的生日在9月。
examples.en: My mother's birthday is in September.

examples.ch: 学校在9月3日开学。
examples.en: School starts on 3 September.

examples.ch: 克劳迪娅明年9月开始上学。
examples.en: Claudia is starting school next September.

defines.trans_en: the tenth month of the year, after September and before November

examples.ch: 我们在10月份有个会，欢迎你来参加。
examples.en: We have a meeting in October that you are welcome to attend.

examples.ch: 万圣节是在10月31日。
examples.en: Hallowe'en is on 31 October.

examples.ch: 明年10月份我们会去马德里。
examples.en: We're going to Madrid next October.

defines.trans_en: the eleventh month of the year, after October and before December

examples.ch: 他将于11月开始新工作。
examples.en: He's starting his new job in November.

examples.ch: 下次会议在11月2日举行。
examples.en: The next meeting is on 2 November.

examples.ch: 这家工厂于去年11月投入生产。
examples.en: The factory opened last November.

defines.trans_en: used to express possibility

examples.ch: 可能有我们不知道的其他问题。
examples.en: There may be other problems that we don't know about.

examples.ch: 明天我走前也许还能见到你。
examples.en: I may see you tomorrow before I leave.

examples.ch: 事故的原因也许永远无法查清。
examples.en: The cause of the accident may never be discovered.

examples.ch: 爆炸可能是由电路连接错误引起的。
examples.en: The explosion may have been caused by a faulty electrical connection.

examples.ch: 我们最好别干涉——她可能会不高兴。
examples.en: We'd better not interfere - she may not like it.

examples.ch: 也许有迹象显示她有罪，但不怎么令人信服。
examples.en: There may be some evidence to suggest she's guilty, but it's hardly conclusive.

defines.trans_ch: （用于请求许可或表示允许）可以
defines.trans_en: used to ask or give permission

examples.ch: 读者一次最多可借阅6本书。
examples.en: A reader may borrow up to six books at any one time.

examples.ch: “我能再取些吃的吗？”“好的，当然可以。”
examples.en: "May I help myself to some more food?" "Yes, of course."

examples.ch: “你好，我叫蒂法尼，能帮你做些什么吗？”
examples.en: Hi, my name's Tiffany. How may I help you?

defines.trans_en: used to introduce a wish or a hope

examples.ch: 祝你们婚姻长久美满。
examples.en: May you have a long and fruitful marriage.

defines.trans_en: the flowers of the hawthorn tree
the fifth month of the year, after April and before June

examples.ch: 我母亲的生日是在5月。
examples.en: My mother's birthday is in May.

examples.ch: 他们是在5月12日结婚的。
examples.en: They got married on 12 May.

examples.ch: 我们预计明年5月搬到新的办公室去。
examples.en: We're supposed to be moving into new offices next May.

defines.trans_en: an event in which a large number of people walk through a public place to express their support for something, or their disagreement with or disapproval of something

examples.ch: 她将在周六参加一个反对关闭医院的示威游行。
examples.en: She's going on a march on Saturday in protest over the closure of the hospital.

defines.trans_en: a piece of music with a strong, regular beat, written for marching to

examples.ch: 葬礼进行曲
examples.en: a funeral march

examples.ch: 门德尔松的《婚礼进行曲》
examples.en: Mendelssohn's Wedding March

defines.trans_en: a walk, especially by a group of soldiers all walking with the same movement and speed

examples.ch: 这是一次长途行军，士兵们疲惫不堪。
examples.en: It had been a long march and the soldiers were weary.

examples.ch: 走一天便能到达边境。
examples.en: The border was within a day's march (= distance measured in time taken to walk it).

defines.trans_en: the continuous development of a state, activity, or idea

examples.ch: 发展的脚步／时间的流逝是无法阻挡的。
examples.en: It is impossible to stop the forward march of progress/time.

examples.ch: 旅游业的恶性发展正在破坏着这个岛。
examples.en: The island is being destroyed by the relentless march of tourism.

phrases.trans_en: If soldiers are on the march, they have started marching to a place.

defines.trans_en: to walk somewhere quickly and in a determined way, often because you are angry

examples.ch: 她冲进我的办公室，质问我为什么没写报告。
examples.en: She marched into my office and demanded to know why I hadn't written my report.

defines.trans_en: to walk through a public place as part of a public event to express support for something, or disagreement with or disapproval of something

examples.ch: 今天4000多人在伦敦街头游行，抗议新的法律提案。
examples.en: Over four thousand people marched through London today to protest against the proposed new law.

defines.trans_en: to walk with regular steps and keeping the body stiff, usually in a formal group of people who are all walking in the same way

examples.ch: 乐队齐步走过街道。
examples.en: The band marched through the streets.

examples.ch: 士兵们3天内行军90英里。
examples.en: The soldiers marched 90 miles in three days.

defines.trans_en: to forcefully make someone go somewhere by taking hold of that person and pulling them there or going there together

examples.ch: 她只字未说，抓着我的胳膊就把我拽到了校长办公室。
examples.en: Without saying a word, she took hold of my arm and marched me off to the headmaster's office.

examples.ch: 警察押着一帮年轻人走出了大楼。
examples.en: The police marched a gang of youths out of the building.

defines.trans_en: the third month of the year, after February and before April

examples.ch: 下次会议在三月举行。
examples.en: The next meeting will be in March.

examples.ch: 他是在3月26日离开的。
examples.en: He left on 26 March.

examples.ch: 她明年三月退休。
examples.en: She is retiring next March.

defines.trans_en: the seventh month of the year, after June and before August

examples.ch: 电影节是在7月份。
examples.en: The film festival is in July.

examples.ch: 我儿子的生日是7月29日。
examples.en: My son's birthday is on 29 July.

examples.ch: 他们明年七月份结婚。
examples.en: They're getting married next July.

defines.trans_en: a toilet

examples.ch: 我去上洗手间——你能等我吗？
examples.en: I'm just going to the john - can you wait for me?

defines.trans_en: a man who is the customer of a prostitute (= a woman who charges men to have sex with her)
the first month of the year, after December and before February

examples.ch: 她父亲于一月去世了。
examples.en: Her father died in January.

examples.ch: 他的生日是1月25日。
examples.en: His birthday is 25 January.

examples.ch: 我们明年一月去滑雪。
examples.en: We're going skiing next January.

defines.trans_en: the second month of the year, after January and before March

examples.ch: 预计建造工作2月份开始。
examples.en: Construction is expected to start in February.

examples.ch: 我生于2月5日。
examples.en: I was born on 5 February.

examples.ch: 我们去年二月搬家了。
examples.en: We moved house last February.

defines.trans_en: the twelfth and last month of the year, after November and before January

examples.ch: 我父母是在12月结婚的。
examples.en: My parents got married in December.

examples.ch: 12月12日我们去了墨西哥。
examples.en: We went to Mexico on 12 December.

examples.ch: 他们的孩子是去年12月出生的。
examples.en: Their baby was born last December.

defines.trans_en: belonging to or relating to China, its people, or its language
a person from China
the language spoken in China

defines.trans_ch: （尤指因社会地位高而）威严的，令人敬畏的
defines.trans_en: having great importance and especially of the highest social class

examples.ch: 该学会德高望重的赞助人诺福克公爵
examples.en: the society's august patron, the Duke of Norfolk

defines.trans_en: the eighth month of the year, after July and before September

examples.ch: 他们通常八月去度假屋住。
examples.en: They usually go to their holiday home in August.

examples.ch: 我们将于8月1号去澳大利亚。
examples.en: We're going to Australia on 1 August.

examples.ch: 他们去年八月结婚了。
examples.en: They got married last August.

defines.trans_en: the fourth month of the year, after March and before May

examples.ch: 我们是4月份回来的。
examples.en: We came back in April.

examples.ch: 会议在4月4日举行。
examples.en: The meeting is on 4 April.

examples.ch: 我从去年四月开始就没有见过她。
examples.en: I haven't seen her since last April.

defines.trans_en: used when the subject of the verb is "you" or the person being spoken to, and the object is the same person

examples.ch: 用那把刀要当心，否则你会弄伤自己的！
examples.en: Be careful with that knife or you'll cut yourself!

examples.ch: 凯蒂，控制下自己！
examples.en: Katie, control yourself!

defines.trans_ch: 你本人，你亲自，您本人，您亲自（用于强调句子主语）
defines.trans_en: used for emphasis when the subject is "you"

examples.ch: 那件衣服是你自己做的吗？
examples.en: Did you make the dress yourself?

examples.ch: 你可以自己做那件事。
examples.en: You can do that yourself.

defines.trans_en: used when both the subject and object of the verb are "you" and "you" is also being used to refer to people generally

examples.ch: 你自己对自己说一切都好，但你知道事实并非如此。
examples.en: You tell yourself everything's all right but you know it's not really.

phrases.trans_en: to behave in your usual manner, rather than behaving in a way you think other people might like

examples.ch: 你最明智的选择就是进去面试时自自然然地表现自己。
examples.en: The best thing you can do is to go into the interview and just be yourself.

phrases.trans_en: alone or without help from anyone else

examples.ch: 你居然能一个人搬动那些箱子，真让我吃惊。
examples.en: I'm amazed you managed to move those boxes all by yourself.

examples.ch: 你喜欢有时候一个人独处，还是你会觉得孤单？
examples.en: Do you like being by yourself sometimes or do you get lonely?

phrases.trans_en: for your use only

examples.ch: 那么，本周末整个房子就是你一个人的天下了？
examples.en: So you have the whole house to yourself this weekend?

phrases.trans_en: not to be, seem, or feel as happy or healthy as usual

examples.ch: 你要是不太舒服的话，为什么不早些回家呢？
examples.en: Why don't you go home early if you're not feeling yourself?

phrases.trans_ch: （用于询问某人身体抱恙时的自我感觉）
phrases.trans_en: used when asking someone about their state of mind when they are physically ill

examples.ch: 我知道你肯定还是不舒服，不过你自己感觉怎么样？
examples.en: I know you must still be uncomfortable, but how are you in yourself?

defines.trans_en: a colour like that of a lemon or gold or the sun

examples.ch: 正值初秋时节，树叶开始转黄。
examples.en: It was early autumn and the leaves were turning yellow.

examples.ch: 你应该多穿些黄色的衣服——很适合你。
examples.en: You should wear more yellow - it suits you.

defines.trans_en: of a colour like that of a lemon or gold or the sun

examples.ch: 亮黄色的花／T恤衫
examples.en: a bright yellow flower/T-shirt

defines.trans_en: belonging to a race that has pale yellowish-brown skin
easily frightened and not brave
to become yellow, or to make something become yellow
of a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone

examples.ch: 白色的T恤衫
examples.en: a white T-shirt

examples.ch: 白墙
examples.en: white walls

examples.ch: 黑白相间的狗
examples.en: a black and white dog

examples.ch: 他现在头发都已经白了。
examples.en: He's white-haired now.

examples.ch: “你想要什么样的咖啡？”“请加奶但不要加糖。”
examples.en: "How do you like your coffee?" "White (= with milk or cream) and no sugar, please."

defines.trans_ch: （因为生病或受到惊吓）面色惨白的，苍白的
defines.trans_en: having a pale face because you are not well, or you are feeling shocked

examples.ch: 她面色苍白，双唇没有血色。
examples.en: She was white, and her lips were pale.

defines.trans_en: used in the names of various food and drink products, many of which are not pure white but slightly cream, yellow, grey, or transparent

examples.ch: 白面包
examples.en: white bread

examples.ch: 白巧克力
examples.en: white chocolate

examples.ch: 白面
examples.en: white flour

examples.ch: 白糖
examples.en: white sugar

examples.ch: 白葡萄酒
examples.en: white wine

defines.trans_en: belonging to the group of people with skin that is pale in colour, who come from or whose family originally came from Europe

examples.ch: 他的母亲是黑人，父亲是白人。
examples.en: He had a black mother and a white father.

examples.ch: 以白人为主的社区
examples.en: a predominantly white neighbourhood

defines.trans_en: the quality of being white
the quality of being white
a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone

examples.ch: 在某些国家的传统中，新娘要穿白色礼服。
examples.en: In some countries it is traditional for a bride to wear white.

defines.trans_en: a person with skin that is pale in colour, who comes from or whose family originally came from Europe

examples.ch: 这个社区里住的主要是白人。
examples.en: The neighbourhood is populated mainly by whites.

phrases.trans_en: white clothes, either worn for a particular activity or job, or put together to be washed at the same time

examples.ch: 穿着白色网球裙的女孩
examples.en: a girl in tennis whites

examples.ch: 厨师的白色工作服
examples.en: chef/chef's whites

examples.ch: 医疗小组都穿着医院的白色工作服。
examples.en: The medical team was all in hospital whites.

examples.ch: 一只红袜子和一堆白衣服放在一起洗了！
examples.en: A red sock got put in the wash with the whites!

phrases.trans_en: the part of the eye that is white

examples.ch: 直到他们离你很近了再开枪。
examples.en: Don't shoot until you see the whites of their eyes (= until the people are very close to you).

phrases.trans_en: the transparent part of an egg that surrounds the yolk and becomes white when cooked

examples.ch: 搅打4个蛋清，直到打得稠稠地耸起来为止。
examples.en: Beat four egg whites into stiff peaks.

defines.trans_ch: 乐于接受;欢迎;鼓励;支持
defines.trans_en: to be pleased about and encourage or support something

examples.ch: 这一新的任命受到了广泛的欢迎。
examples.en: The new appointment has been widely welcomed.

defines.trans_en: to meet and speak to someone in a friendly way when they arrive

examples.ch: 来访人士受到系主任的热烈欢迎。
examples.en: The visitors were warmly welcomed by the head of the department.

examples.ch: 布朗宁站在门口，面带灿烂的笑容迎接新来的人，还会拍拍他们的胳膊。
examples.en: Browning stood at the door, welcoming newcomers with a large smile and a pat on the arm.

examples.ch: 请鼓掌欢迎我们尊贵的客人乔治‧泰勒。
examples.en: Please welcome (= please clap for) our guest of honour, George Taylor.

defines.trans_en: If someone is welcome, you are pleased when they visit you.

examples.ch: 要是进城就过来看看我们——什么时候来都欢迎。
examples.en: Come and see us whenever you're in town - you're always welcome/you'll always be welcome.

examples.ch: 他们的传统是把旅行者作为客人来欢迎。
examples.en: Their tradition is that the traveller is a welcome guest.

defines.trans_en: If something is welcome, you are pleased to have or do it.

examples.ch: 这个假期是一次令人愉快的改变／休息／放松。
examples.en: The holiday was a welcome change/break/relief.

examples.ch: 她为他提供了那次不错的机会，可以做些不同的事。
examples.en: She offered him the welcome chance/opportunity to do something different.

examples.ch: 能喝一杯好茶就再好不过了。
examples.en: A nice cup of tea would be very welcome.

phrases.trans_en: to show someone that you are pleased that they are with you

examples.ch: 那家餐馆让孩子们感觉自己很受欢迎。
examples.en: The restaurant makes children very welcome.

phrases.trans_en: used to tell someone that they can certainly do something

examples.ch: 任何感兴趣的人都请尽管来。
examples.en: Anyone who is interested is welcome to come along.

defines.trans_en: the way in which someone is met and spoken to when they arrive in a place

examples.ch: 他们受到了热烈欢迎。
examples.en: They were given a warm (= very friendly) welcome.

examples.ch: 反对党领导人在经历了7年的流亡生涯后，归来时受到了英雄般的欢迎。
examples.en: The leader of the political protests returned to a hero's/heroine's welcome after seven years in exile.

examples.ch: 她在欢迎词中提到了他上一次的来访。
examples.en: She referred to his previous visit in her speech of welcome/welcome speech.

defines.trans_en: a reaction to a decision or suggestion

examples.ch: 他们的支持者有所保留地／谨慎地接受了这个决定。
examples.en: Their supporters gave the decision a guarded/cautious welcome.

phrases.trans_ch: 呆得太久而不再受欢迎
phrases.trans_en: to stay too long

examples.ch: 我两天之后就离开了——我可不想呆得太久讨人嫌。
examples.en: I left after two days - I didn't want to outstay my welcome.

defines.trans_en: said as a greeting to someone arriving at a place

examples.ch: 欢迎——请进。
examples.en: Welcome - please come in.

examples.ch: 欢迎回家／回来——我们很想念你！
examples.en: Welcome home/back - we've missed you!

examples.ch: 欢迎到剑桥来。
examples.en: Welcome to Cambridge.

defines.trans_ch: 想要，希望（英国英语中礼貌的请求不用 want）
defines.trans_en: to wish for a particular thing or plan of action. "Want" is not used in polite requests

examples.ch: 我想要些巧克力。
examples.en: I want some chocolate.

examples.ch: 她想跟你见面。
examples.en: She wants a meeting with you.

examples.ch: 他具备你理想中男人的所有特质——聪明、风趣而又有魅力。
examples.en: He's everything you'd ever want in a man - bright, funny and attractive.

examples.ch: 你想吃什么？
examples.en: What do you want to eat?

examples.ch: 你要我送你去机场吗？
examples.en: Do you want me to take you to the airport?

examples.ch: 这个包裹——你想今天寄出吗？
examples.en: This package - do you want it sent today?

examples.ch: 这块馅饼你想要热一下吗？
examples.en: Do you want this pie hot?

examples.ch: 我可不希望你凌晨两点来，吵得我睡不着觉。
examples.en: I don't want you coming in at two a.m., waking me up.

examples.ch: 你等着瞧——明年她就会想要一栋更大的房子了！
examples.en: You wait - by next year she'll be wanting a bigger house!

defines.trans_en: to wish or need someone to be present

examples.ch: 明天的会议要我参加吗？
examples.en: Am I wanted at the meeting tomorrow?

examples.ch: 警方正在通缉他。
examples.en: He is wanted by the police (= they are searching for him).

defines.trans_en: to need something

examples.ch: 你觉得这汤里要不要加点盐？
examples.en: Do you think this soup wants a bit of salt?

examples.ch: 葡萄酒在冰箱里——只需要冰镇几分钟。
examples.en: The wine is in the fridge - it just wants cooling for a couple of minutes.

phrases.trans_en: to want to start or stop being involved in something

examples.ch: 我想在还来得及的时候退出整个经营项目。
examples.en: I want out of the whole venture before it's too late.

phrases.trans_en: used in giving advice to mean that someone should do something

examples.ch: 趁还来得及，她应该现在就告诉他。
examples.en: She wants to tell him now, before it's too late.

examples.ch: 你不应该放太多胡椒。
examples.en: You don't want to put too much pepper in.

defines.trans_en: a lack of something

examples.ch: 由于没有什么更好的事情可做，我就看了一会儿电视。
examples.en: For want of anything better to do I watched television for a while.

examples.ch: 即使我们失败了，我们也曾努过力。
examples.en: If we fail it won't be for want of trying (= we have tried even if we fail).

phrases.trans_en: needing

examples.ch: 他显得很疲惫，胡子也需要刮了。
examples.en: He appeared tired and in want of a shave.

phrases.trans_en: needs

examples.ch: 我们所需要的很少。
examples.en: Our wants are few.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调形容词或副词）很，非常
defines.trans_en: (used to add emphasis to an adjective or adverb) to a great degree or extremely

examples.ch: 形势非常严峻。
examples.en: The situation is very serious.

examples.ch: 对所发生的事我们感到非常难过。
examples.en: We're very, very sorry about what's happened.

examples.ch: 作决定之前要仔细考虑。
examples.en: Think about it very carefully before deciding.

examples.ch: 她竟然拒绝跟我说话，多么孩子气呀！
examples.en: How very childish of her to refuse to speak to me!

examples.ch: “你累了吗?”“不，不太累。”
examples.en: "Are you tired?" "No, not very."

examples.ch: 非常感谢。
examples.en: Thank you very much.

examples.ch: “你觉得戏好看吗？”“非常好看。”
examples.en: "Did you enjoy the play?" "Very much so." (= Yes.)

examples.ch: 如果我没做错什么，我可不会去道歉。
examples.en: I can't very well (= it would not be right for me to) say sorry when I didn't do anything wrong.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调形容词最高级或 own，same 等形容词）完全，最，正是
defines.trans_en: used to add force to a superlative adjective or to the adjectives "own" or "same"

examples.ch: 这是我尝过的最好吃的巧克力蛋糕。
examples.en: This is the very best chocolate cake I've ever tasted.

examples.ch: 她总是到最后一刻才写家庭作业。
examples.en: She always leaves her homework to the very last moment.

examples.ch: 现在我们村子真正有了自己的图书馆了。
examples.en: We now have our very own library in the village.

examples.ch: 这就是我们上次来的时候坐过的地方。
examples.en: This is the very same (= exactly the same) place we sat the last time we came.

defines.trans_ch: （用于强调名词）同一的，恰好的，正是的
defines.trans_en: (used to add emphasis to a noun) exact or particular

examples.ch: 这正是那本我找了整整一个月的书。
examples.en: This is the very book I've been looking for all month.

examples.ch: 你正是我们这份工作的合适人选。
examples.en: You're the very person we need for the job.

examples.ch: 后来发生的事情正是我们最害怕的。
examples.en: What ended up happening was the very thing we feared the most.

examples.ch: 那封信星期一从柏林寄出，当天／第二天就到了汉堡。
examples.en: The letter was sent on Monday from Berlin and arrived in Hamburg the very same/next day.

examples.ch: 一想到她的朋友们要住下我就心生恐惧。
examples.en: The very idea/thought of having her friends to stay fills me with dread.

defines.trans_en: used to describe or emphasize the furthest point of something

examples.ch: 他在那一大堆东西的最下面找到了自己丢了的那张纸。
examples.en: He found the piece of paper he had lost at the very bottom of the pile.

examples.ch: 我们排在队伍最后面，所以没有买到票。
examples.en: We were at the very end of the queue, so we didn't manage to get any tickets.

defines.trans_en: the number 20

examples.en: nineteen, twenty, twenty-one

examples.ch: 可容纳20个人的空间
examples.en: space for twenty people

defines.trans_en: the number 12

examples.ch: 餐厅十二点开门供应午餐。
examples.en: The cafeteria opens for lunch at twelve (o'clock).

examples.ch: 12座的小巴
examples.en: a twelve-seater minibus

defines.trans_en: the number 30

examples.en: twenty-nine, thirty, thirty-one

examples.ch: 她30（岁）的时候结婚了。
examples.en: She got married when she was thirty (years old).

defines.trans_en: the number 13

examples.ch: 一些人认为十三是个不吉利的数字。
examples.en: Some people think that thirteen is an unlucky number.

examples.ch: 有十二三个人在公共汽车站等车。
examples.en: There were twelve or thirteen people waiting at the bus stop.

defines.trans_en: the number 10

examples.ch: 她的父亲在十年前去世了。
examples.en: Her father died ten years ago.

examples.ch: 我们的小巴可以载10人。
examples.en: We can take ten (people) in the minibus.

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing, typically with long sleeves and made from wool, that is worn on the upper part of the body

examples.ch: 如果你觉得冷就穿件毛线衫吧。
examples.en: Put a sweater on if you're cold.

examples.ch: V字领针织衫
examples.en: a V-necked sweater

defines.trans_en: a large shop where you can buy many different types of goods

examples.ch: 百货商场
examples.en: a department store

examples.ch: DIY／家具商场
examples.en: a DIY/furniture store

defines.trans_en: any type of shop

examples.ch: 服装店／买酒的店铺
examples.en: a clothing/liquor store

examples.ch: 百货商店
examples.en: a department store

examples.ch: 家具商店
examples.en: a furniture store

examples.ch: 便利店
examples.en: a convenience store

defines.trans_en: an amount of something that is being kept for future use

examples.ch: 他的酒窖里储存了数量惊人的葡萄酒。
examples.en: He has an impressively large store of wine in his cellar.

examples.ch: 据报道，首都的食品储备量很低，形势危急。
examples.en: Food stores are reported to be running dangerously low in the capital.

examples.ch: 晚餐时，奶奶和外婆互相谈起自己关于过去的记忆。
examples.en: My grandmothers store of memories was shared over the dinner table.

defines.trans_en: a building in which things are kept until they are needed

examples.ch: 粮仓／武器库
examples.en: a grain/weapons store

defines.trans_en: to put or keep things in a special place for use in the future

examples.ch: 数据储存在一个硬盘上，并用光盘做了备份。
examples.en: The data is stored on a hard disk and backed up on a CD.

examples.ch: 我在西班牙居住期间，把我的东西放在我母亲那儿了。
examples.en: I stored my possessions in my mother's house while I was living in Spain.

examples.ch: 我把厚毛衣和外套收了起来，等到来年冬天再穿。
examples.en: I've stored my thick sweaters and jackets (away) until next winter.

examples.ch: 松鼠为过冬储藏坚果。
examples.en: Squirrels store (up) nuts for the winter.

defines.trans_en: feeling sadness, sympathy, or disappointment, especially because something unpleasant has happened or been done

examples.ch: 我为给她带来的所有麻烦而感到抱歉。
examples.en: I'm just sorry about all the trouble I've caused her.

examples.ch: 他确实惹恼了她，但他似乎一点儿也不感到愧疚。
examples.en: He'd really upset her and he didn't seem at all sorry.

examples.ch: 你的行程如此艰辛，我深表同情。
examples.en: I'm sorry (that) you had such a difficult journey.

examples.ch: 听说你又生病了，我们两个都很难过。
examples.en: We were both sorry to hear you've been ill again.

examples.ch: 我为孩子们感到十分难过——对他们而言肯定非常艰难。
examples.en: I feel so sorry for their kids - it must be really hard for them.

defines.trans_en: used to say that you wish you had not done what you have done, especially when you want to be polite to someone you have done something bad to

examples.ch: 哦，很抱歉——我在那儿没看见你。
examples.en: Oh, I'm sorry - I didn't see you there.

examples.ch: 汤姆，我对昨晚的事感到非常抱歉——都是我的错。
examples.en: Tom, I'm so sorry about last night - it was all my fault.

examples.ch: 我已经说对不起了。
examples.en: I've said I'm sorry.

phrases.trans_ch: （对自己的遭遇而感到）愤愤不平
phrases.trans_en: to feel sad because you have a problem and you feel that it is not fair that you are suffering so much

examples.ch: 他在电话里听上去一肚子怨气。
examples.en: He sounded very sorry for himself on the phone.

phrases.trans_en: used to show that something that must be said causes sadness or disappointment

examples.ch: 我很遗憾，项目的资金被取消了。
examples.en: I'm sorry to say that the project's funding has been cancelled.

examples.ch: 我很遗憾，参加这门健身课的大多数人确实在头两周内就放弃了。
examples.en: Most people who start the exercise class do, I'm sorry to say, give up within the first two weeks.

phrases.trans_ch: （婉转地表示拒绝或反对）对不起，抱歉
phrases.trans_en: used to show politeness when refusing something or disagreeing

examples.ch: 对不起，但我认为你犯了一个错误。
examples.en: I'm sorry, but I think you've made a mistake.

examples.ch: 很抱歉，我不能同意。
examples.en: I'm sorry, I can't agree.

phrases.trans_ch: 悲惨的景象／糟糕的状况／糟糕的事情（等等）
phrases.trans_en: a bad condition or situation

examples.ch: 他到家的时候，一副惨兮兮的样子——浑身湿透了，而且都是泥。
examples.en: He was a sorry sight when he got home - soaking and covered in mud.

examples.ch: 家里什么吃的都没有，真是够可怜的。
examples.en: It's a sorry situation when there isn't any food in the house.

defines.trans_en: used when apologizing for something

examples.ch: “你踩了我的脚。”“对不起！”
examples.en: "That's my foot you're stepping on." "Sorry!"

defines.trans_ch: （婉转地表示拒绝或反对）对不起，抱歉
defines.trans_en: used to show politeness when refusing something or disagreeing

examples.ch: 抱歉，你不能到那里面去。
examples.en: Sorry, you can't go in there.

defines.trans_ch: （表示礼貌地请对方重复或打断对方的话）你说什么，没听清楚
defines.trans_en: used when politely asking someone to repeat something or when politely interrupting someone

examples.ch: “他迟到了。”“你说什么？”“我说他迟到了。”
examples.en: "He's late." "Sorry?" "I said he's late."

examples.ch: 我没听清楚，你能否把最后一句话重复一下？
examples.en: Sorry, could you just say that last sentence again please?

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing made from soft material that covers your foot and the lower part of your leg

examples.ch: 一双短袜
examples.en: a pair of socks

examples.ch: 尼龙／羊毛／纯棉短袜
examples.en: nylon/woollen/cotton socks

examples.ch: 保暖袜
examples.en: thermal socks

examples.ch: 及脚踝／膝的袜子
examples.en: ankle/knee socks

examples.ch: 穿上你的鞋袜。
examples.en: Put on your shoes and socks.

examples.ch: 小男孩穿着两只不配对的袜子。
examples.en: The little boy was wearing odd socks (= socks of different colours).

defines.trans_en: a powerful hit

examples.ch: 下巴上挨的重重一拳
examples.en: a sock on the jaw

defines.trans_en: to hit someone with your fist (= closed hand)

examples.ch: 他冲着警察的下巴／眼睛就是一拳。
examples.en: He socked the policeman on the jaw/in the eye.

defines.trans_en: in baseball, to hit a ball very powerfully
little in size or amount when compared with what is typical or average

examples.ch: 小狗／房子／汽车／国
examples.en: a small dog/house/car/country

examples.ch: 我宁愿住在小城镇，也不住在大城市。
examples.en: I'd rather live in a small town than a big city.

examples.ch: 你的汉堡包要配大可乐还是小可乐？
examples.en: Would you like a large or small cola with your burger?

examples.ch: 埃拉是她班上个头最小的女孩。
examples.en: Ella is the smallest girl in her class.

examples.ch: 那件夹克你穿太小了。
examples.en: That jacket's too small for you.

examples.ch: 相对他的年龄来说，他个子小了些。
examples.en: He's small for his age.

examples.ch: 只有一小部分人申请成功了。
examples.en: Only a small number of applicants are successful.

examples.ch: 议会中女性的人数少得可怜。
examples.en: The number of women in parliament is pitifully (= extremely) small.

examples.ch: 利口酒通常都是小口小口地喝。
examples.en: Liqueurs are usually drunk in small quantities.

defines.trans_en: A small child is a very young child that is older than a baby.

examples.ch: 照看幼儿会很累人。
examples.en: Taking care of small children can be very tiring.

defines.trans_en: limited in the amount of an activity

examples.ch: 政府应该给予小企业主更多的帮助。
examples.en: The government should give more help to small businessmen (= people whose businesses are of a limited size).

examples.ch: 克里斯饭量很小，所以他不会要太多。
examples.en: Chris is a small eater so he won't want much.

examples.ch: 如果您能帮我们一个小忙，我们将不胜感激。
examples.en: If you can help us in a small way (= to a limited degree) it would be greatly appreciated.

defines.trans_ch: 不重要的；不会造成麻烦的
defines.trans_en: not very important or not likely to cause problems

examples.ch: 在考试中她只犯了一两个小错。
examples.en: She just made a couple of small mistakes in the test.

examples.ch: 我有件小事想和你商量一下。
examples.en: I have a small problem I would like to discuss with you.

defines.trans_en: ashamed or weak

examples.ch: 和她谈话让我感到自己很卑微。
examples.en: Talking to her makes me feel small.

examples.ch: 他总是想方设法让我在老板面前显得无足轻重。
examples.en: He's always trying to make me look small in front of my boss.

defines.trans_en: Small letters are not capital letters.

examples.ch: 诗人 e. e. cummings（卡明斯）用小写字母写自己的名字，而不用大写。
examples.en: The poet e. e. cummings wrote his name with small letters, not capital letters.

defines.trans_en: in a small size

examples.ch: 说明书的字印刷得很小，我几乎无法看清。
examples.en: The instructions are printed so small I can hardly read them.

phrases.trans_en: the middle of the lower back

examples.ch: 我后腰疼。
examples.en: I have a pain in the small of my back.

phrases.trans_en: underwear, especially when being washed or about to be washed

examples.ch: 你有没有要洗的内衣？
examples.en: Do you have any smalls that need washing?

defines.trans_en: a piece of clothing for women and girls that hangs from the waist and does not have legs

examples.ch: 她穿着一条牛仔半身裙和一件白衬衫。
examples.en: She wore a denim skirt and a white shirt.

examples.ch: 长／短裙
examples.en: a long/short skirt

defines.trans_en: an outer covering or part to protect particular machines
beef (= meat from a cow) that is cut from the bottom part of the side of the animal

examples.ch: 市场对像牛腩这种较便宜的牛肉的需求越来越大。
examples.en: There's an increasing market for the cheaper cuts of beef such as skirt.

examples.ch: 牛腩排半熟的最好吃。
examples.en: Skirt steak is best medium-rare.

defines.trans_ch: 位于…的边缘;环绕…的四周;沿…的边缘走
defines.trans_en: to go around the edge of something

examples.ch: 沿镇边的那条路走，不要走穿过镇子的那条路。
examples.en: Take the road which skirts (round) the town, not the one which goes through it.

defines.trans_ch: 避开，绕开（某话题或问题）
defines.trans_en: to avoid discussing a subject or problem, usually because there are difficulties that you do not want to deal with

examples.ch: 政府受到指责，称其避而不谈虐待疑犯的问题。
examples.en: The government has been accused of skirting round the issue of torture.

defines.trans_en: the number 16

examples.ch: 我们有16个人来吃午饭。
examples.en: We have got sixteen (people) coming for lunch.

examples.ch: 他16岁时辍学。
examples.en: He dropped out of school at sixteen (= when he was 16 years old).

defines.trans_ch: （常在热天或运动时穿的）短裤
defines.trans_en: trousers that end above the knee or reach the knee, often worn in hot weather or when playing a sport

examples.ch: 网球短裤
examples.en: tennis shorts

examples.ch: 她穿上短裤和T恤衫。
examples.en: She put on a pair of shorts and a T-shirt.

defines.trans_en: men's underpants
small in length, distance, or height

examples.ch: 短裙
examples.en: a short skirt

examples.ch: 她的头发比过去短多了。
examples.en: Her hair is much shorter than it used to be.

examples.ch: 去车站只需走很短一段路程。
examples.en: It's only a short walk to the station.

examples.ch: 我们家人都比较矮，可我弟弟却很高。
examples.en: I'm fairly short but my brother's very tall.

defines.trans_en: used to say that a name is used as a shorter form of another name

examples.ch: 她名叫乔，是约瑟芬的简称。
examples.en: Her name's Jo - it's short for Josephine.

examples.ch: 她名叫约瑟芬，或简称为乔。
examples.en: Her name's Josephine, or Jo for short.

defines.trans_en: being an amount of time that is less than average or usual

examples.ch: 短片／短暂的访问
examples.en: a short film/visit

examples.ch: 他在如此短的时间里长高了这么多。
examples.en: He's grown so much in such a short time.

examples.ch: 如果每小时我都休息一小会儿，我的工作效率会高很多。
examples.en: I work much better if I take a short break every hour or so.

defines.trans_en: Short books, letters, and other examples of writing do not contain many words and do not take much time to read.

examples.ch: 这是一本篇幅很短的书——你1个小时就能读完。
examples.en: It's a very short book - you'll read it in an hour.

defines.trans_en: saying little but showing slight impatience or anger in the few words that you say

examples.ch: 我很抱歉今天早上我在电话里对你有点不耐烦。
examples.en: I'm sorry if I was a bit short with you on the phone this morning.

phrases.trans_en: to not have enough of something

examples.ch: 空间／时间不足
examples.en: to be short of space/time

examples.ch: 我们的咖啡不多了——我最好去再买一些。
examples.en: We're short on coffee - I'd better get some more.

examples.ch: 账单是85英镑，但我们还缺15英镑。
examples.en: The bill comes to £85, but we're £15 short.

examples.ch: 我这星期钱有点儿不够用——能借我10美元吗？
examples.en: I'm a little short (= I do not have much money) this week - could you lend me ten dollars?

phrases.trans_ch: 喘不过气，上气不接下气
phrases.trans_en: unable to breathe very well, for example because you have been running or doing some type of energetic exercise

examples.ch: 她爬楼梯时总是上气不接下气。
examples.en: She's always short of breath when she climbs the stairs.

phrases.trans_en: to be few or not enough in number

examples.ch: 这间办公室里的可用的桌子不够。
examples.en: Free desks are in short supply in this office.

phrases.trans_en: to not have something, especially when it is something you need in order to live

examples.ch: 我父母并没有多少钱，但他们总是确保我们不会缺衣少食。
examples.en: My parents didn't have much money, but they made sure we didn't go short (of anything).

defines.trans_en: a drink of spirits (= type of strong alcohol) without water or any other liquid added

examples.ch: 她只喝纯烈性酒，从不喝葡萄酒或啤酒。
examples.en: She only drinks shorts, never wine or beer.

defines.trans_ch: （尤指正片播映之前播放的）电影短片
defines.trans_en: a short film, especially one made for showing before the main film at a cinema

informal for
short circuit

informal for
short-circuit (short circuit)

examples.ch: 水管工把洗衣机弄短路了。
examples.en: The plumber shorted the washing machine.

defines.trans_en: before the arranged or expected time or place

examples.ch: 我们想完整地介绍这些计划，但是主席提前打断了我们的发言，因为还有其他重要的事情需要讨论。
examples.en: We wanted to explain the plans fully, but the chairman stopped us short, as there were other important matters to discuss.

defines.trans_ch: （与以 -ed 结尾、由名词变化而来的形容词连用）短…的
defines.trans_en: used with adjectives ending in -ed formed from nouns to describe something with a short part

examples.ch: 短毛狗
examples.en: a short-haired dog (= a dog with short hair)

examples.ch: 短袖衬衫
examples.en: a short-sleeved shirt (= a shirt with short sleeves)

defines.trans_en: one of a pair of coverings for your feet, usually made of a strong material such as leather, with a thick leather or plastic sole (= base) and usually a heel

examples.ch: 平跟／高跟鞋
examples.en: flat/high-heeled shoes

examples.ch: 跑步／网球鞋
examples.en: running/tennis shoes

examples.ch: 他穿上／脱下他那双新鞋。
examples.en: He put on/took off his new pair of shoes.

examples.ch: 快点儿把鞋带系好。
examples.en: Hurry and do up/lace up your shoes.

examples.ch: 鞋店
examples.en: a shoe shop

defines.trans_en:
a 
horseshoe
If you shoe a horse, you nail a horseshoe (= a curved piece of metal) to one or each of its feet.
a piece of clothing worn, especially by men, on the upper part of the body, made of light cloth like cotton and usually having a collar and buttons at the front

examples.ch: 条纹／白衬衣
examples.en: a striped/white shirt

examples.ch: 短袖／长袖衬衫
examples.en: a short-/long-sleeved shirt

examples.ch: 你把什么东西洒在衬衫前襟上了。
examples.en: You've spilled something down your shirt front.

defines.trans_en: the number 17

examples.ch: 我快17岁了，所以可以做我想做的事了。
examples.en: I'm nearly seventeen so I should be able to do what I want.

examples.ch: 他们结婚已经17年了。
examples.en: They've been married for seventeen years.

defines.trans_en: to give something to someone else in return for money

examples.ch: 我把车以600美元的价钱卖给了他。
examples.en: I sold him my car/I sold my car to him for $600.

examples.ch: 我们每张票将卖50英镑。
examples.en: We'll be selling the tickets at/for £50 each.

examples.ch: 这个摊位卖饮料和小吃。
examples.en: The stall sells drinks and snacks.

defines.trans_ch: 被以（…方式／数量／价格）购买
defines.trans_en: to be bought in the way or quantities that are mentioned; to be sold at the price mentioned

examples.ch: 这些篮子卖得很好。
examples.en: These baskets sell well (= a lot of them are bought).

examples.ch: 他们的最新唱片卖出了超过10万张。
examples.en: Their last album sold over a hundred thousand copies.

examples.ch: 这部电话卖多少钱？
examples.en: How much does the phone sell for?

defines.trans_en: to persuade someone that an idea or plan is a good one and likely to be successful

examples.ch: 我的上司很守旧，我要费好大的劲才能使他相信偶尔在家里工作是个不错的主意。
examples.en: My boss is very old-fashioned and I'm having a lot of trouble selling the idea of working at home occasionally.

examples.ch: 这位电影人士说服了我，让我相信我的小说可以搬上银幕。
examples.en: The filmmakers sold me on the idea that my book would work on the screen.

examples.ch: 有机会更进一步打入欧洲市场将能说服总统接受这个计划。
examples.en: The chance of greater access to European markets would help sell the president the plan/sell the plan to the president.

examples.ch: 在面试时，你必须想办法打动雇主。
examples.en: In an interview, you have to sell yourself to the employer.

defines.trans_en: to be conscious of what is around you by using your eyes

examples.ch: 打开灯，这样我才能看见。
examples.en: Turn the light on so I can see.

examples.ch: “我能看到你！”
examples.en: I can see you!

examples.ch: 老师可以看出，孩子们打过架。
examples.en: The teacher could see (that) the children had been fighting.

examples.ch: 雅基看见那辆汽车开到了警察局门口。
examples.en: Jacqui saw the car drive up outside the police station.

examples.ch: 从窗口看去，我们可以看见孩子们在院子里玩耍。
examples.en: From the window we could see the children playing in the yard.

examples.ch: 他父母观看了他被授予获胜者奖牌。
examples.en: His parents saw him awarded the winner's medal.

examples.ch: 票价与航班的具体情况请见第23页。
examples.en: See (= look at) p. 23 for prices and flight details.

examples.ch: 更多信息见下一页。
examples.en: See over (= look at the next page) for further information.

defines.trans_ch: 看，观看（电影、电视节目等）
defines.trans_en: to watch a film, television programme, etc.

examples.ch: 你昨天晚上看4频道的纪录片了吗？
examples.en: Did you see that documentary on Channel 4 last night?

defines.trans_ch: 是…的发生时间（或地点）;见证
defines.trans_en: to be the time or place when something happens

examples.ch: 由于有了新水库，今年夏天该地区取消了用水限制。
examples.en: This summer has seen the end of water restrictions in the area thanks to a new reservoir.

defines.trans_en: to understand, know, or realize

examples.ch: 我知道下个月俱乐部将组织去看一次戏。
examples.en: I see (that) the club is organizing a theatre trip next month.

examples.ch: 他认为星期五不来星期四来也没什么。
examples.en: He can't see what difference it makes to come (= he doesn't think it is important if he comes) on Thursday instead of Friday.

examples.ch: 他们认为没有必要用书面形式通知其成员相关变化。
examples.en: They didn't see the need/any need (= understand that it was important) to notify their members of the changes in writing.

examples.ch: 他们拒绝帮忙的理由就是太忙，但他似乎觉得其中另有隐情。
examples.en: They refused to help because they're too busy, but he seems to see more in it than that.

examples.ch: “我累了。”“我知道——你整个下午都打哈欠”
examples.en: "I'm tired." "So I see - you've been yawning all afternoon."

examples.ch: 我很惊讶他们无法理解我的观点。
examples.en: I was surprised that they couldn't see my point of view.

examples.ch: 政府不想让人觉得他们在向恐怖分子妥协。
examples.en: The government didn't want to be seen to be making concessions to terrorists.

examples.ch: 她读完他的书之后，开始以另一种／不同的／新的角度看待这个问题。
examples.en: After she read his book she started to see the issue in another/a different/a new light (= differently).

defines.trans_en: to meet or visit someone, or to visit a place

examples.ch: 我们周末要去探望朋友。
examples.en: We're seeing friends this weekend.

examples.ch: 近几个星期我没有看到杰里。
examples.en: I haven't seen Jerry around (= in the places I usually meet him) in the last few weeks.

examples.ch: 自从达里尔结婚以后，大家都没怎么看见他了。
examples.en: No one has seen much of Daryl since he got married.

examples.ch: 他们经常见面。
examples.en: They see a lot of each other (= are often together).

examples.ch: 我妈妈下周又要去看病。
examples.en: My mother is seeing the doctor again next week.

examples.ch: 孩子们想看马戏。
examples.en: The children wanted to see the circus.

examples.ch: 经纪人说他们下午3点可以看房子。
examples.en: The agent said they could see the house (UK also see round the house) at 3 p.m.

defines.trans_en: to have a romantic relationship with someone

examples.ch: 她和他交往有多久了？
examples.en: How long has she been seeing him?

defines.trans_en: to consider or think about, especially to think about someone or something in a particular way, or to imagine someone doing a particular activity

examples.ch: 她不认为自己很勇敢。
examples.en: She didn't see herself as brave.

examples.ch: 这份礼物很容易被当成是一种贿赂。
examples.en: It was easy to see the gift as a kind of bribe.

examples.ch: 我认为在目前情况下她不会接受那份工作。
examples.en: I can't see her accepting (= I don't think she will accept) the job in the present circumstances.

examples.ch: 在我看来，我们得找更多的人帮忙。
examples.en: As I see it/things/the situation, we'll have to get extra help.

examples.ch: 设想一下我的处境——如果你离开，我就孤立无援了。
examples.en: Try and see it my way - I'll be left without any help if you go.

defines.trans_en: to take someone somewhere by going there with them

examples.ch: 他把客人送到门口。
examples.en: He saw his visitors to the door.

examples.ch: 她的朋友们送她回了家。
examples.en: Her friends saw her home.

examples.ch: 保安人员将抗议者赶了出去。
examples.en: The security guard saw the protesters off the premises.

defines.trans_en: to try to discover

examples.ch: 你看能否找一个人帮忙？
examples.en: Will you see if you can get anyone to help?

examples.ch: 我看看我可以做点什么。
examples.en: I'll see what I can do.

defines.trans_en: to make certain that something happens

examples.ch: 接待员说他一定会传话给她。
examples.en: The receptionist said he'd see (that) she got the message.

examples.ch: 你要确保5点前做好准备，否则就会有麻烦。
examples.en: See (that) you're ready by five, or there'll be trouble.

phrases.trans_en: said to mean that more surprising or exciting things are likely to happen

defines.trans_en: a place where there is a cathedral and where a bishop or archbishop has authority

examples.ch: 约克/艾克斯特/林肯主教教区
examples.en: the See of York/Exeter/Lincoln

examples.ch: 主教和他们的教区
examples.en: bishops and their sees

defines.trans_en: an act of exchanging something for money

examples.ch: 禁止出售香烟／酒。
examples.en: The sale of cigarettes/alcohol is forbidden.

examples.ch: 建筑公司每卖一套房子都能获得佣金。
examples.en: The building company gets commission on each house sale.

examples.ch: 我一上午什么都没卖出去。
examples.en: I haven't made a sale all morning.

examples.ch: 他们将下调价格而不是失去这单生意。
examples.en: They'll drop the price rather than lose the sale.

defines.trans_ch: （为筹集资金而进行的）销售活动，义卖活动
defines.trans_en: an occasion when things are sold in order to make money

examples.ch: 慈善／圣诞节／图书售卖
examples.en: a charity/Christmas/book sale

examples.ch: 车库／后院旧货售卖
examples.en: a garage/yard sale

defines.trans_en: an auction (= public sale)

examples.ch: 古董家具拍卖
examples.en: a sale of antique furniture

examples.ch: 牛畜拍卖
examples.en: a cattle sale

defines.trans_en: an occasion when goods are sold at a lower price than usual

examples.ch: 季中／季末大减价
examples.en: a mid-season/end-of-season sale

examples.ch: 清仓／歇业大甩卖
examples.en: a clearance/closing-down sale

examples.ch: 这是我在一月大减价时买的。
examples.en: I bought this in the January sales.

examples.ch: 降价商品／促销价
examples.en: sale goods/prices

phrases.trans_en: available to buy

examples.ch: 这幅画出售吗？
examples.en: Is this painting for sale?

examples.ch: 我们的邻居上周开始登广告出售他们的房子。
examples.en: Our neighbours put their house up for sale (= started to advertise that they want to sell it) last week.

phrases.trans_en: the department of a company that organizes and does the selling of the company's products or services

examples.ch: 他在销售部门工作。
examples.en: He works in Sales.

examples.ch: 销售部／销售部经理
examples.en: the sales department/manager

phrases.trans_en: the number of products sold

examples.ch: 今年的销售量超过了前两年销售量的总和。
examples.en: Sales this year exceeded the total for the two previous years.

phrases.trans_en: available to buy in a shop

examples.ch: 音像店目前有售。
examples.en: On sale at record stores now.

phrases.trans_en: a system by which goods are supplied to shopsand can be returned if they are not sold within a particular period of time

examples.ch: 我们可以按剩货包退的条件供货。
examples.en: We can supply goods on a sale or return basis.

phrases.trans_en: reduced in price

examples.ch: 你能告诉我这条裙子是否降价吗？
examples.en: Can you tell me if this dress is in the sale?

defines.trans_en: of the colour of fresh blood

examples.ch: 红色唇膏
examples.en: red lipstick

examples.ch: 这件连衣裙是鲜红色的。
examples.en: The dress was bright red.

defines.trans_en: used to describe hair that is an orange-brown colour

defines.trans_ch: （眼睛）布满血丝的，红肿的，充血的
defines.trans_en: If your eyes are red, the white part of your eyes and the skin around your eyes is red, because of crying, tiredness, too much alcohol, etc.

phrases.trans_ch: （因为愤怒或窘迫）脸涨得通红的
phrases.trans_en: If you go/turn red, your face becomes red because you are angry or embarrassed.

examples.ch: 瞧，你让他很尴尬——他的脸都红了！
examples.en: Look, you've embarrassed him - he's gone bright red!

defines.trans_en: the colour of fresh blood

examples.ch: 她的画作中大量使用红色和粉红色。
examples.en: She uses a lot of reds and pinks in her paintings.

examples.ch: 我一向是穿红色衣服居多。
examples.en: I've always worn a lot of red.

examples.ch: 她穿了一身红。
examples.en: She was dressed all in red.

defines.trans_ch: 社会主义者；共产主义者；赤色分子
defines.trans_en: a person who has socialist or communist political opinions
A winding path, road, river, etc. repeatedly turns in different directions.

examples.ch: 有一条非常长的蜿蜒小路通向房子。
examples.en: There's a very long, winding path leading up to the house.

examples.ch: 他们费力地爬上狭窄蜿蜒的楼梯。
examples.en: They struggled up the narrow winding stairs.

defines.trans_ch: 易受伤的；易受影响（或攻击）的；脆弱的
defines.trans_en: able to be easily physically, emotionally, or mentally hurt, influenced, or attacked

examples.ch: 一丝不挂地站在那儿，我感觉自己不堪一击。
examples.en: I felt very vulnerable, standing there without any clothes on.

examples.ch: 政府最易受人诟病的是经济政策。
examples.en: It is on economic policy that the government is most vulnerable.

examples.ch: 游客更容易受到攻击，因为他们不知道城里哪些地方不该去。
examples.en: Tourists are more vulnerable to attack, because they do not know which areas of the city to avoid.

defines.trans_en: to pull a plant including its roots out of the ground

examples.ch: 数百棵大树在风暴中被连根拔起。
examples.en: Hundreds of mature trees were uprooted in the storm.

defines.trans_ch: 使离开家园（或熟悉的环境）;使迁移他处
defines.trans_en: to remove a person from their home or usual environment

examples.ch: 战争使这个国家近三分之二的人口背井离乡。
examples.en: The war has uprooted nearly two thirds of the country's population.

defines.trans_ch: 正在进行的；正在发生的
defines.trans_en: If something is underway, it is happening now.

examples.ch: 经济已开始复苏了。
examples.en: Economic recovery is already underway.

phrases.trans_en: to begin

examples.ch: 电影节于7月11日开幕。
examples.en: The film festival gets underway on 11 July .

defines.trans_en: relating to the earth
(of a planet) similar to Earth

examples.ch: 对类似地球星球的搜寻
examples.en: the search for terrestrial planets

defines.trans_en: (of animals) living on the land rather than in the water or air

defines.trans_ch: （电视频道）陆地上的，地面上的（与卫星相对而言）
defines.trans_en: Terrestrial television channels are broadcast from stations on the ground and do not use satellites.
a country in Western Asia
a brand name for computer software that allows a group of two or more people to see and talk to each other over the internet using their computers, tablets, or smartphones

examples.ch: 在冠状病毒疫情期间，我们这些在家工作的人很快就对Zoom视频会议熟悉了许多。
examples.en: Those of us working from home during the coronavirus pandemic soon became a lot more familiar with Zoom.

examples.ch: 关于如何使用Zoom以及如何发起Zoom会议，请阅读我们的指南。
examples.en: Read our guide on how to use Zoom and how to set up a Zoom meeting.

defines.trans_en: to move very quickly

examples.ch: 他们钻进汽车一溜烟地开走了。
examples.en: They got into the car and zoomed off.

examples.ch: 到了比赛的最后几米，她突然冲到了前面。
examples.en: In the last few metres of the race, she suddenly zoomed ahead.

defines.trans_en: If prices or sales zoom, they increase suddenly and quickly.

examples.ch: 去年房价突然飙升。
examples.en: House prices suddenly zoomed up last year.

defines.trans_ch: 可变焦距镜头（同 zoom lens）
defines.trans_en:
a 
zoom lens
a brand name for computer software that allows a group of two or more people to see and talk to each other over the internet using their computers, tablets, or smartphones

examples.ch: 在冠状病毒疫情期间，我们这些在家工作的人很快就对Zoom视频会议熟悉了许多。

examples.en: Read our guide on how to use Zoom and how to set up a Zoom meeting.

examples.en: They got into the car and zoomed off.

examples.ch: 到了比赛的最后几米，她突然冲到了前面。

defines.trans_ch: 可变焦距镜头（同 zoom lens）
defines.trans_en:
a 
zoom lens
the scientific study of animals, especially their structure
a person who scientifically studies animals
relating to the scientific study of animals, especially their structure

examples.ch: 他们像研究动物学标本一样研究他。
examples.en: They studied him like a zoological specimen.

examples.ch: 动物学研究/分类
examples.en: zoological research/classification

defines.trans_en: an area in which animals, especially wild animals, are kept so that people can go and look at them or study them
a place where there are a lot of people and their behaviour is not well organized or controlled

examples.ch: 学校的餐厅简直一片混乱。
examples.en: The school cafeteria is a zoo.

defines.trans_en: having lived or existed for only a short time and not old

examples.ch: 年轻人／幼儿
examples.en: young adults/children

examples.ch: 他的女朋友非常年轻。
examples.en: His girlfriend's very young.

examples.ch: 森林中的这一片树木还没长大。
examples.en: The trees in this part of the forest are still fairly young.

examples.ch: 菲莉帕是家里最小的。
examples.en: Philippa is the youngest person in the family.

examples.ch: 安杰拉比克莱尔小两岁。
examples.en: Angela is two years younger than Clare.

defines.trans_en: suitable for young people

examples.ch: 年轻人的时尚／观念
examples.en: young fashion/ideas

examples.ch: 说实话——你觉不觉得这件衣服对我来说有点／太年轻了？
examples.en: Be honest now - do you think this dress is a bit/too young for me (= is more suitable for someone younger)?

phrases.trans_en: to look younger than you really are

defines.trans_en: the babies of an animal

examples.ch: 其间，母鸟会飞回巢中给雏鸟喂食。
examples.en: Meanwhile, the mother flies back to the nest to feed her young.

phrases.trans_en: young people considered together as a group

examples.ch: 我并不反对穿超短裙，但我认为它们只适合年轻人。
examples.en: I have nothing against miniskirts, but I think they're strictly for the young.

defines.trans_en: a city in northern England

examples.ch: 距酒店四十五分钟路程的美丽的约克城有著名的大教堂和很受欢迎的约维克（维京）中心。
examples.en: The beautiful city of York, forty-five minutes from the hotel, has a famous Minster and the popular Jorvik (Viking) Centre.

examples.ch: 水灾预警在约克和北约克郡的其它地区就位。
examples.en: Flood alerts are in place for York and for other areas of North Yorkshire.

defines.trans_en: the season between autumn and spring, lasting from November to March north of the equator and from May to September south of the equator, when the weather is coldest

examples.ch: 我想你在冬天可能会吃得更多。
examples.en: I think you tend to eat more in (the) winter.

examples.ch: 去年冬天我们去滑雪了。
examples.en: Last winter we went skiing.

examples.ch: 今年冬天暖和得出奇。
examples.en: It's been a surprisingly mild winter.

examples.ch: 一个冬日
examples.en: a winter/winter's day

examples.ch: 冬季的天气／雪
examples.en: winter weather/snow

defines.trans_en: (especially of a bird) to spend the winter in a particular place

examples.ch: 鸟类定期迁徙，这样它们就可以在更暖和的地方过冬。
examples.en: Birds migrate so that they can winter in a warmer country.

examples.ch: 许多老人从北方各州到佛罗里达或亚利桑那过冬。
examples.en: A lot of older people from northern states winter in Florida or Arizona.

defines.trans_en:
another spelling of 
willy

phrases.trans_ch: （尤指由奇事或威胁导致的）紧张不安，心惊胆战
phrases.trans_en: a feeling of nervousness and fear, especially caused by something strange or threatening

examples.ch: 独自一人在这所房子里过夜总是让我心惊胆战的。
examples.en: Spending a night in the house alone always gives me the willies.

examples.ch: 看到阴影里有什么东西，我突然紧张起来，撒腿就跑。
examples.en: Seeing something in the shadows, I suddenly got the willies and ran.

defines.trans_en: a stupid person

examples.ch: 如果穿这条短裤，我看起来会像个十足的笨蛋！
examples.en: I'll look a right wally in these shorts!
